translated: So it is said. And that is rightly said, for in the case of the arising of eye-consciousness, the eye and visible data are stated in their own forms among the four conditions for it. The other two conditions are included by the word “and,” namely, adverting and the associated aggregates.

original: ettha bhavaṅgacittena saha āvajjanaṃ gahetvā casaddena sampayuttakkhandhā gahitā.
analyzed: ettha bhavaṅga cittena saha āvajjanam gahetvā ca saddena sampayutta kkhandhā gahitā
translated: And so too in the case of ear-consciousness, and so on. But in the case of mind-consciousness, the word “and” includes the associated aggregates, taking adverting together with the life-continuum in the case of the phrase “mind and mental data.”

original: Evañhi sati cattā ropaccayā hontīti. Vuttañhetaṃ dhātuvibhaṅgaṭṭhakathāyaṃ paṭiccāti🔽nāma āgataṭṭhāne āvajjanaṃ visuṃ nakātabbaṃ. Bhavaṅganissitakameva kātabbanti. Tasmā
analyzed: evam hi sati cattāro ro paccayāḥ honti iti vuttam ha etam dhātu vibhaṅga ṭṭhakathā ayam paṭicca ati  nāma āgata ṭṭhāne āvajjanam visum na kātabbam bhavaṅga nissitakam eva kātabbanti tasmā
translated: For thus there are four conditions. This is said in the Commentary on the Elements: “‘With the support of’ is said in the place where ‘mind’ is stated. Adverting should not be taken separately. It should be taken as dependent on the life-continuum.🔽Therefore ‘mind’ here is the life-continuum together with adverting. ‘Consciousness’ is the impulsion-consciousness.

original: idha manoti sahāvajjanakaṃ bhavaṅgaṃ. Mano viññāṇanti javanamanoviññāṇanti. Etthaca
analyzed: idha manoti bhavaṅgam manaḥ viññāṇanti javana manaḥ viññāṇanti ettha ca
translated: And here

original: paṭiccātināma āgataṭṭhāneti etena aññattha pana āvajjanaṃ dvārapakkhikaṃ nakātabbanti🔽siddhaṃ hoti. Paṭiccāti āgatattāyevaca bhavaṅgaṃpi āvajjanā nantaraṃ bhavaṅgadvayameva
analyzed: paṭicca atināma āgata ṭṭhāne iti etena aññattha pana āvajjanam dvāra pakkhikam  siddham hoti paṭicca ati āgata ttāya iva ca āvajjanā anantaram bhavaṅga dvayam eva
translated: “Having approached” is the place of arrival. By this it is established that the adverting elsewhere is not door-appropriate.🔽And because of the arrival, the life-continuum is to be taken in this text as the two life-continua after the adverting.

original: imissaṃ pāḷiyaṃ gahetabbaṃ. Sannihitapaccayānaṃ eva tattha adhippetattāti. Idha pana
analyzed: imissam pāḷiyam gahetabbam sannihita paccayānam eva tattha adhippetattā ti idha pana
translated: For only the proximate conditions are intended there. But here

original: dvārabhāvā rahassa sabbassa upapattidhammassa pariggahitattā sabbaṃ bhavaṅgaṃ adhippetaṃ.
analyzed: dvāra bhāvāḥ rahassa sabbassa upapatti dhammassa pariggahita ttā sabbam bhavaṅgam adhippetaṃ
translated: all the life-continuum is intended because of the inclusion of all the states that are appropriate to the door.

original: Na hi kiñci bhavaṅgaṃ nāma atthi. Yaṃ manodvārabhāvārahaṃ na siyāti niṭṭhamettha
analyzed: na hi kiñci bhavaṅgam nāma atthi yam manaḥ dvāra bhāva araham na siyāti niṭṭham ettha
translated: For there is no life-continuum called that which is not appropriate to be the eye-door.🔽So it should be concluded here that

original: gantabbanti. Tatthāti niddhāraṇe bhummaṃ, tesu chasu dvāresu cakkhu dvāreti sambandho.🔽Yathārahanti ārammaṇabhūmipuggalamanasikārā dīnaṃ anurūpavasena. Sabbathāpīti visuṃ
analyzed: gantabbanti tattha ati niddhāraṇe bhummam tesu chasu dvāresu cakkhu dvāra iti sambandho  yathārahanti ārammaṇa bhūmi puggala manasikārāḥ dīnam anurūpa vasena sabbathā api iti visum
translated: “there” is a locative particle. The construction is: “among those six doors, the eye door.”

original: visuṃ chacattālīsa bhedasaṅkhātena sabbapakārenapi agahita gahaṇa vasena, catupaññā
analyzed: visum chacattālīsa bheda saṅkhātena sabba pakārena api agahita gahaṇa vasena catupaññā
translated: “As appropriate” is according to the object, the plane, the person, and the attention. “In every way” is by way of the inclusion of what is not included by means of the forty-six kinds.

original: sāti sambandho. Sabbathāpītivā āvajjanādi tadārammaṇa pariyo sānavasena anekakiccabhedayuttena🔽sabbapakārenapi, kāmāvacarānevāti sambandho. Yāni āvajjanādīni kiccāni dvāravikāraṃ
analyzed: sā ati sambandho sabbathā api iti vā āvajjana ādi tad ārammaṇa aneka kicca bheda yuttena  sabba pakārena api kāmāvacarān eva ati sambandhaḥ yāni āvajjana ādīni kiccāni dvāra vikāram
translated: This is the connection.🔽With all, etc.

original: paṭicca pavattanti, taṃ kiccavantānieva dvāre niyuttānīti atthena dvārikānināma honti.
analyzed: paṭicca pavattanti tam kiccavantāni eva dvāre niyuttāni iti atthena honti
translated: The functions of adverting, etc., which occur dependent on the door-process, are called “door-linked” in the sense that they are bound to the doors because they have a door.

original: Paṭisandhi bhavaṅga cuti kiccānipana dvāravikārena vinā kevalaṃ kammavaseneva sijjhanti.
analyzed: dvāra vikārena vinā kevalam kamma vasena iva sijjhanti
translated: The functions of rebirth-linking, life-continuum, and death are successful only by kamma, without any door-process.

original: Tasmā taṃkiccavantāni dvārikānināma nahontīti vuttaṃ ekūna.La. Dvāravimuttānīti ettha🔽ca dvāravikāronāma attani ārammaṇānaṃ āpātāgamanavasena bhavaṅgassa calanaṃ, cakkhādīnañca
analyzed: tasmā dvāra vimuttāni iti ettha  ca dvāra vikāraḥ nāma ārammaṇānaṃ āpāta āgamana vasena bhavaṅgassa calanam cakkha ādīnam ca
translated: Therefore they are called “not door-linked,” which is said to be “nine.”

original: attani viññāṇuppādana sattivisesa yogo daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: attani viññāṇa uppādana satti visesa yogo daṭṭhabbo
translated: Herein, the so-called door-process is the disturbance of the life-continuum and the disturbance of the eye, etc., which occur by the arrival of objects in their own respective fields.

original: [100] Vibhāvaniyaṃ pana
analyzed: vibhāvaniyam pana
translated: But in the Vibhaṅga it is said:

original: “Cakkhādidvāresu apavattanato manodvārasaṅkhāta bhavaṅgato ārammaṇantaragahaṇavasena apavattitoca dvāravimuttānī”ti vuttaṃ, taṃ aṭṭhakathāyapi saha nasameti.
analyzed: cakkha ādi dvāresu apavattanataḥ manaḥ dvāra saṅkhāta bhavaṅgataḥ ārammaṇa antara gahaṇa vasena apavattitaḥ ca dvāra vimuttāni iti vuttam tam aṭṭhakathāya api saha
translated: “Because they do not occur in the eye-door, etc., and because they occur in the life-continuum called the mind-door, and because they occur by apprehending an object other than that , they are called ‘freed from the doors’ ”—this is said in the commentary too.

original: Paṭisandhi bhavaṅga cuti vasenāti hi vuttaṃ. Etena hi kiccasīseneva cittānaṃ dvārika🔽dvāravimuttabhāgo therena dassito. Teneva hi heṭṭhāpi pañcadvārāvajjana.La. Tadārammaṇavasenātiādinā
analyzed: paṭisandhi bhavaṅga cuti vasena ati hi vuttam etena hi kicca sīsena iva cittānam  dvāra vimutta bhāgaḥ therena dassito tena iva hi heṭṭhā api tad ārammaṇa vasena ati ādinā
translated: For it is said, “by way of rebirth-linking, life-continuum, and death.” And it is by this very function that the Elder saw the mind as “freed from the doors.”🔽For it is by this very function that the mind is called “eye-door-freed,” etc., in the passage: “The adverting is eye-door-freed; the impulsions are eye-door-freed; the registration is eye-door-freed” , and so on.

original: kiccasīseneva cittānaṃ cakkhudvārikādibhāvo vuttoti. Nanu cakkhādidvāresu apavattanatoti🔽iminā etadatthova vuttoti ce. Na. Adhippetatthavirahassa apasaṅga nivattakassaca
analyzed: kicca sīsena iva cittānam cakkhu dvārikā ādi bhāvaḥ vuttaḥ ti nanu cakkha ādi dvāresu apavattanato  iminā etad atthaḥ uva vuttaḥ ti ce na adhippeta ttha virahassa apasaṅga nivattakassa ca
translated: The meaning of the words “because they do not occur in the eye-door, etc.” is the same as that of the words “because they do not occur in the eye-door, etc.”

original: saṃvaṇṇanā vākyassa payojanābhāvatoti. Chadvārikāniceva santīraṇa tadārammaṇakiccānaṃ
analyzed: saṃvaṇṇanā vākyassa payojana abhāvato ti
translated: But the latter are stated in order to exclude the possibility of the former being misinterpreted as meaning that the mind is freed from the doors because it does not occur in the eye-door, etc., and in order to show the purpose of the statement.

original: vasena dvāravimuttānica paṭisandhādikiccānaṃ vasenāti adhippāyo. Pañcadvārikānica
analyzed: vasena dvāra vimuttāni ca paṭisandhā ādi kiccānam vasena ati adhippāyo pañcadvārikāni ca
translated: The intention is that the mind is “freed from the doors” by way of the functions of determining and registration, and it is “freed from the doors” by way of the functions of rebirth-linking, etc.

original: chadvārikānica pañcachadvārikāni. Kadāci chadvārikāniceva tāni kadāci dvāravimuttānicāti
analyzed: chadvārikāni ca pañca chadvārikāni kadāci chadvārikāni ca iva tāni kadāci dvāra vimuttāni ca ati
translated: and the six-door-freed are the five-door-freed. Sometimes they are six-door-freed and sometimes they are door-freed.

original: chadvārikavimuttāni. Dvārasaddo cetthaadhikāravasena yojīyati.
analyzed: cha dvārika vimuttāni dvāra saddo ca itthā adhikāra vasena
translated: So they are six-door-freed. And the word “door” is to be construed here in the sense of “sphere” .

original: [101] Vibhāvaniyaṃ pana
analyzed: vibhāvaniyam pana
translated: But in the Vibhaṅga

original: “Chadvārikānica chadvārikavimuttānicā”tipi vuttaṃ. Taṃ na sundaraṃ.
analyzed: vuttam tam na sundaram
translated: it is said: “The six-door-freed are also the six-door-freed” . That is not good.🔽Because it is not so stated in the passage on the “dust-heap” below .

original: Heṭṭhā cuṇṇiyavākye tathā asutattāti. Ekadvārikacittāni. La. Sabbathā dvāravimuttānica yathākkamaṃ chattiṃsati.La. Navadhā ceti pañcadhā paridīpayeti yojanā.
analyzed: heṭṭhā cuṇṇiya vākye tathā ekadvārika cittāni sabbathā dvāra vimuttāni ca yathākkamam navadhā ca iti pañcadhā paridīpaya iti yojanā
translated: The mind-door-freed are the thirty-six in the order stated.

original: 134. Rūpādīnaṃ ārammaṇānaṃ bhedena cittacetasikānaṃ saṅgaho ārammaṇasaṅgaho.
analyzed: rūpa ādīnam ārammaṇānam bhedena citta cetasikānam saṅgahaḥ ārammaṇa saṅgahaḥ
translated: The inclusion of consciousness and its concomitants by way of the division of objects such as visible forms, etc., is inclusion by object.

original: [102] Ṭīkāsu pana
analyzed: ṭīkāsu pana
translated: But in the commentaries

original: “Ārammaṇānaṃ sarūpato vibhāgato taṃvisayacittato ca saṅgaho ārammaṇasaṅgaho”ti vuttaṃ. Taṃ na sundaraṃ.
analyzed: ārammaṇānam sarūpataḥ vibhāgataḥ ca saṅgahaḥ ārammaṇa saṅgahaḥ ti vuttam tat na sundaram
translated: it is said: “Inclusion by object is the inclusion of objects by way of their individual essences, by way of their division, and by way of the consciousness that has them as its respective domain” . That is not good.

original: Ayañhi cittacetasikānaṃ eva saṅgaho. Na ārammaṇānanti. Rūpādīnaṃ vacanattho upari
analyzed: ayam hi citta cetasikānam eva saṅgahaḥ na ārammaṇānam ti rūpa ādīnam vacana tthaḥ upari
translated: For this is the inclusion of consciousness and its concomitants, not of objects. The meaning of the words “visible-form object,” etc., is given above .

original: āgamissati. Dubbalapurisena daṇḍādiviya cittacetasikehi ālambīyati amuñcamānehi gaṇhīyatīti
analyzed: āgamissati dubbala purisena citta cetasikehi amuñcamānehi gaṇhīyati iti
translated: It is clung to by the mind and mental factors that do not let go of it, as a weak man is clung to by a snake.

original: ālambaṇaṃ. Ārammaṇasadde pana sati cittacetasikāni āgantvā ettha ramantīti ārammaṇaṃ.
analyzed: ālambaṇam ārammaṇa sadde pana sati citta cetasikāni āgantvā ettha ramanti iti ārammaṇam
translated: It is an object in the sense of being clung to. But in the case of the word object, the mind and mental factors are said to delight in it, thus it is an object in the sense of delighting in .

original: [103] Yaṃpana vibhāvaniyaṃ
analyzed: yaṃpana vibhāvaniyam
translated: But in the exposition it is said:🔽“It is clung to by the mind and mental factors, as a weak man is clung to by a snake. And they delight in it, thus it is an object.”

original: “Dubbalapurisena daṇḍādiviya cittacetasikehi ālambīyati. Tānivā āgantvā ettha ramantīti ālambaṇa”nti vuttaṃ. Taṃ na sundaraṃ.
analyzed: dubbala purisena citta cetasikehi ālambīyati āgantvā ettha ramanti iti ālambaṇam ti vuttam tat na sundaram
translated: That is not good.🔽For these terms are established separately.

original: Visuṃ siddhāni hi etāni padānīti. Rūpamevāti vaṇṇāyatanameva. Pañcārammaṇavimuttaṃ
analyzed: visum siddhāni hi etāni padāni iti rūpam eva ati vaṇṇa āyatanam eva pañca ārammaṇa vimuttam
translated: “Matter only” is the visible-data base.

original: yaṃkiñci dhammajātaṃ vijjamānaṃpiavijjamānaṃpi bhūtaṃpi abhūtaṃpi dhammārammaṇameva.🔽Taṃ pana sabhāga koṭṭhāsato saṅgayhamānaṃ chabbidhaṃ hotīti vuttaṃ dhammārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: yat kiñci dhamma jātam vijjamānam pi a vijjamānam pi bhūtam pi abhūtam pi dhamma ārammaṇam eva  tam pana sabhāga koṭṭhāsato saṅgayhamānam chabbidham hoti iti vuttam dhamma ārammaṇam
translated: “Free from the five objects” is any kind of state, whether existent or non-existent, real or unreal, that has only mental data as object.🔽But it is said to be of six kinds when classed according to the homogeneous division.🔽“But mental data as object is classed As six in the sixfold way” .

original: pana.La. Chadhā saṅgayhatīti. Tatthāti tesu rūpādīsu chasu. Cakkhudvāre ghaṭṭayamāna
analyzed: chadhā chadhā tattha ati tesu rūpa ādīsu chasu cakkhu dvāre ghaṭṭayamāna
translated: Herein, in the case of the six beginning with visible data that impinge on the eye door,

original: rūpānusāreneva uppannāni cakkhudvārikacittāni aññāni ārammaṇāni ālambituṃ nalabhanti.
analyzed: rūpa anusārena iva uppannāni cakkhu dvārika cittāni aññāni ārammaṇāni ālambitum na labhanti
translated: The eye-door cognizances arisen by following after visible forms are unable to take other objects.🔽And visible forms devoid of impingement, past and future, are unable to be objects.

original: Rūpānipi ghaṭṭanarahitāni atītānāgatāni ālambituṃ nalabhantīti vuttaṃ cakkhudvārikacittānaṃ
analyzed: rūpāni api ghaṭṭana rahitāni atīta anāgatāni ālambitum na labhanti iti vuttam cakkhu dvārika cittānam
translated: So it is said that the cognizances of the eye-door🔽have only visible data as their object, and that is present.

original: sabbesaṃpi rūpameva ārammaṇaṃ. Tañha paccuppannanti. Sotadvārikā dīsupi esevanayo.
analyzed: sabbesam pi rūpam eva ārammaṇam tat ha paccuppannanti sotadvārikāḥ
translated: The same method applies to the ear-door.

original: Tattha taṃ taṃ kāraṇaṃ paṭicca uppannaṃ paccuppannaṃ. Vattamānanti attho. Chabbidhaṃpīti
analyzed: tattha tam tam kāraṇam paṭicca uppannam paccuppannam vattamānam
translated: Herein, what is present is what has arisen and is occurring owing to this or that condition.🔽It is of six kinds as visible data, etc.,

original: rūpādivasena chabbidhaṃpi. Atikkantabhāvaṃ itaṃ gataṃ pavattanti atītaṃ. Āgacchati
analyzed: rūpa ādi vasena atikkanta bhāvam itam gatam pavattanti atītam āgacchati
translated: and as past, future, and present.🔽What has gone beyond the state of what is present is past.🔽What is coming is future.

original: āgacchitthāti āgataṃ. Paccuppannaṃ, atītañca. Na āgatanti anāgataṃ. Uppādajātikā
analyzed: āgacchittha ati āgatam paccuppannam atītam ca na āgatam ti anāgatam uppāda jātikā
translated: What is present is neither coming nor gone.🔽Only formed ideas, which are born of generation,

original: saṅkhatadhammāeva tīsu kālesu anupatanti. Tasmā uppādarahitā asaṅkhatabhūtā nibbānapaññattiyo
analyzed: saṅkhata dhammāḥ eva tīsu kālesu anupatanti tasmai uppāda rahitāḥ asaṅkhata bhūtāḥ nibbāna paññattiyaḥ
translated: are included in the three times. Therefore the descriptions of Nibbāna,

original: kālavimuttaṃnāmāti veditabbā.
analyzed: veditabbā
translated: which are devoid of arising, are called “free from the times.”

original: [104] Vibhāvaniyaṃ pana
analyzed: vibhāvaniyam pana
translated: But in the Vibhaṅga

original: “Vināsābhāvato atītādikālavasena navattabbattā nibbānaṃ paññattica kālavimuttaṃnāmā”ti vuttaṃ. Taṃ vicāretabbaṃ.🔽Sabbepi hi saṅkhatadhammā anāgatabhāva pubbakāeva honti. Tasmā te yadā paccayasāmaggiṃ🔽labhitvā uppajjissantīti vattabbapakkhe tiṭṭhanti, tadā anāgatānāma. Yadā paccayasāmaggiṃ🔽labhitvā uppannā, yadā paccuppannānāma. Yadā niruddhā, tadā atītānāma. Evaṃ uppādajātikānaññeva
analyzed: vināsā abhāvataḥ atīta ādi kāla vasena navattabba ttā nibbānam paññatti ca kālavimuttam nāma ati vuttam tat vicāretabbam  sabbe pi hi saṅkhata dhammāḥ anāgata bhāva pubbakāḥ eva honti tasmā te yadā paccaya sāmaggim  labhitvā uppajjissanti iti vattabba pakkhe tiṭṭhanti tadā anāgatā nāma yadā paccaya sāmaggiṃ  labhitvā uppannā yadā paccuppannā nāma yadā niruddhā tadā atītā nāma evam uppāda jātikā anaññā eva
translated: “Because of the absence of destruction, and because of the absence of occurrence in the three times beginning with the past, Nibbāna is called ‘free from time’ as a designation.” This should be examined.🔽For all formed dhammas are only future before they have come into existence. Therefore, when they are said to be “obtainable” when they have obtained the concurrence of conditions,

original: uppādamūlikā tekālikatā siddhā. Uppādarahitānaṃ pana anāgatāvatthāpi natthi. Kuto🔽paccuppannātītā vatthāti. Tasmā nibbānapaññattīnaṃ kālattaya vimuttatā hotīti. Vināsābhāvatoti
analyzed: uppāda mūlikā tekālika tā siddhā uppāda rahitānam pana natthi kutas  paccuppanna atītāḥ vattha ati tasmā nibbāna paññattīnam kālattaya vimutta tā hoti iti vināsā abhāvato ti
translated: then they are future; when they have obtained the concurrence of conditions and have arisen, then they are present; when they have ceased, then they are past. Thus the tripartite division based on arising is established only for those dhammas that have arising. But those that are devoid of arising have no future state,🔽to say nothing of a present or past state. Therefore the designations of Nibbāna are free from the three times.

original: idaṃ pana atītakālavimuttiyāeva kāraṇanti na tena tāsaṃ itarakālavimuttiṃ sādhetīti
analyzed: idam pana atīta kāla vimuttiyāḥ eva kāraṇan ti na tena tāsam itara kāla vimuttim sādheti iti
translated: As to “because of the absence of destruction”: this is a reason only for the freedom from the past time; it does not establish the freedom from the other two times.

original: daṭṭhabbaṃ. Yathārahavibhāgo pana idheva tesūtiādinā pacchā āgamissati. Dvāravimuttānañca
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam yathāraha vibhāgo pana idha iva tesu uti ādinā pacchā āgamissati dvāra vimuttānam ca
translated: The exposition of the way in which they occur will come later in the description of the function of the kinds of knowledge, under the heading “The exposition of the way in which they occur will come later in the description of the function of the kinds of knowledge” .🔽The construction is: “The object of the kinds of direct-knowledge is of six kinds, and also of the kinds of direct-knowledge that are free from the hindrances.”

original: chabbidhaṃpi ārammaṇaṃ hotīti sambandho. Yathā pana āvajjanādīnaṃ chadvārikacittānaṃ
analyzed: chabbidham api ārammaṇam hoti iti sambandhaḥ yathā pana āvajjana ādīnam cha dvārika cittānam
translated: But although the object of the kinds of direct-knowledge classed as the six kinds of direct-consciousness consisting of adverting, etc.,

original: ārammaṇaṃ bhavantarepi imasmiṃ bhavepi purimabhāge kenaci dvārena gahitaṃpi agahitaṃpi
analyzed: ārammaṇam bhavantare pi imasmin bhavepi purima bhāge kenacid dvārena gahitam pi a gahitam pi
translated: is in the next existence and in this existence too, and is both what has been apprehended by one or other of the doors and what has not,

original: hoti. Na tathā imesanti dassetuṃ bhavantare chadvāragahitanti vuttaṃ. Bhavavisesañhi
analyzed: hoti na tathā imesan ti dassetum bhavantare cha dvāra gahitanti vuttam bhava visesam hi
translated: nevertheless this is said in order to show that it is not like that in the case of these .

original: patthetvā kammaṃ katvā tattha nibbattānaṃ ārammaṇaṃ bhavantarepi kenaci dvārena gahitaṃpi hoti yevāti.
analyzed: patthetvā kammam katvā tattha nibbattānam ārammaṇam bhavantare pi kenacid dvārena gahitam pi hoti yeva ati
translated: For the object of those who have been reborn there after making kamma that has as its object a particular kind of existence is what has been apprehended by one or other of the doors in the next existence too.

original: [105] Vibhāvaniyaṃ pana
analyzed: vibhāvaniyam pana
translated: But in the Vibhāvinī-Țīkā,

original: “Taṃ pana nesaṃ ārammaṇaṃ na āvajjanassa viya kenaci agahitameva gocarabhāvaṃ gacchatīti dassetuṃ chadvāra gahitanti vutta”nti vuttaṃ. Taṃ na yujjati.
analyzed: tam pana nesam ārammaṇam na āvajjanassa viya kenaci agahitam eva gocara bhāvam gacchati iti dassetum cha dvāra gahitanti vuttanti vuttam tam na yujjati
translated: “But in order to show that its object does not become the province of these kinds of direct-knowledge in the way that the object of adverting does, which is not apprehended by any door, it is said that it is ‘apprehended by the six doors’” . That is not right.

original: Pañcadvārā vajjanassapi hi ārammaṇaṃ pubbe kenaci dvārantarena gahitaṃpi agahitaṃpi
analyzed: pañca dvārā vajjanassa api hi ārammaṇam pubbe kenacid dvāra antarena gahitam pi agahitampi
translated: For the object of the adverting at the five doors is sometimes apprehended by some consciousness at the same door and sometimes not.

original: hotiyeva. Tathā hi idaṃ nāma labhissāmi bhuñjissāmi passissāmīti pubbe gahitaṃ pacchā
analyzed: tathā hi idam nāma labhissāmi bhuñjissāmi passissāmi iti pubbe gahitam pacchā
translated: For what was apprehended previously as “I shall get this,” “I shall eat this,” “I shall see this,” is not not the object of the adverting subsequently.

original: āvajjanassa ārammaṇaṃ na na hotīti. Naca ekāvajjanavīthiyaṃ pubbe kenaci cittena
analyzed: āvajjanassa ārammaṇam na na hoti iti na ca eka āvajjana vīthiyam pubbe kenacid cittena
translated: And the fact that it is not apprehended by any consciousness previously in a single cognitive series is not a criterion here.

original: agahitabhāvo idha pamāṇanti. Yathā ca pañcadvārikacittānaṃ ārammaṇaṃ ekantapaccuppannameva
analyzed: agahita bhāvaḥ yathā ca pañcadvārika cittānam ārammaṇam ekanta paccuppannam eva
translated: And just as the object of the five-door consciousness is only what is actually present,

original: hoti. Yathā ca manodvārikacittānaṃ ārammaṇaṃ tekālikaṃvā kālavimuttasā maññaṃvā hoti.
analyzed: hoti yathā ca manaḥ dvārika cittānaṃ ārammaṇam tekālikam vā kāla vimutta sā maññam vā hoti
translated: and just as the object of the mind-door adverting is either what is actually present or what is not present but is reckoned as present,

original: Na tathā imesanti dassetuṃ paccuppannamatītaṃ paññattibhūtaṃvāti vuttaṃ. Yathā ca
analyzed: na tathā imesan ti dassetum paccuppannam atītam paññatti bhūtam vā iti vuttam yathā ca
translated: so as to show that this is not so in this case, it is said to be “present or past, or else nominally existent.”

original: chadvārikacittānaṃ ārammaṇaṃ āgamasiddhavohārayuttaṃpi tabbohāravinimuttaṃpi hoti.
analyzed: cha dvārika cittānam ārammaṇam āgama siddha vohāra yuttam pi tad bohāra vinimuttam pi hoti
translated: And just as the object of the six-door consciousness is either what is established by hearsay or what is free from such verbal expression,

original: Na tathā imesanti dassetuṃ kamma kamma nimitta gatinimitta sammatanti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: na tathā imesan ti dassetum kamma kamma nimitta gati nimitta sammatanti vuttam
translated: so as to show that this is not so in this case, it is said to be “what is agreed upon as action, as a sign of action, or as a sign of destiny.”

original: [106] Vibhāvaniyaṃ pana
analyzed: vibhāvaniyam pana
translated: But in the Vibhāṇa it is said:

original: “Nāpi nesaṃ ārammaṇaṃ maraṇāsannato purimabhāgajavanānaṃ viya kammakammanimittādivasena
analyzed: na api ārammaṇam maraṇa āsannato kamma kamma nimitta ādi vasena
translated: Nor is their object, like that of the prenascent impulsions, a kamma, a sign of kamma, etc., that is near to death.🔽

original: āgamasiddhavohāravinimuttanti dassetuṃ kamma.La. Sammatanti āhā”ti vuttaṃ. Taṃpi na sundaraṃ.🔽Maraṇā sannato purimabhāgepi hi sattā attanā katakammaṃvā cetiyādīni kamma, pakaraṇānivā
analyzed: āgama siddha vohāra vinimuttanti dassetum āha ati vuttam tat pi na sundaram  purima bhāge pi hi sattāḥ attanā kata kammam vā cetiya ādīni kamma pakaraṇāni vā
translated: Nor is it right to say that the words “kamma, kamma-nimitta, etc.,” are mentioned in order to show that their object is not established by tradition like that of the javanas occurring in the prior stage before death.

original: ārammaṇaṃ karontiyeva. Tadāpi hi kammaṃ kammameva, kammupakaraṇānica kammanimittāniyeva.
analyzed: ārammaṇam karontiyā iva tadā api hi kammam kammam eva kamma upakaraṇāni ca
translated: For beings make kamma and kamma-nimitta their object even in the prior stage before death. For at that time kamma is kamma and the requisites of kamma are kamma-nimitta.

original: Kamma siddhiyānimittaṃ kāraṇaṃ kammanimittanti katvā. Kammassa nimittaṃ ārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: kamma siddhiyā a nimittam kāraṇam kamma nimittam ti katvā kammassa nimittam ārammaṇam
translated: And they call kamma-nimitta “the cause of the establishment of kamma” and “the object of kamma.”

original: kammanimittantipi vadanti. Ajātasatturājā viyaca supinadassanādivasena gatinimittānipi
analyzed: vadanti ajāta sattu rājā supina dassana ādi vasena gati nimittāni pi
translated: And they also call it “the sign of kamma” . And beings make the sign of destiny their object too, as did King Ajātasattu, by seeing a dream, and so on.🔽For the king killed his father in two existences. And from the time he had killed him,

original: ārammaṇaṃ karontiyeva. Rājā hi dvīsu bhavesu pitaraṃ māreti. Māritakālatoca paṭṭhāya
analyzed: ārammaṇam karontiyā iva rājā hi dvīsu bhavesu pitaram māreti mārita kālato ca paṭṭhāya
translated: the sign of his destiny appeared to him when he was asleep.

original: tassa niddāyantassa gatinimittāni upaṭṭhahantīti. Tattha yathāsambhavanti taṃ taṃ
analyzed: tassa niddāyantassa gati nimittāni upaṭṭhahanti iti tattha yathā sambhavanti tam tam
translated: Herein, “according as appropriate” means according as any one of them is appropriate.

original: paṭisandhādīnaṃ chadvāragahitādivasena sambhavantassa ārammaṇassa anurūpato. Yathāsambhavavibhāgo
analyzed: paṭisandhā ādīnam cha dvāra gahita ādi vasena sambhavantassa ārammaṇassa anurūpataḥ yathā sambhava vibhāgaḥ
translated: and it is called “in conformity with the object” because it arises in conformity with the object that is apprehended by the six doors, etc., in the rebirth-linking and so on.🔽The analysis according to what is possible will come later in the section on death and rebirth-linking .

original: pana upari maraṇuppattiyaṃ āgamissati. Yebhuyyenāti bāhullena. Bhavantareti atītānantarabhave
analyzed: pana upari maraṇa uppattiyam āgamissati yebhuyyena ati bāhullena bhavantare ti atīta anantara bhave
translated: “For the most part”: in the majority of cases.🔽“In the course of an existence”: in the existence that follows the previous existence.

original: tatthaca maraṇāsannakāle. Chadvāra gahitanti chahi dvārehi maraṇāsannajavanehi gahitaṃ.
analyzed: maraṇa āsanna kāle cha dvāra chahi dvārehi maraṇa āsanna javanehi gahitam
translated: “Apprehended by the six doors”: apprehended by the impulsions that occur at the six doors at the time of approaching death.

original: Ettha ca yebhuyyenāti etena bhavantare chadvāragahitanti imassa vidhānassa anekaṃsabhāvaṃ🔽viseseti. Kasmā. Agahitassapi sambhavato. Yañhi asaññibhavato cutānaṃ kamma kammanimitta
analyzed: ettha ca yebhuyyena ati etena bhavantare cha dvāra gahitanti imassa vidhānassa  visese ti kasmā a gahitassa api sambhavataḥ yat hi a saññi bhavataḥ cutānam kamma kamma nimitta
translated: And here the word “for the most part” distinguishes the rule “in the course of an existence” as being only partially true,

original: gatinimitta sammataṃ arūpabhavato cutānañca gatinimittasammataṃ kāmapaṭisandhi bhavaṅgacutīnaṃ
analyzed: gati nimitta sammatam gati nimitta sammatam kāma paṭisandhi bhavaṅga cutīnam
translated: since it is not true in all cases. For the object of rebirth-linking and death consciousnesses in the sense sphere is the object that is agreed upon as the kamma or the sign of the kamma in the case of those dying in the immaterial world, and the object that is agreed upon as the destiny in the case of those dying in the non-percipient world.🔽That is not apprehended by any door in the course of an existence.

original: ārammaṇaṃ. Taṃ bhavantare kenaci dvārena agahita meva hotīti. Etthaca yasmā paṭṭhāne
analyzed: ārammaṇam tam bhavantare kenacid dvārena a gahitam eva hoti iti ettha ca yasmai paṭṭhāne
translated: And here, since the object of rebirth-linking consciousness is not apprehended by the six doors,

original: arūpabhave duvidhopi purejātapaccayo paṭisiddho. Aṭṭhakathāsuca tato cutānaṃ kāmapaṭisandhiyā
analyzed: arūpa bhave duvidhaḥ api purejāta paccayo paṭisiddho aṭṭhakathāsu ca tatas cutānam kāma paṭisandhiyā
translated: In the formless world both kinds of prenascence condition are rejected. And in the Commentaries it is said that the sign of the destiny is the object of the present-functioning consciousnesses of those who die there and are reborn in the sense-desire world.

original: paccuppannagatinimittārammaṇatāpi vuttā. Gatinimittañca nāma rūpārammaṇameva dīpenti.🔽Tasmā tesaṃ kāmapaṭisandhiyāpi gatinimittasammataṃ bhavantare kenaci dvārena agahitameva🔽hotīti veditabbaṃ. Apica, maraṇāsannakāle kammabalena kammādīnaṃ upaṭṭhānaṃnāma yebhuyyena
analyzed: paccuppanna gati nimitta ārammaṇa tā api vuttā gati nimittam ca nāma rūpa ārammaṇam eva dīpenti  tasmā tesam kāma paṭisandhiyā api gati nimitta sammatam bhavantare kenacid dvārena agahitam eva  hoti iti veditabbam apica maraṇa āsanna kāle kamma balena kamma ādīnam upaṭṭhānam nāma yebhuyyena
translated: And they explain that the sign of the destiny is a visible-data object.🔽So it should be understood that even in the rebirth-linking of those who die in the formless world and are reborn in the sense-desire world, the sign of the destiny, which is called the “sign of the place of rebirth,” is not actually apprehended by any door except that of the nose.🔽Moreover, the manifestation of kamma, etc., through the power of kamma at the time of the approach of death is generally only in the case of those who die supine.

original: saṃmuḷhamaraṇena marantānameva hoti. Itaresaṃ pana paresaṃ payogabalenapi attanā🔽pakatiyā suṭṭhu āsevitānaṃ anussaraṇabalenapi dhammikaupāsakādīnaṃ viya devalokato
analyzed: saṃmuḍha maraṇena marantānam eva hoti itaresam pana paresam  pakatiyā suṭṭhu āsevitānam anussaraṇa balena api dhammika aupāsaka ādīnam viya deva lokato
translated: But in the case of others it is also due to the power of the effort of others,🔽and also due to the power of recollection of what was well attended to in the past, and also due to the influence of deities who have come from the deva world to receive them, as in the case of the righteous lay followers, and so on.

original: āgantvā gaṇhantānaṃ devānaṃ ānubhāvenapi hotiyeva. Nirayapālāpi nirayato āgantvā
analyzed: āgantvā hotiyā iva niraya pālā api nirayataḥ āgantvā
translated: And the guardians of the hells come and receive those who are to be reborn in hell.

original: gaṇhantiyeva. Revativimānañcettha vattabbaṃ. Tañhi dve nirayapālā gahetvā pathamaṃ
analyzed: gaṇhantiyā iva revati vimānam ca ittha vattabbam tat hi dve niraya pālāḥ gahetvā pathamam
translated: The “Revatha Palace” should be mentioned here. For two guardians of the hells came and received Revatha first.

original: tāvatiṃsābhavanaṃ netvā pacchā nirayaṃ nayiṃsu. Te hi yakkha jātikattā vessavaṇaparisāviya🔽tāvatiṃsā bhavanaṃpi gantuṃ sakkontiyeva. Yamassa dūtā dve yakkhāti hi pāḷiyaṃ vuttaṃ.🔽Vessavaṇadūtā idha yamassa dūtāti vuttātipi vadanti. Tasmā ye kasiṇāsubhādīni samathanimittāni
analyzed: netvā pacchā nirayam nayiṃsu te hi yakkha jāti kattāḥ  tāvatiṃsāḥ bhavanam pi gantum sakkontiyā iva yamassa dūtāḥ dve yakkhā ti hi pāḷiyam vuttam  vessavaṇa dūtāḥ idha yamassa dūta ati vadanti tasmā ye kasiṇa asubha ādīni samatha nimittāni
translated: and after taking them to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven they lead them to hell. For these ghosts, because of their kind of rebirth, are able to go to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven just as the retinue of Vessavaṇa can.🔽And it is said that the words “messengers of Yama” are used here for the messengers of Vessavaṇa.

original: suṭṭhu āsevitvā upacārajjhāne ṭhatvā tāneva nimittāni gahetvā maranti. Tesaṃpi kāmapaṭisandhiyā🔽ārammaṇaṃ bhavantare kenaci dvārena agahitameva siyā. Upacārajjhānabaleneva brahmalokato
analyzed: suṭṭhu āsevitvā upacāra jhāne ṭhatvā tāni eva nimittāni gahetvā maranti tesam pi kāma paṭisandhiyā  ārammaṇam bhavantare kenacid dvārena agahitam eva siyā upacāra jhāna balena iva brahmalokato
translated: Therefore, those who have well developed the kasiṇa, the sublime abidings, and so on, as the sign for serenity, and who have reached access concentration and die while apprehending those same signs,🔽may have as the object of their rebirth-linking in the sense sphere a sign that has not been apprehended in the previous existence by any door of consciousness.

original: idhauppajjantānaṃpi esevanayoti.
analyzed: idha a uppajjantānam pi
translated: And those who are reborn here from the Brahmā-world by the power of access concentration have the same method.

original: Yaṃpana vibhāvaniyaṃ
analyzed: yaṃpana vibhāvaniyam
translated: But in the Vibhāvinī-Țīkā,

original: “Kevalaṃ kammabaleneva tesaṃ asaññibhavato cutānaṃ paṭisandhiyā kammanimittādikaṃ ārammaṇaṃ upaṭṭhātī”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: kevalam kamma balena iva tesam asaññi bhavataḥ cutānam paṭisandhiyā kamma nimitta ādikam ārammaṇam upaṭṭhāti iti vuttam
translated: it is said: “The sign of kamma, and so on, as object appears to those who have died in the non-percipient realm and are reborn there by the mere power of kamma.”

original: Tattha kammanimittādikanti ettha ādisaddena kammaṃpi gahetabba meva. Na hi tassa
analyzed: tattha kamma nimitta ādikam ti ettha ādi saddena kammam pi gahetabba meva na hi tassa
translated: Herein, the sign of the destiny and so on: the word “and so on” includes the kamma too.

original: agahaṇe kāraṇaṃ atthīti. Tāni pana sabbānipi kevalaṃ paṭisandhijanakassa kammassa🔽ānubhāveneva paṭisandhiyaṃ upaṭṭhahantīti veditabbaṃ. Anāgataṃ pana nimittaṃ upaṭṭhahamānaṃ
analyzed: a gahaṇe kāraṇam atthi iti tāni pana sabbāni pi kevalam paṭisandhi janakassa kammassa  ānubhāvena iva paṭisandhiyam upaṭṭhahanti iti veditabbam anāgatam pana nimittam upaṭṭhahamānam
translated: For there is no reason to omit it. But all these things should be understood to appear only through the influence of the kamma that generates the rebirth-linking itself.

original: gatinimittameva siyā. Naca tassa visuṃ upaṭṭhātabbakiccaṃ atthi. Paccuppanna gatinimitte
analyzed: gati nimittam eva siyā na ca tassa visum upaṭṭhātabba kiccam atthi paccuppanna gati nimitte
translated: But the sign of the future destiny may be the sign of the past destiny. And there is no need for it to appear separately.

original: siddhe siddhameva hotīti vuttaṃ paccuppannamatītaṃ paññatti bhūtaṃvāti.
analyzed: siddhe siddham eva hoti iti vuttam paccuppannam atītam paññatti bhūtam vā ti
translated: When the sign of the present destiny is established, that is established too. That is why it is said, “The present and the past are the same in being a designation for what is actually present.”

original: [107] Vibhāvaniyaṃ pana🔽“Anāgataṃnāma atītaṃ viya anubhūtañca na hoti. Naca paccuppannagatinimittaṃ viya āpātamāgata”nti kāraṇaṃ vuttaṃ. Taṃ akāraṇaṃ.
analyzed: vibhāvaniyam pana  anāgatam nāma atītam viya anubhūtam ca na hoti na ca paccuppanna gati nimittam viya āpātam āgatam ti kāraṇam vuttam tam akāraṇam
translated: But in the Vibhaṅga🔽the reason is given thus: “The future is not experienced as the past is, nor does it come into the focus of the eye as the present sign of the destiny does.”🔽That is no reason.🔽Because it does not follow. For the sign of the destiny, though present, is not experienced,

original: Pasaṅgassa anivattitattā. Gatinimittañhi nāma paccuppannaṃpi anubhūtaṃ na hoti. Taṃpi
analyzed: pasaṅgassa a nivattita ttā gati nimittam hi nāma paccuppannam pi anubhūtam na hoti tam pi
translated: and it is not in the focus of the eye.

original: kammabaleneva āpātamāgataṃ. Evaṃsante anāgataṃpi kammabalena āpātamāgatameva siyāti
analyzed: kamma balena iva āpātam āgatam anāgatam pi kamma balena āpātam āgatam eva siyāti
translated: and it comes into focus by the power of kamma. So it is with the future.🔽This is the natural consequence.

original: ayaṃ pasaṅgo pākatikoeva hotīti. Tesūti yathāvuttesu ārammaṇikacittesu. Rūpādīsu
analyzed: ayam pasaṅgo pākatikaḥ eva hoti iti tesu ti yathā vuttesu ārammaṇika cittesu rūpa ādīsu
translated: In these: in the kinds of consciousness stated thus.

original: pañcasu ekekaṃ ārammaṇaṃ etesanti samāso. Rūpādīni pañca ārammaṇāni etassāti viggaho.
analyzed: pañcasu ekekam ārammaṇam etesan ti samāsaḥ rūpa ādīni pañca ārammaṇāni etassa ati viggahaḥ
translated: Each of the five beginning with visible data is a “datum” for these, thus they are “having that as their object.”🔽The analysis is: “The five beginning with visible data are the object of this, thus it is that.”

original: Sesānīti pañcaviññāṇasampaṭicchana dvayato sesāni santīraṇa mahāvipākāni. Sabbathāpi🔽kāmāvacarā lambaṇānevāti paṭisandhādīhi nānākiccehi rūpādīsu nānārammaṇesu pavattena
analyzed: sesāni iti pañca viññāṇa sampaṭicchana dvayataḥ sesāni santīraṇa mahā vipākāni sabbathā api  kāmāvacarāḥ paṭisandhā ādīhi nānā kiccehi rūpa ādīsu nānā ārammaṇesu pavattena
translated: The rest: the rest of the kinds of consciousness beginning with the two receiving consciousnesses and ending with the great-object resultant are the rest.🔽In every way: in every way, by all the kinds of function beginning with rebirth-linking, occurring with respect to the various objects beginning with visible data,

original: sabba pakārenapi kāmāvacarālambaṇikāniyeva. Tāni hi sabbaññubuddhānaṃ uppannānipi
analyzed: tāni hi sabbaññu buddhānam uppannāni pi
translated: they have only sense-sphere objects. For they are unable to take as their object any of the ideas of the Omniscient Buddhas that have arisen,

original: vikappasattirahitattā avijjamāne paññattidhammeca sukhume mahaggatadhammeca gambhīre🔽lokuttaradhammeca ālambituṃ na sakkontīti. Tattha santīraṇattayaṃ tāva santīraṇakiccavasena
analyzed: vikappa satti rahita ttā a vijjamāne paññatti dhamme ca sukhume mahaggata dhamme ca gambhīre 🔽lokuttara dhamma ī ca ālambitum na sakkonti iti tattha santīraṇa ttayam tāva santīraṇa kicca vasena
translated: because they are devoid of the power of insight and investigation, and because they are weak and gross, and because they are mundane and shallow.🔽Herein, firstly, as regards the three kinds of investigating consciousness:

original: rūpādipañcālambaṇe pavattati. Tadārammaṇādivasena pana sabbānipi ekādasavipākāni🔽chasu parittārammaṇesu pavattantīti.
analyzed: rūpa ādi pañca ālambaṇe pavattati tad ārammaṇa ādi vasena pana sabbāni api ekādasa vipākāni  chasu paritta ārammaṇesu pavattanti iti
translated: It occurs with respect to the five objects, visible data, etc., as object. But all the eleven kinds of resultants occur in the six kinds of limited-sphere consciousnesses.

original: [108] Vibhāvaniyaṃ pana
analyzed: vibhāvaniyam pana
translated: But in the Vibhaṅga it is said:🔽“Resultants occur with respect to the five objects, visible data, etc., as object, by searching out, etc.,”

original: “Vipākāni tāva santīraṇādivasena rūpādipañcālambaṇe”ti vuttaṃ. Tattha santīraṇādivasenāti navattabbaṃ. Santīraṇavasena icceva vattabbanti.
analyzed: vipākāni tāva santīraṇa ādi vasena rūpa ādi pañca ālambaṇā iti vuttam tattha santīraṇa ādi vasena ati santīraṇa vasena icca iva vattabbanti
translated: whereby “by searching out, etc.,” should be understood as “by searching out.”

original: Yo panettha cittānaṃ ārammaṇesu pavattivibhāgo vattabbo. So aṭṭhakathākaṇḍe gahetabbo.
analyzed: yaḥ pana ittha cittānam ārammaṇesu pavatti vibhāgaḥ vattabbo saḥ aṭṭhakathā kaṇḍe gahetabbo
translated: But the analysis of the occurrence of the consciousnesses with respect to their objects should be understood as given in the Peṭaka.

original: Lokuttaradhammā atigambhīrattā ñāṇasseva visayabhūtāti vuttaṃ. Akusala.La. Lokuttara🔽vajjita sabbā rammaṇānīti. Tattha tāni laddhasamāpattīnaṃ uppannakāleeva mahaggatārammaṇāni.
analyzed: lokuttara dhammā ati gambhīra ttā ñāṇassa iva visaya bhūtā ti vuttam  tattha tāni laddha samāpattīnam uppanna kāle eva mahaggata ārammaṇāni
translated: The supramundane states are the province of knowledge only because they are extremely profound.🔽The rest are the province of both.

original: Tesuca dve dosamūlacittāni parihīnajjhānāni ārabbha uppannakāleti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Ñāṇaṃpi
analyzed: tesu ca dve dosa mūla cittāni parihīna jjhānāni ārabbha uppanna kāle ti daṭṭhabbam ñāṇam pi
translated: The rest are the province of both knowledge and seeing.🔽Herein, the profitable and unprofitable of the sense sphere have as their objects all the kinds of objects except the supramundane states.🔽The profitable and unprofitable of the fine-material sphere have as their objects only the kinds of objects belonging to their own sphere.🔽The profitable and unprofitable of the immaterial sphere have as their objects only the kinds of objects belonging to their own sphere.🔽The profitable of the supramundane has as its object only the supramundane.🔽The unprofitable has as its object all the kinds of objects except the unformed element.

original: anadhigatāni lokuttarāni ālambituṃ na sakkotīti vuttaṃ ñāṇasampayutta.La. Vajjitasabbā
analyzed: anadhigatāni lokuttarāni ālambitum na sakkoti iti vuttam
translated: He is unable to advert to any of the supramundane states that he has not already attained.🔽The profitable mundane consciousnesses associated with knowledge are the sense-sphere profitable associated with the three kinds of knowledge, namely, the knowledge of the past, the knowledge of the future, and the knowledge of the present, which occur in ordinary men who have obtained jhāna.🔽They have as object the ideas of the sense sphere together with their individual essences.

original: rammaṇānīti. Tattha ñāṇasampayuttakāmakusalāni puthujjanānaṃ ajjhānalābhīnaṃ uppannakāle🔽paññattiyā saha kāmāvacarārammaṇāni. Tāneva sotāpattimaggato pure gotrabhukkhaṇe
analyzed: rammaṇāni iti tattha ñāṇa sampayutta kāma kusalāni puthujjanānam ajjhāna lābhīnam uppanna kāle  paññattiyā saha kāmāvacara ārammaṇāni tāni eva sotāpatti maggato pure gotrabhukkhaṇe
translated: The same associated with the knowledge of the past and the knowledge of the future have as object the ideas of the sense sphere together with their individual essences and the past and future individual essences of the ideas of the sense sphere.🔽The same associated with the knowledge of the present have as object the ideas of the sense sphere together with their individual essences and the present individual essences of the ideas of the sense sphere.🔽The same associated with the knowledge of penetration of minds have as object the associated and co-nascent ideas in the mind-door process.🔽The same associated with the knowledge of former habitations have as object the past individual essences of the ideas of the sense sphere.🔽The same associated with the knowledge of the passing away and reappearance of beings have as object the present individual essences of the ideas of the sense sphere.

original: puthujjanānaṃ nibbānārammaṇāni. Jhānalābhīnaṃ tāneva abhiññākusalañca mahaggatārammaṇānipi.
analyzed: puthujjanānam nibbāna ārammaṇāni jhāna lābhīnam tāni eva abhiññā kusalam ca mahaggata ārammaṇāni pi
translated: The same associated with the knowledge of the divine eye have as object the materiality of the sense sphere.🔽The same associated with the knowledge of the six kinds of consciousness have as object the six kinds of consciousness.

original: Heṭṭhimaphalaṭṭhānaṃ attanā adhigata maggaphalanibbānā rammaṇānipīti veditabbāni.
analyzed: heṭṭhima phala ṭṭhānam attanā adhigata magga phala nibbāna ārammaṇāni pi iti veditabbāni
translated: The same associated with the knowledge of the seven stations for consciousness have as object the seven stations for consciousness.🔽The same associated with the knowledge of the four noble truths have as object the four noble truths.🔽The same associated with the knowledge of the four jhānas have as object the four jhānas.

original: Yathā cettha ariyā attanā adhigata maggaphalāniyeva ālambituṃ sakkonti. Tathā jhānalābhinopi
analyzed: yathā ca ittha ariyāḥ attanā adhigata magga phalāniyā iva ālambitum sakkonti tathā jhāna lābhinaḥ pi
translated: The same associated with the knowledge of the five spiritual faculties have as object the five spiritual faculties.

original: attanā adhigatajjhānānieva ālambituṃ sakkontīti veditabbaṃ. Ettha siyā-ye ca jhānāni
analyzed: attanā adhigata jhānāni eva ālambitum sakkonti iti veditabbam ettha ca jhānāni
translated: The same associated with the knowledge of the six kinds of direct knowledge have as object the six kinds of direct knowledge.🔽The same associated with the knowledge of the seven kinds of purity have as object the seven kinds of purity.🔽The same associated with the knowledge of the eight liberations have as object the eight liberations.

original: patthenti. Jhānaparikammaṃpi karonti. Yeca jhānasuttāni saṃvaṇṇenti. Te alābhino
analyzed: patthenti jhāna parikammam pi karonti ye ca jhāna suttāni saṃvaṇṇenti te alābhinaḥ
translated: The same associated with the knowledge of the nine successive cessations have as object the nine successive cessations.🔽The same associated with the knowledge of the ten kinds of totality have as object the ten kinds of totality.🔽The same associated with the knowledge of the four discriminations have

original: mahaggatajjhānāni ālambituṃ sakkonti, nasakkontīti. Na sakkonti. Te hi jhānānināma🔽evaṃ mahānubhāvāni evaṃ mahānisaṃsānīti sutvāvā sutapariyattibalena siddhe ākāra
analyzed: mahaggata jhānāni ālambitum sakkonti na sakkonti iti na sakkonti te hi  evam mahā anubhāvāni evam mahā nisaṃsāni iti sutvā vā suta pariyatti balena siddhe
translated: They are able to do so, and they are unable to do so. They are unable to do so. For they have heard that the jhānas are of such great potency and of such great benefit, and so they have succeeded by the power of what they have heard, by the power of the scriptures.🔽🔽The form of the jhāna is established in them by the power of what they have heard, by the power of the scriptures, and so it is called “established by faith.”

original: sallakkhaṇaññāṇe ṭhatvā vā anumānavaseneva tāni patthenti. Parikammaṃpi karonti.🔽Suttānipi saṃvaṇṇentīti. Itarathā puthujjanāpi lokuttaradhamme patthenti, maggaparikammaṃpi🔽karonti. Maggaphala nibbānavacanānivikathenti saṃvaṇṇentīti tesaṃpi te ārammaṇabhūtā
analyzed: sat lakkhaṇa ñāṇe ṭhatvā vā anumāna vasena iva tāni patthenti parikammam pi karonti  suttāni pi saṃvaṇṇenti iti itarathā puthujjanāḥ api lokuttara dhamme patthenti magga parikammam pi  karonti saṃvaṇṇenti iti tesam pi te ārammaṇa bhūtā
translated: They are able to do so, and they are unable to do so. They are unable to do so. For they have heard it said that the jhānas are of such great potency and of such great fruit, and so they have established the knowledge of the appearance of the jhāna by the power of what they have heard, the learning sign, and they seek them by inference only. They do the preliminary work and they recite the texts.

original: eva siyunti. Tesaṃ pana cittāni jhānādīnaṃ paññattiguṇe eva anubhontīti veditabbāni.🔽Paṇītadhammānañhi paññattiyopi paṇitarūpāeva hontīti. Mahiddhiko hi paracittavidū.
analyzed: eva siyunti tesam pana cittāni jhāna ādīnam paññatti guṇe eva anubhonti iti veditabbāni  paṇīta dhammānam hi paññattiyaḥ pi paṇita rūpāḥ eva honti iti mahiddhikaḥ hi para citta vidū
translated: Otherwise, worldlings would seek supramundane states and do the preliminary work for the path, and they would discuss and recite the texts on the path, fruition, and Nibbāna. So they would be their object too. But their consciousnesses should be understood as experiencing only the qualities of the description of the jhānas, and so on.🔽For the description of sublime states is sublime in form.

original: Māro deva puttopi rūpajjhānacittaṃ vaṭṭanissitameva passati. Vivaṭṭanissitaṃ na passati.
analyzed: māraḥ deva puttaḥ api rūpa jjhāna cittam vaṭṭa nissitam eva passati vivaṭṭa nissitam na passati
translated: And a powerful being who knows the minds of others, even though he be a deva or a Brahmā, sees only the consciousness of the jhāna that is bound up with the round of rebirths; he does not see that which is bound up with the cessation of the round.

original: Arūpajjhānacittaṃ pana vaṭṭanissitaṃpi napassatīti aṅguttare navanipāte aṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: arūpa jhāna cittam pana vaṭṭa nissitam pi na passati iti aṅguttare navanipāte aṭṭhakathāyam
translated: But the formless-world jhāna consciousness does not see even what is bound up with the round of rebirths, it is said in the commentary to the Ninth Chapter of the Anguttara Nikāya.

original: vuttaṃ. Ye pana aggamaggaphalāni paṭivijjhanti. Tesaṃ uppannāniññaṇasampayuttakāmakriyajavanāni
analyzed: vuttam ye pana aggamagga phalāni paṭivijjhanti tesam uppanna aniññaṇa sampayutta kāmakriya javanāni
translated: But those who penetrate the noble paths and fruits, their in-breaths and out-breaths associated with knowledge and their in-breaths and out-breaths associated with the direct knowledges

original: kriyābhiññājavanañca puggalānurūpaṃ paññattiyā saha catubbhūmakadhammesu kiñci ārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: kriyā abhiññā javanam ca puggala anurūpam paññattiyā saha catubbhūmaka dhammesu kiñci ārammaṇam
translated: are not unable to make any one of the four-based ideas their object according to the kind of designation appropriate to the person,

original: kātuṃ nasakkontīti natthi. Tathā tesaṃ purecāri kamanodvārāvajjanañcāti vuttaṃ ṭhāṇasampayutta.La.🔽Sabbathāpisabbā rammaṇānīti. Tattha sabbathāpīti sabbakāmāvacara sabbamahaggata sabbalokuttara🔽sabbapaññatti sabbapaccuppannādi pakārenapītiattho. Idañca sabbaññubuddhānaṃ uppannāni
analyzed: kātum na sakkonti iti natthi tathā tesam purecāri kamanodvāra āvajjanam ca ati vuttam  sabbathā api sabbā rammaṇāni iti tattha sabbathā api iti sabba kāmāvacara sabba mahaggata sabba lokuttara  sabba paññatti sabba paccuppanna ādi pakārena pi iti atthaḥ idam ca sabbaññu buddhānam uppannāni
translated: and so there is no such thing as their not being able to do so. And so too with their adverting at the mind door that precedes the in-breaths and out-breaths.🔽In every way, all ideas: here the meaning is that in every way, in all the kinds of ideas, namely, all those in the sense-desire world, all those in the fine-material world, all those in the immaterial world, all those supramundane, all those past, all those future, all those present,

original: sandhāya vuttaṃ. Itarāni pana pacceka buddhānaṃ uppannānipi padesasabbārammaṇānieva
analyzed: sandhāya vuttam itarāni pana pacceka buddhānam uppannāni pi padesa sabba ārammaṇāni eva
translated: and this is said with reference to the kinds of ideas arisen in omniscient Buddhas. But those arisen in Paccekabuddhas and Buddhas’ disciples are only objects of limited ideas.

original: honti. Tāni hi ekaṃ pathavidhātuṃpi sabbehi anavasesapakārehi jānituṃ nasakkontīti.🔽Āruppesu dutīyacatutthāni pathamatatīyāruppa viññāṇā rammaṇattā mahaggatā rammaṇāni.🔽Sesānīti abhiññā dvaya dutīyacatutthāruppehi avasesāni sabbānipi ekavīsatividhāni
analyzed: honti tāni hi ekam sabbehi anavasesa pakārehi jānitum na sakkonti iti  āruppesu dutīya catutthāni pathama tatīya āruppa viññāṇā rammaṇattā mahaggatā rammaṇāni  sesāni iti abhiññā dvaya dutīya catuttha āruppehi avasesāni sabbāni pi ekavīsatividhāni
translated: for they are unable to know even one of the four primary elements in all its aspects.🔽In the immaterial states, the second and fourth are the great primaries, since the first and third are the consciousnesses of the fine-material-sphere jhānas that are their objects.🔽The rest are the twenty-one kinds of great-primary consciousnesses that have as their objects the concepts of the kasiṇa and so on.

original: mahaggatacittāni kasiṇādi paññattārammaṇānīti attho. Pañcavīsāti pañcadvārāvajjana
analyzed: mahaggata cittāni kasiṇa ādi paññatta ārammaṇāni iti attho pañcavīsā ati pañca dvāra āvajjana
translated: The twenty-five are the five-door adverting consciousness,🔽the twenty-two kinds of sense-sphere result, and the laughing consciousness.

original: tevīsati kāmavipāka hasanacittāni sandhāya vuttaṃ. Parittamhīti kāmāvacarā lambaṇe🔽evāti attho. Tañhi appānubhāvato paṭibandhakadhammehi parisamantato dīyati avakhaṇḍīyati
analyzed: sandhāya vuttam parittamhi iti kāmāvacarāḥ lambaṇe  eva ati attho tat hi appa anubhāvato paṭibandhaka dhammehi parisamantataḥ dīyati avakhaṇḍīyati
translated: The limited is the sense-sphere registration consciousness.🔽For that is called “limited” because it is weak and is surrounded, is not separated, by states that are impediments.

original: nittejabhāvaṃ pāpīyatīti parittanti vuccati.
analyzed: nitteja bhāvam pāpīyati iti parittanti vuccati
translated: It is brought to a low state of heat.

original: 135. Cakkhādīnaṃ vatthūnaṃ bhedena tabbatthukānaṃ cittacetasi kānaṃ saṅgaho vatthusaṅgaho.
analyzed: cakkha ādīnam vatthūnam bhedena tad batthukānam citta cetasi kānam saṅgahaḥ vatthu saṅgahaḥ
translated: The classification according to the physical basis is the classification of the consciousnesses and their concomitants according to the physical basis consisting of the eye, etc.,

original: [109] Vibhāvaniyaṃ pana
analyzed: vibhāvaniyam pana
translated: In the Vibhaṅga, however, it is said:

original: “Vatthuvibhāgato tabbatthukacittaparicchedavasenaca saṅgaho vatthusaṅgaho”ti vuttaṃ. Taṃ na sundaraṃ.
analyzed: vatthu vibhāgataḥ tad batthuka citta pariccheda vasena ca saṅgahaḥ vatthu saṅgahaḥ ti vuttam tam na sundaram
translated: “The ‘aggregate of physical basis’ is the aggregate of the physical bases and the aggregate of the kinds of consciousness that have those physical bases as their object.” This is not good.

original: Vasantipatiṭṭhahanti cittacetasikāetesūtivatthūni, cakkhuvatthuca. La. Kāyavatthucahadayavatthucātiyojanā.
analyzed: citta cetasikā etesu uti vatthūni cakkhu vatthu ca kāya vatthu ca hadaya vatthu ca atiyojanā
translated: The physical bases are so called because the mind and mental factors rest on them, just as the earth is the physical basis for the world. The eye is the physical basis for the eye-consciousness element and for the states associated with that consciousness. The ear, etc., are the physical bases for the ear-consciousness element, etc. The body is the physical basis for the body-consciousness element and for the states associated with that consciousness. The heart is the physical basis for the mind element and for the states associated with that consciousness.

original: Cakkhumeva cakkhuvatthu tathā sotādīniyeva sotavatthādīni. Vākyasaṅkhepo hesa pāṭho.
analyzed: cakkhum eva cakkhu vatthu tathā sota ādīni iva sota vattha ādīni vākya saṅkhepaḥ ha isa pāṭhaḥ
translated: The eye itself is the physical basis for the eye-consciousness element, and likewise the ear, etc., are the physical bases for the ear-consciousness element, etc. This is the reading in the text, which is an abbreviation of the sentence.

original: Peyyālanayotipi antadīpakanayotipi vattuṃ yujjati. Keci pana dvandasamāsaṃ maññanti.🔽Tesaṃ casaddo nayujjati. Parato vatthusaddo casaddoca pubbapadesu ānetabbotipi vadanti.
analyzed: anta dīpaka nayā itipi vattum yujjati keci pana dvanda samāsam maññanti  tesam ca saddaḥ paratas vatthu saddo ca saddo ca pubba padesu ānetabbaḥ iti pi vadanti
translated: It is also appropriate to say “in the manner of the ‘peyyāla’” or “in the manner of the ‘antaka’” . But some construe it as a dvanda compound.🔽For them the word “and” is not appropriate. Others say that the word “physical basis” and the word “and” should be supplied in the preceding terms.

original: Tesaṃ hadayavatthūti samāsapadaṃ nayujjati. Avibhattikaniddesotipi apare. Tāni kāmaloke
analyzed: tesam samāsa padam apare tāni kāmaloke
translated: For them the compound “heart-physical-basis” is not appropriate. Others say that it is a compound without a case ending. All of these are found

original: sabbānipi labbhantīti kāmataṇhā dhina kammanibbattānaṃ attabhāvānaṃeva paripuṇṇindriyatā
analyzed: sabbāni api labbhanti iti kāma taṇhā kamma nibbattānam atta bhāvānam eva paripuṇṇa indriya tā
translated: in the sense-desire world. The completeness of the faculties is due to the kamma of beings subject to craving for sense desires.

original: sambhavato sabbānipi tāni cha vatthūni kāmalokeeva labbhanti. Tathā hi cakkhādīsu
analyzed: sambhavato sabbāni pi tāni cha vatthūni kāmaloke eva labbhanti tathā hi cakkha ādīsu
translated: All these six bases are only the world of sensuality. For when the eye, etc.,

original: vatthūsu santesu evarūpādīnaṃ paribhogo sampajjati. Tasmā rūpādīsu kāmavatthūsu abhiratā🔽kāmataṇhā sadā cakkhādīnaṃ pañcannaṃ vatthūnaṃpi sampattiṃ patthetiyeva. Yathāca
analyzed: vatthūsu santesu eva rūpa ādīnam paribhogaḥ sampajjati tasmā rūpa ādīsu kāma vatthūsu abhiratā  kāma taṇhā sadā cakkha ādīnam pañcannam vatthūnam pi sampattim yathā ca
translated: are present, the enjoyment of such visible data, etc., as are mentioned is possible. Therefore, when beings delight in the visible-data base, etc., as sensuality,

original: sabbakammiko amacco sadā rañño icchameva pūrayamāno sabbāni rājakammāni sampādeti.🔽Evameva kāmāvacarakammaṃpi sadā kāmataṇhāya icchameva pūrayamānaṃ paripuṇṇindriyaṃ
analyzed: sabbakammikaḥ amaccaḥ sadā raññaḥ iccham eva pūrayamānaḥ sabbāni rāja kammāni sampādeti  evam eva sadā kāma taṇhāya iccham eva pūrayamānam paripuṇṇa indriyam
translated: then craving for sensuality always seeks the excellence of the eye, etc., the five bases. And just as a minister who is a doer of all the king’s duties always fulfills the king’s wishes and so accomplishes all the king’s duties,

original: attabhāvaṃ nibbatteti. Tasmā kāmataṇhādhinakammanibbattā kāmasattāeva paripuṇṇindriyā🔽hontīti. Yathā ca dassanasavanānuttariya dhammabhūtāni cakkhusotāni buddhadassana
analyzed: atta bhāvam nibbattā iti tasmā kāma taṇhā adhina kamma nibbattā kāma sattā eva paripuṇṇa indriyā  honti iti yathā ca dassana savana anuttariya dhamma bhūtāni cakkhu sotāni buddha dassana
translated: so too, sense-desire-originated kamma always fulfills the wish of craving for sensuality and so produces a personality with complete faculties. That is why only beings born of sense-desire-originated kamma have complete faculties.

original: dhammassavanā divasena sattānaṃ visuddhiyāpi honti, na tathā ghānādittayaṃ. Taṃ pana
analyzed: dhammassavanāḥ divasena sattānam visuddhiyā api honti na tathā tam pana
translated: And just as the eye and ear, which are the supreme Dhamma, are the means of purification for beings by seeing and hearing the Enlightened One and the True Dhamma respectively, so the three beginning with the nose are not.

original: kevalaṃ kāmaparibhogatthāyaeva hoti. Tasmā taṃ kāmavirāgabhāvanā kammanibbattesu
analyzed: kevalam kāma paribhoga tthāya eva hoti tasmā tam kāma virāga bhāvanā kamma nibbattesu
translated: and it is only for the purpose of enjoyment of sensual desires. That is why it is said that it is not found in the Brahma-world, which is created by the kamma of those who have developed the meditation that ends in the fading out of sense desire.

original: brahmattabhāvesu naupalabbhatīti vuttaṃ rūpaloke pana ghānādittayaṃ natthīti. Idañca
analyzed: brahmatta bhāvesu vuttam rūpa loke pana natthi iti idam ca
translated: But in the fine-material world there is no nose, etc.,

original: pasādarūpattayaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Sasambhāraghāna jivhā kāya saṇṭhānānipana suṭṭhuparipuṇṇānieva🔽hontīti. Arūpalokepana sabbānipi nasaṃvijjantīti rūpavirāga bhāvanā kammanibbatte
analyzed: pasāda rūpa ttayam sandhāya vuttam saṇṭhānāni pana suṭṭhu paripuṇṇāni eva  honti iti sabbāni api na saṃvijjanti iti rūpa virāga bhāvanā kamma nibbatte
translated: and this is said with respect to the three sensitive material instances. But the nose, tongue, and body with their supports are quite complete there.🔽And in the immaterial world all these are absent.

original: tasmiṃ loke ajjhattabahiddhāsantānesupi sabbena sabbaṃ rūpapavattiyāeva abhāvato.
analyzed: tasmin loke ajjhatta bahiddhā santānesu pi sabbena sabbam rūpa pavattiyā eva abhāvataḥ
translated: For in that world, which is created by the kamma of those who have developed the meditation that ends in the fading out of materiality, there is no occurrence of materiality at all, either internally or externally.

original: Tattha nibbattā hi sattā suddhe ākāsataleeva cittapabandhamattā hutvā tiṭṭhantīti.🔽Imasmiṃ saṅgahe pana cittāni sattaviññāṇa dhātuvasena gahetuṃ tattha pañcaviññāṇadhātuyotiādi
analyzed: tattha nibbattā hi sattā suddhe ākāsa tale eva citta pabandha mattāḥ hutvā tiṭṭhanti iti  imasmin saṅgahe pana cittāni satta viññāṇa dhātu vasena gahetum tattha
translated: For the beings who are reborn there stand in the pure space of the base consisting of boundless space as if in a pavilion.🔽But in this manual the kinds of consciousness are given under the heading of the seven kinds of resultant consciousness. That is why it is said, “In the five-constituent kind of becoming there are five kinds of sense-sphere consciousness” .

original: vuttaṃ. Tatthāti tesu chasu vatthūsu. Pañcaviññāṇāni eva nisattanijīvaṭṭhena dhātuyoti
analyzed: vuttam tattha ati tesu chasu vatthūsu pañca viññāṇāni eva nisatta nijīva ṭṭhena dhātuyo ti
translated: Herein, in the five-constituent kind of becoming, there are five kinds of sense-sphere consciousness, namely, eye-, ear-, nose-, tongue-, and body-consciousness. These are called “dhātu” in the sense of a “mine” , since they are the source of the defilements and of the jhānas, etc.,

original: viggaho. Evaṃ sesesupi. Vijānanakiccābhāvato mananamattā dhātūti manodhātu. Pañcadvāre
analyzed: viggahaḥ evam sesesu pi vijānana kicca abhāvataḥ manana mattā dhātu uti manodhātu pañca dvāre
translated: The rest should be understood in the same way. The mind element is so called because it is mere reflection since it lacks the function of cognizing. In the five doors

original: āvajjanamatta sampaṭicchanamatta kiccāni hi visesajānana kiccāni nahontīti. Pañcaviññāṇāni
analyzed: āvajjana matta sampaṭicchana matta kiccāni hi visesa jānana kiccāni na honti iti pañca viññāṇāni
translated: the functions of mere adverting and mere receiving are not the functions of special knowing. But the five consciousnesses

original: pana paccakkhato dassanādivasena thokaṃ visesajānanakiccāni honti. Avasesā pana santīraṇādayo🔽ārammaṇasabhāva vicāraṇā divasena atireka visiṭṭhajānanakiccayuttattā na manodhātuyo🔽viya mananamattā honti. Nāpi pañcaviññāṇadhātuyoviya vijānana mattā. Athakho mananaṭṭhena🔽manoca taṃ vijānanaṭṭhena viññāṇañcāti katvā manoviññāṇadhātuyonāma. Atisaya visesajānana
analyzed: pana paccakkhatas dassana ādi vasena thokam visesa jānana kiccāni honti avasesā pana santīraṇa ādayo                      viya manana mattāḥ honti na api pañca viññāṇa dhātuyo viya vijānana mattāḥ atha kho manana ṭṭhena  tam vijānana ṭṭhena viññāṇam ca ati katvā atisaya visesa jānana
translated: do have the function of special knowing to a slight extent, since they are respectively the seeing, etc., of visible objects, etc., by direct experience. But the rest,

original: dhātuyoti attho. Pariyāyapadānañhi visesana samāse atisayattho viññāyati. Yathā padaṭṭhānanti.
analyzed: dhātuyo ti samāse atisaya tthaḥ viññāyati yathā padaṭṭhānam ti
translated: which are applied thought, etc., are not mere reflection like the mind element, since they are associated with the function of special knowing by investigating the individual essences of objects, etc. Nor are they mere cognizing like the five consciousness elements. But rather they are called mind-consciousness element because they are mind in the sense of reflecting and they are consciousness in the sense of cognizing. The meaning is: element of special knowing. For in a descriptive compound the meaning of excess is recognized, as in the words “the foot of the tree” .

original: [110] Vibhāvaniyaṃ pana
analyzed: vibhāvaniyam pana
translated: But in the Vibhāṇa it is said:

original: “Manoyeva viññāṇaṃ manoviññāṇanti vā. Manaso viññāṇaṃ manoviññāṇa”nti vā vuttaṃ. Tattha manoyeva viññāṇanti idaṃ tāva na yujjati.
analyzed: manaḥ yā iva viññāṇam manaḥ viññāṇanti vā manasaḥ viññāṇam manaḥ viññāṇanti vā vuttam tattha manaḥ yā iva viññāṇanti idam tāva na yujjati
translated: “‘Mind-consciousness’ is either mind itself or consciousness, or consciousness of mind.” Herein, “mind itself is consciousness” is not tenable.

original: Na hi aññamaññaṃ visesetvā abhirekaṭṭhadīpake padaṭṭhānantiādike visesanasamāse avadhāraṇa viggaho katthaci dissati yujjaticāti.
analyzed: na hi aññam aññam visesetvā abhireka ṭṭha dīpake padaṭṭhāna nti ādike visesana samāse avadhāraṇa viggahaḥ katthaci dissati
translated: For in no instance is a restrictive specification seen in a co- locative compound such as “basis of what is specified” , etc.,

original: [111] Manaso viññāṇanti idaṃpi nayujjatiyeva.🔽Manasoti hi manodhātuttikasaṅkhātassa manassa. Tattha sampaṭicchanadvayaṃ santīraṇādikassa🔽manoviññāṇapabandhassa paccayabhūtaṃ hoti. Pañcadvārāvajjanaṃ pana parato dvārantare
analyzed: manasaḥ viññāṇanti idam pi  manasaḥ ti hi manaḥ dhātu tika saṅkhātassa manassa tattha sampaṭicchana dvayam santīraṇa ādikassa  manaḥ viññāṇa pabandhassa paccaya bhūtam hoti pañca dvāra āvajjanam pana paratas dvāra antare
translated: “Consciousness of mind” is not tenable either.

original: pavattamānaṃ tasseva manoviññāṇapabandhassa paccayuppannabhūtaṃ hotītikatvā ādimhi
analyzed: pavattamānam tassa iva manaḥ viññāṇa pabandhassa paccaya uppanna bhūtam hoti iti katvā ādimhi
translated: For “mind” is the mind called the mind element and the mind base. Herein, the pair of contacts is a condition for the occurrence of the consciousness called mind-consciousness, which is the mind element and the mind base. But the adverting at the five doors is a condition for the occurrence of the same mind-consciousness occurrence, which is the mind element and the mind base, that arises next in the mind door.🔽Thus it is said that the adverting at the five doors is a condition for the occurrence of the same mind-consciousness occurrence, which is the mind element and the mind base, that arises next in the mind door.

original: paccayabhūtassa ceva ante dvārantare paccayuppannabhūtassa ca manassa sambandhiviññāṇanti
analyzed: paccaya bhūtassa ca iva ante dvāra antare paccaya uppanna bhūtassa ca manassa sambandhi viññāṇanti
translated: So it is the consciousness that is related to the mind that is a condition at the beginning and that is related to the mind that is a condition at the end.

original: attho. Athavā, pañcaviññāṇavajjitāni sabbāni viññāṇāni mananakiccattā manonāma. Ārammaṇe🔽pana abhinipāta mattāni pañcaviññāṇāni mananakiccāni nahontīti dassanādīni eva nāma.
analyzed: atthaḥ athavā pañca viññāṇa vajjitāni sabbāni viññāṇāni manana kiccattā manaḥ nāma ārammaṇe  pana abhinipāta mattāni pañca viññāṇāni manana kiccāni nahonti iti dassana ādīni eva nāma
translated: Or alternatively, all the consciousnesses except the five consciousnesses are called mind because of the function of measuring. But the five consciousnesses, which are only the mere arrival at the objective field, do not measure, so seeing, etc., are not mind.

original: Pañcadvārāvajjanañca manato jātaṃpi manassa paccayo nahoti. Dassanādīnaṃ eva paccayo.
analyzed: manataḥ jātam pi manassa paccayaḥ na hoti dassana ādīnam eva paccayaḥ
translated: And though the adverting of the five doors arises from mind, it is not a condition for mind; it is a condition for seeing, etc., only.

original: Sampaṭicchanadvayañca manassa paccayo hontaṃpi manato jātaṃ nahoti. Dassanādito eva🔽jātaṃ. Santīraṇādīni pana attano pure pacchāpavattānaṃ dvinnaṃ dvinnaṃ manānaṃ eva
analyzed: sampaṭicchana dvayam ca manassa paccayaḥ hontam pi manataḥ jātam na hoti dassana āditaḥ eva  jātam santīraṇa ādīni pana attano pure pacchā apavattānam dvinnam dvinnam eva
translated: And though the two kinds of receiving are a condition for mind, they do not arise from mind; they arise from seeing, etc., only.

original: majjhe jātānīti attano paccaya paccayuppannabhūtassa manassa sambandhiviññāṇanti🔽attho. Evañca sati pañcaviññāṇaṃpi dvinnaṃ manodhātūnaṃ antare pavattattā manaso
analyzed: majjhe jātāni iti attanaḥ paccaya paccaya uppanna bhūtassa manassa sambandhi viññāṇanti  evam ca sati pañca viññāṇam pi dvinnam manaḥ dhātūnam antare pavatta tā manasaḥ
translated: But the determining, etc., arise between the two kinds of measuring that occur earlier and later, respectively, and so they are the consciousness related to the condition that is the mind arisen next to them.

original: paccaya paccayuppannabhūtassa sambandhiviññāṇaṃ manoviññāṇanti vattabbameva siyāti.
analyzed: paccaya paccaya uppanna bhūtassa sambandhi viññāṇam manaḥ viññāṇan ti vattabbam eva siyāti
translated: This is the meaning. And that being so, it is only right that the five consciousnesses should be called “mind-consciousness” since they are the consciousness related to the condition that is the mind arisen next to the two kinds of mind element.

original: [112] Ṭīkāyaṃ pana
analyzed: ṭīkā ayam pana
translated: But in the Commentary

original: Manato jātaṃ viññāṇantipi vuttaṃ. Taṃpi vuttanayena nayujjatiyeva.
analyzed: manataḥ jātam viññāṇan ti pi vuttam tam pi vutta nayena
translated: and it is said to be born of mind. That too can be interpreted in the way already given.

original: Avasesā pana manoviññāṇadhātusaṅkhātāca santīraṇa.La. Pannarasarūpāvacaravasena tiṃsadhammā🔽hadayaṃ nissāyeva pavattantīti yojanā. Casaddo panettha avasesānaṃ chasattati dhammānaṃ
analyzed: avasesā pana manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu saṅkhātā ca panna rasa rūpāvacara vasena tiṃsa dhammā  hadayam nissāya iva pavattanti iti yojanā ca saddaḥ pana ittha avasesānam cha sattati dhammānam
translated: The remaining kinds of consciousness, which are called the mind element, and the investigating, etc., which are the fifteen kinds of sense-sphere consciousness,🔽are the thirty states that occur only in dependence on the heart.

original: manoviññāṇadhātubhāvaṃ sambhāveti.
analyzed: manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu bhāvam sambhāveti
translated: The word “and” implies that the remaining seventy-six states are the mind-consciousness element.

original: [113] Vibhāvaniyaṃ pana
analyzed: vibhāvaniyam pana
translated: But in the Vibhaṅga,

original: Sampiṇḍanatthaṃ gahetvā “na kevalaṃ manodhātuyevā”ti vuttaṃ. Taṃ na yujjati.
analyzed: sampiṇḍana attham gahetvā na kevalam manaḥ dhātuyā iva iti vuttam tam na yujjati
translated: the word “and” is taken to mean “inclusive” and is explained as follows: “Not only the mind element but also … the mind-consciousness element.” That is not correct.

original: Evañhi sati avasesāca manoviññāṇadhātusaṅkhātāti vuttaṃ siyāti.
analyzed: evam hi sati avasesā ca manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu saṅkhātā ti vuttam siyāti
translated: For if it were, then the remaining kinds of consciousness would have to be called the mind-consciousness element.

original: [114] Yāca ṭīkāsu
analyzed: yāca ṭīkāsu
translated: In the commentaries,

original: Santīraṇa.La. Rūpāvacaravasena pavattā, avasesā manoviññāṇa dhātusaṅkhātāca tiṃsa dhammāti yojanā. Sāpi na sundarā.
analyzed: rūpāvacara vasena pavattāḥ avasesāḥ manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu saṅkhātāḥ ca tiṃsa dhammā ati yojanā sā api na sundarā
translated: the explanation is given as follows: “The investigating, etc., which occur as the fine-material-sphere consciousness, and the remaining kinds of consciousness, which are called the mind-consciousness element, are the thirty states.” That is not a good explanation.🔽because it is not clear what is intended.

original: Atthagatiyā avisadattāti. Tattha kasmā te nissāyeva pavattantīti. Āruppesu anuppajjanato,
analyzed: atthagatiyā a visadattā ati tattha kasmā te nissāya iva pavattanti iti āruppesu an uppajjanato
translated: Why do they occur only in dependence on the heart? Because they do not occur in the immaterial-sphere jhānas.

original: kasmāca tattha nuppajjantīti vuccate. Santīraṇamahāvipākāni tāva tattha nuppajjanti
analyzed: kasmāca tattha nuppajjanti iti vuccate santīraṇa mahā vipākāni tāva tattha nuppajjanti
translated: Why do they not arise there? The great results of the investigation of the four noble truths do not arise there.

original: pañcannaṃ dvārānaṃ attano kiccānañca tattha abhāvato. Paṭighacittadvayaṃpi nuppajjati.
analyzed: pañcannam dvārānam tattha abhāvataḥ paṭigha citta dvayam pi nuppajjati
translated: Why do they not arise there? It may be stated as follows. The three rooted in hate do not arise there because of the absence of the five doors and their own objective fields.

original: Anīvaraṇāvatthassa paṭighassa abhāvato. Ekanta nīvaraṇānañca jhānabhūmīsu asambhavato.
analyzed: anīvaraṇa avatthassa paṭighassa abhāvato ekanta nīvaraṇānañca jhāna bhūmīsu asambhavato
translated: The two rooted in greed do not arise there because there is no obstruction there and because the state of being an obstruction is impossible in the jhāna plane.

original: Ettha pana yadi anīvaraṇāvattho paṭigho natthi. Pāḷiyaṃ dutīyajjhāneeva domassindriyassa
analyzed: ettha pana yadi paṭighaḥ natthi pāḷiyam dutīya jhāne eva
translated: But here it might be argued: “If there is no obstruction there, then why is it said in the texts that the second jhāna is ‘with happiness and bliss born of seclusion’?

original: aparisesanirodhavacanaṃ aṭṭhakathāsuca dutīyajjhānūpacāre tassa uppattisambhavavacanaṃ🔽viruddhaṃ siyā. Tasmā attano sahāyapaccaya bhūtassa oḷārikassa kāmarāgassa jhānabhūmīsu
analyzed: aparisesa nirodha vacanam aṭṭhakathāsu ca dutīya jjhāna upacāre tassa uppatti sambhava vacanam  viruddham siyā tasmai attano sahāya paccaya bhūtassa oḷārikassa kāmarāgassa jhāna bhūmīsu
translated: And why is it said in the commentaries that the faculty of agitation exists in the second jhāna as access?🔽This would be contradictory. So it should be understood that the two rooted in hate do not arise there because there is no gross greed there that is a proximate cause for them.”

original: abhāvato paṭighacittadvayaṃ tattha nuppajjatīti yuttantipi vadanti. Ṭīkākārāpana🔽dutīyajjhānūpacāre tassa uppattisambhava vacanaṃ parikappavacanamattanti katvā purimakāraṇameva
analyzed: abhāvato paṭigha citta dvayam tattha nuppajjati iti vadanti 🔽dutīya jjhāna upacāre tassa uppatti sambhava vacanam katvā purima kāraṇam eva
translated: The commentators, however, say that the statement that the faculty of agitation exists in the second jhāna as access is merely a concession.🔽The reason given above is the correct one.

original: icchanti. Yadi panetaṃ parikappavacanamattaṃ siyā pāḷivacanaṃpi parikappavacanamattameva
analyzed: icchanti yadi pana etam parikappa vacana mattam siyā pāḷi vacanam pi parikappa vacana mattam eva
translated: If this were mere supposition, then the words of the text would be mere supposition too.🔽So our view is that the last is the right one.

original: siyā. Tasmā pacchimakā raṇameva yuttarūpanti amhākaṃ khanti. Hasanacittaṃpi nuppajjati🔽arūpīnaṃ hasanakiccassa abhāvato. Kāyābhāvatotipi yujjati. Sotāpattimaggacittaṃpi
analyzed: siyā amhākam khanti hasana cittam pi nuppajjati  arūpīnam hasana kiccassa abhāvato kāya abhāvato tipi yujjati sotāpatti magga cittam pi
translated: The mind element does not arise there because there is no function of laughing there.

original: nuppajjati. Paratoghosābhāvena tatthuppannassa puthujjanassa dhammābhisamayābhāvato
analyzed: na uppajjati paratoghosa abhāvena tattha uppannassa puthujjanassa dhamma abhisamaya abhāvato
translated: The mind element of the path of stream-entry does not arise there because the ordinary man who has arisen there has no penetration of the Dhamma by understanding born of another’s utterance,

original: buddhapaccekabuddhānañca tattha anuppajjanato. Teneva hi tatthuppanno puthujjano🔽aṭṭhasu akkhaṇayuttesu vuttoti. Rūpāvacaracittānipi tattha nuppajjanti rūpavirāgabhāvanāya
analyzed: buddha paccekabuddhānañca tattha anuppajjanato tena iva hi tattha uppannaḥ puthujjanaḥ  aṭṭhasu akkhaṇa yuttesu vuttaḥ ti rūpāvacara cittāni pi tattha nuppajjanti rūpa virāga bhāvanāya
translated: and because Buddhas and Paccekabuddhas do not arise there.🔽That is why the ordinary man who has arisen there is called “one who has entered the eight inopportune conditions” .

original: rūpanimittārammaṇānaṃ tesaṃ samatikkantattāti.
analyzed: rūpa nimitta ārammaṇānam tesam samatikkanta ttā ti
translated: The mind element of the fine-material sphere does not arise there because the sign of materiality has been surpassed by the development of the surmounting of the fine-material.

original: Avasesā manoviññāṇadhātusaṅkhātā kusalākusalakriyānuttaravasena dve cattālīsadhammā
analyzed: avasesā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu saṅkhātā kusala akusala kriyā anuttara vasena dve cattālīsa dhammā
translated: The remaining forty-two states consisting of the profitable, unprofitable, and functional mind elements called mind-consciousness element—

original: hadayaṃ nissāyavā anissāyavā pavattantīti yojanā. Nissāyavā pañcavokāre anissāyavā
analyzed: hadayam nissāyavā a nissāyavā pavattanti iti yojanā nissāyavā pañcavokāre a nissāyavā
translated: The interpretation is that they occur with the heart-basis and without it. Those with a heart-basis are in the five-constituent kind of becoming;🔽those without a heart-basis are in the four-constituent kind of becoming.

original: catuvokāreti adhippāyo. Kusalānica akusalānica kriyānica anuttarānicāti viggaho.🔽Tattha kusalānīti pañcarūpa kusalato avasesāni dvādasalokiyakusalāni. Akusalānīti🔽paṭighadvayato avasesāni dasaakusalāni. Kriyānīti pañcadvārāvajjana hasana pañcarūpakrito
analyzed: catu vokāra iti adhippāyaḥ kusalāni ca akusalāni ca kriyāni ca anuttarāni ca ati viggahaḥ  tattha kusalāni iti avasesāni dvādasa lokiya kusalāni akusalāni iti  paṭigha dvayataḥ avasesāni dasa akusalāni kriyāni iti
translated: The analysis is into profitable, unprofitable, functional, and indeterminate.

original: avasesāni terasakriyacittāni. Anuttarānīti pathamamaggato avasesāni sattaanuttaracittāni.
analyzed: avasesāni terasa kriya cittāni anuttarāni iti pathama maggataḥ avasesāni satta anuttara cittāni
translated: Herein, the profitable are the twelve mundane kinds of profitable consciousness in the sense sphere, leaving out the five profitable consciousnesses accompanied by joy. The unprofitable are the ten kinds of unprofitable consciousness, leaving out the two kinds accompanied by joy. The functional are the thirteen kinds of functional consciousness, leaving out the five-door adverting, laughing, and the five kinds of functional consciousness accompanied by joy.
