original: sandhāya voṭṭhabbanādīni pañcadvārikānipi gahitāniti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Etthaca iriyāpathonāma🔽gamanādinā tena tena avatthāvisesena pavattā rūpadhammāeva. Evaṃ santepi kiñcicittaṃ
analyzed: sandhāya voṭṭhabbana ādīni gahitāni iti daṭṭhabbam ettha ca iriyāpathaḥ nāma  gamana ādinā tena tena avatthā avisesena pavattāḥ rūpa dhammāḥ eva evam sante pi
translated: do not give rise to intimation. Or the five-door adverting consciousnesses are included by the words “the support of deportment” and “the state of being grasped as a continuity,”🔽and so on. Herein, the “deportment” is the material phenomena that occur in the various postures such as going and so on.

original: rūpa sāmaññameva janeti na tatoparaṃ. Kiñci aññacittassa vasena yathāpavattaṃ iriyāpathaṃ
analyzed: rūpa sāmaññam eva janeti na tatas uparam kiñci añña cittassa vasena yathāpavattam iriyāpatham
translated: Even though this is so, some consciousnesses give rise to material phenomena that are similar to themselves, but no further than that. Some consciousnesses give rise to deportment that occurs according to the influence of other consciousnesses.

original: rakkhituṃeva sakkoti, na appavattaṃ iriyāpathaṃ pavattetuṃ. Kiñci viññattiṃ samuṭṭhāpetvā🔽appavattañca iriyāpathaṃ pavattetuṃ sakkoti. Aññānica kāyika vācasika vikārāni janetuṃ
analyzed: rakkhitum eva sakkoti na appavattam iriyāpatham pavattetum kiñci viññattim samuṭṭhāpetvā  appavattam ca iriyāpatham pavattetum sakkoti aññāni ca kāyika vācasika vikārāni janetum
translated: but it cannot cause the occurrence of a posture that has not already occurred.🔽It can cause the occurrence of a posture that has already occurred and also cause the arising of any bodily or verbal intimation.

original: sakkoti. Yānica cittāni uttarakiccaṃ janetuṃ sakkonti. Tāni heṭṭhimaheṭṭhimaṃ kiccaṃ
analyzed: sakkoti yāni ca cittāni uttara kiccam janetum sakkonti tāni heṭṭhima heṭṭhimam kiccam
translated: And it can cause the occurrence of any of the kinds of consciousness that can cause the next consciousness to arise.

original: janetuṃ sakkontiyevāti dassanatthaṃ ayaṃ vibhāgo katoti veditabbo.
analyzed: janetum sakkontiyā iva āti dassana attham ayam vibhāgaḥ kataḥ iti veditabbaḥ
translated: It should be understood that this is the explanation of the occurrence of the kinds of consciousness in order to show that the lower can cause the occurrence of the higher.

original: [196] Yaṃ pana vibhāvaniyaṃ
analyzed: yam pana
translated: But in the analysis it is said:🔽“But the consciousness that causes intimation is the cause of the occurrence of the posture, since the posture is invariably conascent with intimation.”

original: “Yaṃpana cittaṃ viññattijanakaṃ, taṃ ekaṃsato iriyāpathu patthambhakaṃ. Iriyā pathassa viññattiyā saha avinābhāvato”ti vuttaṃ. Taṃ na yujjati.
analyzed: yat pana cittam viññatti janakam tat ekaṃsataḥ iriyāpathu patthambhakam iriyā pathassa viññattiyā saha avinābhāvato ti vuttam tat na yujjati
translated: That is not right.

original: Idha hi iriyāpathupatthambhanaṃnāma viññattirahitamevā dhippetaṃ, na viññattisahitaṃ.
analyzed: idha hi iriyāpathu patthambhanam nāma viññatti rahitam evā dhippetam na viññatti sahitam
translated: For here the cause of the occurrence of the posture is intended as not invariably conascent with intimation.

original: Itarathā appanājavanānaṃpi viññattijanakatā āpajjeyyāti. Somanassajavanāni terasāti
analyzed: itarathā appanā javanānam pi viññatti janaka tā āpajjeyya ati somanassa javanāni terasa ati
translated: Otherwise, the impulsion of the absorption would be the cause of intimation.🔽Thirteen kinds of joy impulsions.

original: hasituppādena saddhiṃ lobhamūlato mahā kusalato mahā kriyato ca cattāricattārīti
analyzed: hasituppādena saddhim lobha mūlataḥ mahā kusalataḥ mahā kriyataḥ ca cattāri cattāri iti
translated: With the arising of laughter, there are four each from the profitable and from the root-cause greed, and four each from the great primaries and from the function,

original: terasa somanassajavanāni. Tesupana kusalā kusalato aṭṭhaputhujjanānaṃ. Diṭṭhivippayuttā
analyzed: terasa somanassa javanāni tesu pana kusalā kusalataḥ aṭṭha puthujjanānam diṭṭhi vippayuttā
translated: making thirteen impulsions of joy. But of these, the profitable are eight in number in the case of ordinary men, and in the case of those still on the path they are profitable and unprofitable,

original: kusalakusalato chasekkhānaṃ. Kriyato pañcakhīṇāsavānanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Sabbaṃ kāyavacīmanokammaṃ
analyzed: kusala kusalataḥ kriyataḥ pañca khīṇa āsavānam ti daṭṭhabbam sabbam kāya vacī manaḥ kammam
translated: and in the case of those who have reached the end of the path they are only functional. All bodily, verbal, and mental action

original: ñāṇapubbaṅgamaṃ ñāṇānuparivattanti vacanato vicāraṇakiccarahito hasituppādo sabbaññubuddhānaṃ
analyzed: ñāṇa pubbaṅgamam ñāṇa anuparivattanti vacanataḥ vicāraṇa kicca rahitaḥ hasita uppādaḥ sabbaññu buddhānam
translated: is “preceded by knowledge and accompanied by knowledge” . So laughter that arises without the function of investigation is impossible in omniscient Buddhas.

original: nasambhavatīti evaṃ pavatto vādo aṭṭhakathāyaṃ paṭikkhittoyeva. Tasmiṃvāde hi sati
analyzed: na sambhavati iti evam pavattaḥ vādaḥ aṭṭhakathā ayam tasmin vāde hi sati
translated: This doctrine, which is stated thus, is refuted in the commentary. For if it were so,

original: itaresaṃpi ahetukacittānaṃ ñāṇavippayuttamahā kriyajavanānañca buddhānaṃ asambhavo🔽āpajjati. Tasmā tesaṃ hasituppādacittena pavattassa sitakammassa pubbāparapavattānaṃ
analyzed: itaresam pi ahetuka cittānam ñāṇa vippayutta mahā kriya javanānam ca buddhānam asambhavaḥ  āpajjati tasmā tesam hasita uppāda cittena pavattassa sita kammassa pubba apara pavattānam
translated: then the other rootless consciousnesses and the great primaries and functional impulsions of Buddhas would be impossible.

original: ñāṇānaṃ vasena ñāṇapubbaṅgamatā ñāṇānuparivattatā ca veditabbāti. Sītuṇhotu samaññātāti
analyzed: ñāṇānam vasena ñāṇa pubbaṅgama tā ñāṇa anuparivatta tā ca veditabbā ati sītuṇhā tu samaññātā ati
translated: So it should be understood that the “preceded by knowledge” and “accompanied by knowledge” are in virtue of the knowledge that occurs in the prior and subsequent consciousnesses of the bodily and verbal action that occurs with the consciousness accompanied by joy. “Cold and heat are called”

original: idaṃ sītaṃ idaṃ uṇhanti evaṃ sabba lokiyamahājanehi suṭṭhu paricchinditvā ñātā. Ṭhitippattāvāti
analyzed: idam sītam idam uṇhanti evam lokiya mahājanehi suṭṭhu paricchinditvā ñātā ṭhiti ppattā avāti
translated: “This is cold, this is hot” and so on, and they are well known to all the world’s people. “They reach the state of presence”:

original: attano ṭhitibhāvaṃ ṭhitikkhaṇaṃvā pattāeva. Na pana cittamiva jāyanta mattāti attho. Kāraṇaṃ vuttameva.
analyzed: attanaḥ ṭhiti bhāvam ṭhiti kkhaṇam vā pattā eva na pana cittam iva jāyanta ati attho kāraṇam vuttam eva
translated: they reach the state of presence, the moment of presence, of themselves. The meaning is that they are not born, like consciousness. The reason has been given already.

original: [197] Yaṃ pana vibhāvaniyaṃ
analyzed: yam pana
translated: But in the Vibhaṅga it is said:

original: “Pacchājātādipaccayupatthambhalābhena ṭhitikkhaṇeeva utuojānaṃ balavabhāvoti vuttaṃ tejodhātu ṭhitippattātiādi”. Tattha pacchājātapaccayavacanaṃ heṭṭhā vicāritameva.
analyzed: pacchājāta ādi paccaya upatthambha lābhena ṭhiti kkhaṇe eva utu ojānam balava bhāvo ti vuttam tejodhātu ṭhiti ppattā tiādi tattha pacchājāta paccaya vacanam heṭṭhā vicāritam eva
translated: “The moment of presence of heat is the strength of heat. The strength of heat is the condition for the presence of material instances” . Herein, the words “condition for presence” have been discussed already .

original: Apica, yadi utuno balavabhāvo rūpuppādanañca pacchājātapaccayāyattaṃ siyā. Evaṃ sati
analyzed: apica yadi utunaḥ balava bhāvaḥ rūpa uppādanam ca pacchājāta paccaya āyattam siyā evam sati
translated: Besides, if the strength of heat and the production of material instances were dependent on the condition for presence,

original: so paṭisandhicittassa ṭhitikkhaṇe rūpaṃ na samuṭṭhāpeyya, tadā pacchājātapaccayasseva
analyzed: so paṭisandhi cittassa ṭhiti kkhaṇe rūpam na samuṭṭhāpeyya tadā pacchājāta paccayassa iva
translated: then it would not cause material instances to arise at the moment of presence of the rebirth-linking consciousness, because at that time

original: abhāvato. Vakkhatica ṭhitikālamupādāya utusamuṭṭhānāti. Etthaca ṭhitikālanti paṭisandhicittassa
analyzed: abhāvataḥ ṭhiti kālam upādāya utu samuṭṭhānā ti ettha ca ṭhiti kālanti paṭisandhi cittassa
translated: the condition for presence is absent. And it is said that “Heat is the condition for the presence of material instances beginning with the second moment” . Herein, the words “moment of presence” refer to the moment of presence of the rebirth-linking consciousness.

original: ṭhītikālo vuttoti. Tasmā pacchājātapaccayavacanaṃ vicāretvā sampaṭicchitabbanti.
analyzed: vuttaḥ ti tasmā pacchājāta paccaya vacanam vicāretvā sampaṭicchitabbanti
translated: So the explanation of the condition being subsequent should be understood after examining it.🔽The nutriment consisting of contact is the four kinds of nutriment classed as “consisting of contact” in the way already stated.🔽The nutriment consisting of mental volition is the four kinds of nutriment classed as “consisting of mental volition” in the way already stated.🔽The nutriment consisting of consciousness is the four kinds of nutriment classed as “consisting of consciousness” in the way already stated.

original: Ojāsaṅkhāto āhāroti kammasamuṭṭhānādivasena catubbidho ajjhattasantāna gatoasitapītakhāyitasāyitavasena
analyzed: ojā saṅkhātaḥ āhāraḥ ti kamma samuṭṭhāna ādi vasena catubbidhaḥ ajjhatta santāna gataḥ asita pīta khāyita sāyita vasena
translated: The nutriment consisting of edible food is the four kinds of nutriment classed as “consisting of edible food” in the way already stated.🔽The nutriment consisting of edible food is twofold as nutriment consisting of edible food internally and as nutriment consisting of edible food externally.

original: catubbidho, bahiddhasantā nagatoca ojāsaṅkhāto duvidhāhāro. Tadubhayāpica saṃsagga
analyzed: catubbidhaḥ ojā saṅkhātaḥ duvidha āhāro saṃsagga
translated: The nutriment consisting of edible food internally is fourfold as nutriment consisting of edible food classed as derived from the earth, from water, from fire, and from air.🔽The nutriment consisting of edible food derived from the earth is the nutriment consisting of edible food classed as derived from the earth in the way already stated.🔽The nutriment consisting of edible food derived from water … derived from fire … derived from air is the nutriment consisting of edible food classed as derived from air in the way already stated.🔽The nutriment consisting of edible food externally is twofold as nutriment consisting of edible food classed as derived from the earth and as nutriment consisting of edible food classed as derived from water, from fire, and from air.🔽The nutriment consisting of edible food classed as derived from the earth is the nutriment consisting of edible food classed as derived from the earth in the way already stated.

original: vasena laddhupatthambhā evarūpaṃ samuṭṭhāpentīti vuttaṃ ajjhoharaṇa kāleti. Etthaca🔽bahiddhāsambhūtena utunā saha ajjhatta sambhūtānaṃ catusamuṭṭhānānaṃ utuojānaṃ viya🔽bahiddhāsambhūtāya ojāyapi ajjhattaṃ rūpasamuṭṭhānaṃ sabbaaṭṭhakathāsu vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vasena laddha upatthambhāḥ evarūpam samuṭṭhāpenti iti vuttam ajjhoharaṇa kāle iti ettha ca  bahiddhā sambhūtena utunā saha ajjhatta sambhūtānam catu samuṭṭhānānam utu ojānam viya  bahiddhā sambhūtāya ojasi api ajjhattam rūpa samuṭṭhānam sabba aṭṭhakathāsu vuttam
translated: The nutriment consisting of edible food classed as derived from water … derived from fire … derived from air is the nutriment consisting of edible food classed as derived from air in the way already stated.🔽The nutriment consisting of edible food is also twofold as nutriment consisting of edible food classed as derived from the four great primaries and as nutriment consisting of edible food classed as derived from the four derived forms of matter.🔽The nutriment consisting of edible food classed as derived from the four great primaries is the nutriment consisting of edible food classed as derived from the four great primaries in the way already stated.

original: Yathāha-majjhimaṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: yathā aham ajjhima ṭṭhakathā ayam
translated: The nutriment consisting of edible food classed as derived from the four derived forms of matter is the nutriment consisting of edible food classed as derived from the four derived forms of

original: Kabaḷīkārāhāro tāva mukhe thapitamatto eva aṭṭharūpāni samuṭṭhāpeti. Dantavicuṇṇitaṃ pana ajjhoharīyamānaṃ ekekaṃ sitthaṃ aṭṭha aṭṭha rūpāni samuṭṭhāpetīti.
analyzed: kabaḷīkāra āhāro tāva mukhe thapita mattaḥ eva aṭṭha rūpāni samuṭṭhāpeti danta vicuṇṇitam pana ajjhoharīyamānam ekekam sittham aṭṭha aṭṭha rūpāni samuṭṭhāpeti iti
translated: Nutriment as physical nutriment generates the eight kinds of materiality as soon as it is put into the mouth. But when it is swallowed, each lump generates eight kinds of materiality.

original: Ācariyadhammapālattherena pana yadi bahiddhasambhūtā ojā rūpaṃ samuṭṭhāpeyya, evaṃ
analyzed: ācariya dhammapāla ttherena pana yadi bahiddha sambhūtā ojā rūpam samuṭṭhāpeyya evam
translated: But the teacher Dhammapāla says that if the nutriment consisting of physical nutriment were to generate materiality that had arisen externally, then

original: sati yathā bahiddhasambhūto utu ajjhattañca bahiddhāca rūpaṃ samuṭṭhāpeti. Tathā
analyzed: sati yathā bahiddha sambhūtaḥ utu ajjhattam ca bahiddhā ca rūpam samuṭṭhāpeti tathā
translated: just as the nutriment consisting of contact generates materiality both internally and externally, so too

original: sā bahiddhāpi rūpaṃ samuṭṭhāpeyya. Na pana samuṭṭhāpeti. Tasmā sā ajjhattaṃ patvāpi🔽rūpaṃ na samuṭṭhā petiyeva. Ekantena pana ajjhattaojāeva samuṭṭhāpeti. Sā pana tassā
analyzed: sā bahiddhā api rūpam samuṭṭhāpeyya na pana samuṭṭhāpeti tasmā sā ajjhattam patvā api  rūpam na ekantena pana ajjhatta ojā eva samuṭṭhāpeti sā pana tassā
translated: that nutriment would generate materiality externally as well. But it does not do so. Therefore, even though it has reached the inside,

original: upatthambhanapaccayoeva hotīti adhippāyena mukhe thapitamattoeva. Na saṅkhādito.
analyzed: upatthambhana paccayaḥ eva hoti iti adhippāyena mukhe thapita mattaḥ eva na saṅkhādito
translated: it does not generate materiality. It generates only that materiality which is entirely internal. But its intention is this: it is only as soon as it is put into the mouth, not as a result of its being mixed up,🔽that it generates the eight kinds of materiality.

original: Tattakenapi abbhantarassa paccayo hotiyeva, kenāha aṭṭha aṭṭha rūpāni samuṭṭhāpetīti
analyzed: abbhantarassa paccayaḥ kena āha aṭṭha aṭṭha rūpāni samuṭṭhāpeti iti
translated: And even though it is mixed up, it is still a condition for the internal materiality.

original: majjhimaṭīkāyaṃ vuttaṃ. Yasmā pana upādinnakā utu ojānāma suṭṭhu paṇītarūpā honti,
analyzed: majjhima ṭīkāyam vuttam yasmā pana upādinnakāḥ utu ojā nāma suṭṭhu paṇīta rūpāḥ honti
translated: and it is said in the Majjhima Commentary. But since the nutriment derived from temperature is well-cooked and refined in the case of what is appropriated,

original: tasmā bahiddhā ojāpi ajjhattaṃ patvā tena utunā suṭṭhu sediyamānā tāyaca ojāya suṭṭhu
analyzed: tasmai bahiddhā ojā api ajjhattam patvā tena utunā suṭṭhu sediyamānā tāyace ojāya suṭṭhu
translated: it enters in and is well-cooked by that temperature, and then it supports the nutriment derived from kamma well,

original: upatthambhīya mānā sarīre medasinehupacayavasena rūpaṃ samuṭṭhāpetiyevāti yuttaṃ.
analyzed: sarīre yuttam
translated: and so it generates materiality in the body by way of the accumulation of fat and sinews.

original: Ajjhoharaṇakāleti idañca suṭṭhu balavabhāvappatta kālaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Visuddhimagge🔽pana mātarā paribhuttāhāropi dārakassa sararaṃ pharitvā rūpaṃ samuṭṭhāpeti. Sarīre
analyzed: ajjhoharaṇa kāla iti idam ca suṭṭhu kālam sandhāya vuttam visuddhimagge  pana mātarā paribhutta āhāraḥ api dārakassa sararam pharitvā rūpam samuṭṭhāpeti sarīre
translated: As to ‘nutriment derived from consciousness’: this is said with reference to the time when it has reached a state of great strength. But in the Path of Purification

original: makkhitāhā ropi rūpaṃ samuṭṭhāpetīti vuttaṃ. Mukhe thapitamattoeva aṭṭharūpāni samuṭṭhāpetītica
analyzed: makkhita ahā ropi rūpam samuṭṭhāpeti iti vuttam mukhe thapita mattaḥ eva aṭṭharūpāni samuṭṭhāpeti iti ca
translated: it is said that ‘materiality is generated in the child’s body by the mother’s food that has circulated in the body, and that materiality is generated in the body by food smeared on the body.’ And it is said that ‘materiality is generated by food as soon as it is put in the mouth.’🔽This is what was said above.

original: pubbe vuttanti. Ṭhāna pattovāti attano ṭhitikkhaṇaṃ pattoeva. Etthaca catūsu samuṭṭhānesu
analyzed: pubbe vuttanti ṭhāna patto vā ti attanaḥ ṭhiti kkhaṇam patto eva ettha ca catūsu samuṭṭhānesu
translated: As to ‘when it has reached its place’: as soon as it has reached its own time of presence. And here

original: utueva mahanto mahāthāmo mahāvipphāroca hoti. So hi sakalassapi okāsalokassa bahiddhā
analyzed: hoti saḥ hi sakalassa api okāsa lokassa bahiddhā
translated: it is only in the case of temperature that there is a great deal, a great abundance, a great extension. For that extends externally over the whole world-sphere,

original: saṅkhāralokassaca samuṭṭhā pako vināsako ca hoti. Sattalokassaca soeva mahanto ajjhattasambhārabhūto
analyzed: saṅkhāra lokassa ca samuṭṭhā pako vināsako ca hoti satta lokassa ca saḥ eva mahantaḥ ajjhatta sambhāra bhūto
translated: and it is the source and the destroyer of the world of formations. And it is the great inner store of the world of beings.

original: hoti. Itarāni pana tīṇi tassa parivāramattānieva sampajjantīti.
analyzed: hoti itarāni pana tīṇi tassa parivāra mattāni eva sampajjanti iti
translated: But the other three are only its attendants.

original: Hadaya indriya rūpāni kammajāneva, na cittajādini. Yadievaṃ vippasannāni kho te āvuso
analyzed: hadaye indriya rūpāni kamma jāna eva na citta ja ādini yadi evam vippasannāni kho te āvuso
translated: The heart-basis, faculties, and materiality derived from kamma are only kamma-born, not mind-made, etc.,

original: sāriputta indriyāni. Katarena tvaṃ etarahi vihārena viharasīti kasmā vuttanti. Indriyasambhārānaṃ🔽vaṇṇānaṃ samāpatti cittasamuṭṭhitānaṃ visadavippasannatāvasena upacari tattāti. Tathā
analyzed: sāriputte indriyāni katarena tvam etarahi vihārena viharasi iti kasmai vuttam ti  vaṇṇānam samāpatti citta samuṭṭhitānam visada vippasanna tā vasena tathā
translated: Why is it said, “Friend Sāriputta, your faculties are clear” and so on? Because the clear, bright appearance of the faculties and the clear, bright appearance of the attainment are similar.

original: hi ekābaddhapavattāni catujarūpāni ekasmiṃ vippasanne sabbāni vippasannāneva honti.🔽Milāteca milātānevāti. Utucittāhārā pana tesaṃ navannaṃ upatthambhanapaccayā hontīti
analyzed: hi eka ābaddha pavattāni catu ja rūpāni ekasmin vippasanne sabbāni vippasannāna eva honti  milāte ca utu citta āhārā pana tesam navannam upatthambhana paccayāḥ honti iti
translated: For when the four primary elements occur in a single mode, then all the material instances that are derived from them are clear and bright when one of them is clear and bright, just as when the water in a pond is clear and bright, then the lotuses in it are clear and bright too.🔽But it should be understood that the four primary elements and the material instances derived from them are respectively the support and the supported.

original: veditabbaṃ. Ettha ca uppalapadumāni viya kammajarūpāni daṭṭhabbāni. Tesaṃ bījaṃ viya
analyzed: veditabbam ettha ca uppala padumāni viya kamma ja rūpāni daṭṭhabbāni tesam bījam viya
translated: And here the material instances derived from kamma should be regarded as like the lotuses, and the four primary elements as like the water.

original: kammaṃ. Kaddamodakāni viya utuāhārādīni. Viññatti dvayaṃ cittajameva. Tathā hi taṃ
analyzed: kammam kaddama udakāni viya utu āhāra ādīni dvayam citta jam eva tathā hi tam
translated: and kamma. The temperature, nutriment, etc., are like the molasses and the cake. The two kinds of intimation are born of consciousness. For that is stated by the Blessed One among the states that are conascent with consciousness and that occur in conformity with consciousness.

original: cittasahabhū cittānuparivattidhammesu bhagavatā niddiṭṭhanti. Saddocittotujoti kasmā
analyzed: citta sahabhū citta anuparivatti dhammesu bhagavatā niddiṭṭhanti kasmā
translated: Why is it said, “The voice is born of kamma, temperature, and nutriment”?

original: vuttaṃ. Nanunidhikaṇḍasutte suvaṇṇatā susaratā susaṇṭhānaṃ surūpatātiādinā tādisena🔽kammavisesena saddasampattināma vuttāti. Saccaṃ, kammavisesena pana yathā suvisado🔽sumadhuro saddo pavattati, tathā ṭhānakaraṇagatānaṃ upādinnakasarīrānaṃ susaṇṭhitatā🔽vāta semhādīhi apalibuddhatāca hoti. Tasmā tammūlikāsaddasampatti kammaphalesu pakkhipitvā
analyzed: vuttam nanu nidhi kaṇḍa sutte su vaṇṇa tā su sara tā su saṇṭhānam surūpa tā ati ādinā tādisena  kamma visesena sadda sampatti nāma vuttā ati saccam kamma visesena pana yathā  su madhuraḥ saddo pavattati tathā ṭhāna karaṇa gatānam upādinnaka sarīrānam su saṇṭhita tā  vāta semha ādīhi apalibuddha tā ca hoti tasmā kamma phalesu pakkhipitvā
translated: Because in the Nanidhikaṇḍa Sutta the attainment of a good voice is stated thus: “A good color, a good voice, a good figure, a good complexion” , etc.,🔽by a particular kamma. But although this is so, the good arrangement of the faculties in the appropriated body and the non-obstruction by wind, bile, etc.,

original: susaratāti vuttā. Na ekantena saddassa kammajanitattāti veditabbā.
analyzed: su saratā ati vuttā na ekantena saddassa kamma janita ttā ti veditabbā
translated: are due to the fact that the voice occurs very clearly and very sweetly by means of a particular kamma. Therefore, the attainment of a good voice, which is rooted in kamma, is included among the fruits of kamma and is stated as “a good voice.” It should be understood that the voice is not born of kamma exclusively.

original: Lahutādittayaṃ utucittāhārehi sambhotīti kasmā vuttaṃ. Nanu appābādhasaṃvattanikā
analyzed: utu citta āhārehi sambhoti iti kasmai vuttam nanu appa ābādha saṃvattanikā
translated: Why is it said, “The three beginning with lightness are born of temperature, consciousness, and nutriment”?🔽Are not the states that are favorable to health

original: esā māṇava paṭipadā, yadidaṃ avihiṃsāti vuttaṃ. Appābādha paccayasamuṭṭhitañca etaṃ🔽rūpattayaṃ. Tathā hi dandhattādi kara dhātukkhota paṭipakkhapaccaya samuṭṭhānatā
analyzed: esā māṇava paṭipadā yat idam a vihiṃsa ati vuttam appa ābādha paccaya samuṭṭhitam ca etam  rūpattayam tathā hi dandha ttā ādi paṭipakkha paccaya samuṭṭhāna tā
translated: And this is originated by requisites that are free from disease.🔽For it is said that it is originated by requisites that are the opposite of those that are rough, etc.,🔽and that are the opposite of those that are originated by requisites that are the opposite of the requisites that are originated by kamma.

original: etassa vuttāti. Vuccate, kammajarūpānināma udake pakkhittāni satapākatelāni viya
analyzed: etassa vuttā ti vuccate udake pakkhittāni sata pāka telāni viya
translated: Reply: Just as a hundred times refined sesame oil and a hundred times refined salt are by nature soft and light,

original: pakatiyāva kammānurūpaṃ lahu mudu kammañña bhūtāni honti. Tasmā tesaṃ visuṃ lahutādi🔽vikāronāma natthi. Yato tesaṃ ekasmiṃbhave ekāaddhā paccuppannatāva labbhatīti. Evañca
analyzed: kamma anurūpam lahu mudu kammañña bhūtāni honti tasmā tesam visum  vikāraḥ nāma natthi yatas tesam ekasmiṃ bhave ekāaddhā paccuppanna tā ava labbhati iti evam ca
translated: so too are the kinds of materiality originated by kamma. Therefore they have no alteration called lightness, etc.,🔽since they can only be described as arisen in a single moment in a single existence.

original: katvā yamakesupi tesaṃ kālabhedo paṭisandhivutiparicchinnena addhā paccuppanneneva🔽gahitoti. Yasmā pana cittaṃnāma nānānīvaraṇabhedavasenavā sukha dukkha pīti passaddhi
analyzed: katvā yamakesu pi tesam kāla bhedaḥ paṭisandhi vuti paricchinnena addhā paccuppannena iva  gahitoti yasmā pana
translated: And thus the difference in time of these kinds of materiality in the Yamaka is included in the single moment arisen in the time delimited by the rebirth-linking and death conscious states.🔽But consciousness is associated with different states in different moments, according to whether it is associated with the different kinds of faculties such as faith, understanding, etc.,

original: saddhā paññādi vasenavā nānā khaṇesu nānā avatthā yuttaṃ hoti. Tathā utuāhārāca sappāyā
analyzed: saddhā paññā ādi vasenavā nānā khaṇesu nānā avatthā yuttam hoti tathā utu āhārā ca sappāyā
translated: and according to whether it is associated with the different kinds of hindrances such as stiffness, agitation, etc., and with the different kinds of feelings such as pleasure, pain, joy, grief, etc.,🔽and according to whether it is associated with the different kinds of nutriment such as contact, mental volition, etc., and with the different kinds of temperature such as heat, cold, etc.,

original: sappāyabhedavasena. Tasmā tehi tīhi samuṭṭhita rūpānieva nānākhaṇesu garukalahukādi
analyzed: sappāya bheda vasena tasmā tehi tīhi nānā khaṇesu garuka lahuka ādi
translated: by way of the division of the allowable. Therefore, only the materiality originated by those three is heavy or light, etc., in different moments.

original: vasena nānāvikārayuttāni honti. Yato tesaṃ santati samaya vasena kālabhedo labbhati.
analyzed: vasena nānā vikāra yuttāni honti yatas tesam santati samaya vasena kāla bhedaḥ labbhati
translated: and by the kind of kamma that produces them. So it is only the material instances originated by these three that are associated with the various modifications of heaviness, lightness, etc., in the different moments, and so they have a difference of time reckoned by their continuity and by occasion.

original: Evañca katvā yamakesupi akammajānaṃ pavattikāle khaṇasantativasenapi kālabhedo gahitoti.🔽Nanu kammavipākajā ābādhāti vuttaṃ. Satica kamma samuṭṭhāne ābādharūpe tatovuṭṭhānabhūto
analyzed: evam ca katvā pavatti kāle khaṇa santati vasena api kāla bhedaḥ gahitaḥ iti  nanu kamma vipāka jāḥ ābādhā ti vuttam sati ca kamma samuṭṭhāne ābādha rūpe tatovuṭṭhāna bhūto
translated: And it is in this way that the difference of time is included in the case of the twins by the continuity and the occasion of the occurrence of the non-kamma-born instances.

original: kammajo lahutādi guṇopi visuṃ labbhamāno siyāti. Na. Yesañhi vasena imasmiṃ sarīre🔽kammavipākajānāma ābādhā uppajjanti. Tāni upapīḷakupa ghātakakammānipi gatikālapayoga🔽vipattiyo labhamānāni eva sarīraṭṭhakā pathavādayo vātapittādayoca utusamuṭṭhānā
analyzed: kamma jaḥ guṇaḥ api visum labbhamānaḥ siyāti na imasmin sarīre  kamma vipāka jānāma ābādhāḥ uppajjanti tāni gati kāla payoga  vipattiyaḥ labhamānāni eva utu samuṭṭhānā
translated: But was it not said above, “Disease is born of kamma result” ? —Yes; but when there is disease originated by kamma, the qualities of lightness, etc., originated by kamma are also found separately as the state of recovery from that.

original: dhātuyo khobhetvā nānābādhe uppādenti. Utusamuṭṭhānāsu pana khubbhitāsu itarāni tadanugatikāni
analyzed: dhātuyaḥ khobhetvā nānā ābādhe uppādenti utu samuṭṭhānāsu pana khubbhitāsu itarāni tadanugatikāni
translated: No, they are not. For it is by reason of which of these that the diseases born of kamma result occur in this body that the kamma that produces the diseases, the kamma that produces the death, the kamma that produces the time, the kamma that produces the place, and the kamma that produces the company, are all found separately, and the earth element, etc., that are the body’s support, and the air element, etc., that are the body’s condition, which are originated by temperature, are disturbed, and they produce the various diseases. But when those originated by temperature are disturbed, the others that accompany them are also disturbed.

original: eva honti. Teneva hi sītenapi ruppati, uṇhenapi ruppati, jigacchāyapi ruppati, vipāsāyapi🔽ruppatītiādinā utupadhānova rūpadhammānaṃ ruppanapaccayo vuttoti. Tasmā kevalaṃ kammasamuṭṭhāno
analyzed: eva honti tena iva hi sītena api ruppati uṇhena api ruppati ruppati vipāsāya api  ruppati iti ādinā utu padhānaḥ va rūpa dhammānam ruppana paccayaḥ vutto ti tasmā kevalam kamma samuṭṭhāno
translated: and so they are. It is for this very reason that the condition for the occurrence of material phenomena is stated in the description of the primary elements as “by temperature” thus: “With the support of temperature, material phenomena occur” (Dhs 1).🔽Therefore, the material phenomena that are the result of kamma are not only the result of kamma.

original: ābādhonāma natthi. Yato yathāvutto kammajo lahutādiguṇonāma visuṃ labbhamāno siyāti.
analyzed: ābādhaḥ nāma na atthi yatas yathā vuttaḥ kamma jaḥ lahu tā ādi guṇaḥ nāma visum labbhamāno siyāti
translated: and so they are. That is why the nutriment contact is said to be a condition for materiality in the form of the elements and the kinds of derived materiality derived from the four primary elements only in the clause, “With temperature as decisive temperature is a condition, as generation condition, for the primary materiality originated by kamma” , and so on. So there is no such thing as a sickness called “originated by kamma” . Consequently, the qualities of lightness, etc., called “originated by kamma” are not to be found separately in the way described.

original: Yasmā pana avihiṃsā kammanibbattā sattā tesaṃ upapīḷakādīnaṃ kammānaṃ suvidūratāyaceva
analyzed: yasmā pana avihiṃsā kamma nibbattā sattā tesam upapīḍaka ādīnam kammānam su vidūra tāya ca iva
translated: But because beings born as a result of non-ill will are far removed from the kamma that produces such diseases as leprosy, etc.,

original: sarīrakoṭṭhāsānaṃ ghanasiniddhasaṇṭhitiyā dukkhobhaniyatāyaca nibbattabhave nirābādhā🔽honti. Tasmā tadatthaṃ sandhāya appābādhasaṃvattanikā esā māṇavapaṭipadā. Yadidaṃ
analyzed: sarīra koṭṭhāsānam ghana siniddha saṇṭhitiyā dukkha ubha niyatāya ca nibbatta bhave nirābādhā  honti tasmai tad attham sandhāya appa ābādha saṃvattanikā esā māṇava paṭipadā yat idam
translated: and because the compactness and extreme compactness of the parts of the body are not fixed as a cause of pain, they are free from sickness in the existence in which they are born.

original: avihiṃsāti vuttaṃ, na pana appābādhanimittassa lahutādittayassa kammasamuṭṭhānatāya.
analyzed: avihiṃsā ti vuttam na pana appa ābādha nimittassa kamma samuṭṭhāna tāya
translated: That is why it is said with reference to that purpose, “This way of life, student, conduces to health, namely, non-ill will,” and not because the three beginning with lightness, which are the cause of health, are originated by kamma.

original: Evañca katvā rūpakaṇḍena kammassakaṭattārūpesu eva etaṃ rūpattayaṃ niddiṭṭhanti daṭṭhabbaṃ.🔽Rūpakalāpānāma ekasmiṃ paramāṇusmiṃpi bahuvidhā hutvā pavattanti. Tasmā catujarūpa
analyzed: evañca katvā rūpa kaṇḍena eva etam rūpattayam niddiṭṭhanti daṭṭhabbam  rūpa kalāpāḥ nāma bahuvidhāḥ hutvā pavattanti
translated: And it should be regarded as shown in this way in the case of the materiality aggregate in the section on materiality .🔽They occur in many different ways in a single atom of a group of material instances.

original: kalāpesu ghanabhāvena pavattamānesu kalāpantarabhūtā ākāsadhātupi dissamānāeva hotīti
analyzed: kalāpesu ghana bhāvena pavattamānesu kalāpa antara bhūtā hoti iti
translated: So when four material instances occur in a compact mass, the space element is seen as though it were in the interstices between the instances.

original: katvā catujesu tassā gahaṇaṃ kataṃ. Kāmaṃ sabbānipi anipphannarūpāni kenaci paccayena🔽anipphāditāni honti. Tesu pana na tathā lakkhaṇarūpāni. Yathā itarāni cittādi paccaya
analyzed: katvā catujesu tassāḥ gahaṇam katam kāmam sabbāni api a nipphanna rūpāni kenaci paccayena  anipphāditāni honti tesu pana na tathā lakkhaṇa rūpāni yathā itarāni citta ādi paccaya
translated: That is why it is said to be apprehended in the four.🔽Of course, all unformed material instances are unproduced by any conditions. But the characteristic-types are not like the others, which are seen to differ through the difference in the conditions, such as consciousness, etc., that produce them.

original: visesena dissamāna visesāni hontīti vuttaṃ lakkhaṇarūpāni na kutoci jāyantīti. Jāyamānādi
analyzed: visesena dissamāna visesāni honti iti vuttam lakkhaṇa rūpāni na kutoci jāyanti iti jāyamāna ādi
translated: That is why it is said, “The characteristic-types are not produced from anywhere.”🔽“Material instances that are being born, etc.”: material instances that are being born, that are being decayed, that are being dissolved.

original: rūpānanti jāyamāna jiyyamāna miyyamānānaṃ rūpakalāpānaṃ. Sabhāvattāti jātijarāmaraṇasaṅkhātalakkhaṇasabhāvamattattā.
analyzed: rūpa ananti jāyamāna jiyyamāna miyyamānānam rūpa kalāpānam sabhāva ttā ati jāti jarā maraṇa saṅkhāta lakkhaṇa sabhāva matta ttā
translated: “Mere individual essence”: mere individual essence consisting in the characteristics of birth, ageing, and dissolution.

original: Etthaca rūpakaṇḍe utusamuṭṭhānanti ca āhārasamuṭṭhānanti ca vuttaṃ natthi. Paṭṭhāne eva vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ettha ca rūpa kaṇḍe utu samuṭṭhānan ti ca āhāra samuṭṭhānan ti ca vuttam natthi paṭṭhāne eva vuttam
translated: But in the Rūpa Book it is not said that the kinds of derived materiality originated by temperature and by nutriment are originated from a source. It is said in the Path of Purification.

original: Ettha siyā, jaratā aniccatā pāḷiyameva na kutoci samuṭṭhānāti vuttā. Tasmā idhapi🔽tāsaṃ nakutoci samuṭṭhānesu gahaṇaṃ yuttaṃ. Upacayasantatiyo pana pāḷiyaṃpi kutoci🔽samuṭṭhānesu vuttā. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃpi tāhi saddhiṃ visati kammajarūpāni sattarasa cittajarūpāni🔽cuddasa utujarūpāni terasa āhāraja rūpāni vuttāni. Tasmā idha tāsaṃ nakutocisamuṭṭhānatā🔽navattabbāti. Vuccate, rūpajanakānaṃ jananabyāpāronāma attanā janitarūpānaṃ uppādakkhaṇe
analyzed: ettha siyā jara tā anicca tā pāḷiyam eva na kutoci samuṭṭhānā ati vuttā tasmai idha api  tāsam na kutoci samuṭṭhānesu gahaṇam yuttam upacaya santatiyaḥ pana kutoci  samuṭṭhānesu vuttā aṭṭhakathāyam pi tāhi saddhim kamma ja rūpāni sattarasa citta ja rūpāni  cuddasa utu ja rūpāni terasa āhāra ja rūpāni vuttāni tasmai idha tāsam nakutocid samuṭṭhāna tā  navattabbā ti vuccate rūpa janakānam janana byāpāraḥ nāma attanā janita rūpānam uppāda kkhaṇe
translated: Here it may be asked: “But ageing and ageing-and-death are not said to be originated from a source anywhere in the texts. So how can it be proper to include them here among those originated from a source?🔽” But the growth-continua are said in the texts to be originated from a source. In the commentary it is said that the twenty kinds of materiality originated by kamma, the seventeen kinds originated by consciousness, the fourteen kinds originated by temperature, and the thirteen kinds originated by nutriment are so originated. So it is not improper to include them here among those originated from a source.

original: eva pharati. Na-tato paraṃ, tasmā tasmiṃ khaṇe labbhamānā upacayasantatiyoyeva kutoci
analyzed: eva param tasmai tasmin khaṇe labbhamānā kutocid
translated: The function of the originators of material instances is to cause the material instances that they originate to arise at the moment of their own arising. It does not extend beyond that. So it is only the growth-continua that are found at the moment of arising of the material instances originated by kamma, etc., that are originated from a source.

original: jātapariyāyaṃ arahanti, na jaratā aniccatāyoti katvā pāḷiyaṃ aṭṭhakathā yaṃca tāsaṃeva🔽kutoci samuṭṭhānesu gahaṇaṃ kataṃ. Apica, pubbe ajātā dhammā paccaye sati jāyanti.🔽Asati na jāyantīti atthi. Jātā pana dhammā paccaye sati jiyyanti, miyyanti. Asati🔽najiyyanti namiyyantīti natthi, tasmā purimānaṃ dvinnaṃ pavatti ekantena paccayāyattā
analyzed: jāta pariyāyam arahanti na jaratā anicca tāya iti katvā pāḷiyam aṭṭhakathā yaṃ ca tāsam eva  kutoci samuṭṭhānesu gahaṇam katam apica pubbe ajātāḥ dhammāḥ paccaye sati jāyanti  asati na jāyanti iti atthi jātā pana dhammā paccaye sati jiyyanti miyyanti asati  najiyyanti namiyyanti iti natthi tasmā purimānam dvinnam pavatti ekantena paccaya āyattā
translated: and the Suttas say, “The formed is subject to destruction” , and so on.🔽The Commentaries have taken them as the “destruction” and “impermanence” of what is already born, not as the “destruction” and “impermanence” of what is not yet born.🔽And besides, before they are born, states are “existent” in the sense that they are liable to be born when the conditions are present, and “non-existent” in the sense that they are not born when the conditions are absent.🔽But when they are born, they are “non-existent” in the sense that they are liable to destruction, to dissolution, when the conditions are present, and “existent” in the sense that they are not destroyed, not dissolved, when the conditions are absent.🔽So the occurrence of the first two of these is entirely dependent on conditions.

original: hoti. Pacchimānaṃ dvinnaṃ pavatti pana ekantena paccaya nirapekkhā hotīti iminā pariyāyena🔽tāsaṃ tesu gahaṇaṃ agahaṇañca veditabbaṃ. Yaṃ pana suttapadesu jarāmaraṇaṃ bhikkhave🔽saṅkhataṃ paṭicca samuppannanti vuttaṃ. Taṃ jātiyā satieva tadubhayaṃ paññāyati.🔽Asati na paññāyatīti iminā pariyāyena vuttanti veditabbaṃ. Idha pana pubbe vuttanayena
analyzed: hoti pacchimānam dvinnam pavatti pana ekantena paccaya nirapekkhā hoti iti iminā pariyāyena 🔽tāsam tesu gahaṇam a gahaṇam ca veditabbam yam pana sutta padesu jarā maraṇam bhikkhave 🔽saṅkhatam paṭicca samuppannanti vuttam tam jātiyā sati eva tat ubhayam paññāyati 🔽asati na paññāyati iti iminā pariyāyena vuttan ti veditabbam idha pana pubbe vutta nayena

original: itara anipphannarūpāni viya cattāripi etāni cittādipaccayavisesena dissamānavisesāni
analyzed: anipphanna rūpāni cattāri pi etāni citta ādi paccaya visesena dissamāna visesāni
translated: and the other three are not seen to have different characteristics according to the difference in the conditions of consciousness, etc., as the materiality that has already arisen does.🔽So it is said that none of the four has arisen from anywhere.

original: na hontīti catunnaṃpi na kutoci jātatā vuttā. Evaṃsantepi sārataraṃ pāḷinayaṃ atidhāvanto
analyzed: na honti iti na kutoci jāta tā vuttā sārataram pāḷinayam atidhāvantaḥ
translated: But although it is so, he seems to be running away from the more important method of the text.

original: viya hotīti upacayasanta tīnaṃ kutoci samuṭṭhānesu saṅgahoeva seyyoti. [Rūpasamuṭṭhānanayo]🔽159. Eko eva jāti saṅkhāto uppādo etesanti ekuppādā. Ekoeva aniccatāsaṅkhāto nirodho🔽etesanti ekanirodhā. Ekasaddo cettha saṅkhāne pavatto. Tasmā tena yāni rūpāni ekāyaeva
analyzed: viya hoti iti kutoci samuṭṭhānesu saṅgahaḥ eva seyyaḥ ti  ekaḥ eva jāti saṅkhātaḥ uppādaḥ etesanti eka uppādāḥ ekaḥ eva anicca tā saṅkhātaḥ nirodho  etesanti eka nirodhāḥ eka saddo ca ittha saṅkhāne pavatto tasmā tena yāni rūpāni ekāya eva
translated: So the best way is to take the “accumulation” as the “collection” in the three instances of “arising from anywhere.”🔽They have a single arising called generation, production, etc., thus they are of single arising. They have a single dissolution called the state of dissolution, the state of change, etc., thus they are of single dissolution.

original: jātiyā jāyanti. Ekāya eva aniccatāya nirujjhanti. Tesaṃ piṇḍi idha rūpakalāponāmāti
analyzed: jātiyā jāyanti ekāya eva anicca tāya nirujjhanti tesam
translated: The word “single” is used here in the sense of unity. So he shows that the “mass of materiality” here is the collection of those material instances that arise by a single arising and that dissolve by a single dissolution.

original: dasseti. Ye pana kalāpagata rūpagaṇanāya ekasmiṃ kalāpepi anekāni jātiādīni kappenti,
analyzed: dasseti ye pana kalāpa gata rūpa gaṇanāya ekasmin kalāpe pi anekāni jāti ādīni kappenti
translated: But those who reckon the instances of materiality in a single “mass” as having many arisings, etc.,🔽do not agree with the Root Commentary. There is no reason for it. For this is said there:

original: tesaṃ mūlaṭīkāya nasameti. Yuttica natthi. Vuttañhi tattha ekekakalāpa pariyāpannānaṃ
analyzed: tesam mūla ṭīkāya yutti ca natthi vuttam hi tattha ekeka kalāpa pariyāpannānam
translated: “The material instances included in each single mass

original: rūpānaṃ saheva uppādādipavattito ekekakalāpassa uppādādayo ekekāva hontīti yathā🔽ekekassa kalāpassa jīvitindriyaṃ kalāpā nupālakaṃ upādāya rūpanti vuccati. Evaṃ kalāpuppādādi
analyzed: rūpānam saha iva uppāda ādi pavattitaḥ ekeka kalāpassa uppāda ādayaḥ ekekā ava honti iti yathā  ekekassa kalāpassa jīvitindriyam kalāpā nupālakam upādāya rūpan ti vuccati evam kalāpa uppāda ādi
translated: Because of the occurrence of material instances together with the arising, etc., of material instances, the arising, etc., of each aggregate are only each.

original: sabhāvā jātiādayo upādāyarūpānicceva vuccanti. Evaṃ vikārapariccheda rūpānica yojetabbānīti.
analyzed: sabhāvāḥ jāti ādayaḥ vuccanti evam vikāra pariccheda rūpāni ca yojetabbāni iti
translated: Just as the life faculty of each aggregate is called materiality because it is the preserver of the aggregate, so the characteristics of arising, etc., which are the individual essences of the arising, etc., of the aggregates, are called “derived materiality” because they are the preservers of the aggregates.🔽Thus the material instances that are modifications and the material instances that are determinations should be construed.

original: Yadica yo āyatanānaṃ ācayo. So rūpassa upacayotica yo rūpassa upacayo. Sārūpassa
analyzed: yadi ca yaḥ āyatanānaṃ ācayo saḥ rūpassa upacayo uti ca yaḥ rūpassa upacayo sārūpassa
translated: And because it is said, “That which is the accumulation of the sense bases is the accumulation of materiality,” and “That which is the accumulation of materiality is the continuity of materiality,”

original: santatītica vuttattā tāni jātiādīni lakkhaṇarūpāni visuṃvisuṃ rūpānaṃeva, nakalāpassāti
analyzed: santati iti ca vutta ttā tāni jāti ādīni lakkhaṇa rūpāni visum visum na kalāpassa ati
translated: those characteristics of arising, etc., which are characteristic materiality, would have to be called materiality of individual material instances, not of aggregates.

original: vucceyyuṃ. Catunnaṃ mahābhūtānaṃ upādāya pasādo rūpīnaṃ dhammānaṃ āyūtiādinā vuttattā
analyzed: vucceyyum catunnam mahābhūtānam upādāya pasādaḥ rūpīnam dhammānam āyūti ādinā vutta ttā
translated: And because it is said, “The clear ordering of the four great entities is the materiality of material phenomena,”

original: cakkhādi jīvitādīnipi ekasmiṃ kalāpe anekānieva āpajjeyyuṃ. Tasmā tathā kappanaṃ
analyzed: cakkha ādi jīvita ādīni pi ekasmin kalāpe anekāni eva āpajjeyyum tasmā tathā kappanam
translated: the eye faculty, etc., and the life faculty, etc., would have to be admitted as many in a single aggregate. Therefore the construing

original: akatvā ekasmiṃ kalāpe aññāni upādārūpāni viya lakkhaṇarūpānipi ekekānievāti niṭṭhaṃ gantabbanti.
analyzed: a katvā ekasmin kalāpe aññāni upādā rūpāni viya lakkhaṇa rūpāni pi ekekāni eva ati niṭṭham gantabbanti
translated: and it should be concluded that the characteristic forms are also each single, like the other derived material instances in a single continuity.

original: Eko samāno mahābhūtasaṅkhāto nissayo etesanti ekanissayā. Ettha pana samānatthe ekasaddo
analyzed: ekaḥ samānaḥ mahābhūta saṅkhātaḥ nissayaḥ etesanti eka nissayāḥ ettha pana samāna tthe eka saddaḥ
translated: They have a single support called the great primaries, thus they are single-supported. Here the word single is applicable in the sense of sameness,

original: saddāyatanaṃ sotaviññāṇassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayoti āvataṃ. Tasmā vinā viññattighaṭṭanāya

original: Tathā hi dhammahadayavibhaṅge –

analyzed: kassaci ekādasā yatanāni itiādisu catūsu vākyesu saṃseda ja upapātikā vuttā kassaci satta āyatanāni iti

analyzed: pātu bhavanti yāni kalalanti vuccanti bhāva dasakam kadācid
translated: and the egg-born. There are three sets of ten, which are called the “embryo.” The “ten-factored” is not🔽always found. The intention is that it is not found in the sexless. If it were not so, then in the Dhamm-

translated: ahadaya Vibhaṅga it would not have been said that

analyzed: manindriyam jīvitindriyam upekkhindriyanti vuttam tatas uparanti gabbhaseyyakānam paṭisandhi khaṇato  param pavatti kāle iti eka dasame satta ahe tathā hi kathā vatthu aṭṭhakathāyam sesāni
translated: After that: after the rebirth-linking of those to be born from the womb.🔽In the course of existence: in the eleventh week. For in the Kathāvatthu Commentary it is said:
