original: vuddhiṃ viruḷhiṃ vepullaṃ patvā uparupari catusamuṭṭhānika rūpaparaṃparāpavattiyā
analyzed: vuddhim viruḷhim vepullam patvā upari upari catu samuṭṭhānika rūpa paraṃparā pavattiyā
translated: The material phenomena that arise later, such as the first rebirth-linking consciousness and the material phenomena that arise with it,🔽become conditions for the later consciousnesses and material phenomena by way of postnascence.🔽The material phenomena that arise later, such as the first rebirth-linking consciousness and the material phenomena that arise with it,🔽become conditions for the later consciousnesses and material phenomena by way of postnascence.

original: paccayattaṃ upagacchantīti vuttaṃ pacchājātā cittacetasikā dhammātiādi. Tattha purejātassāti
analyzed: paccayattam upagacchanti iti vuttam pacchājātā citta cetasikāḥ dhammā tiādi tattha purejātassa āti
translated: The material phenomena that arise later, such as the first rebirth-linking consciousness and the material phenomena that arise with it,🔽become conditions for the later consciousnesses and material phenomena by way of postnascence.🔽The material phenomena that arise later, such as the first rebirth-linking consciousness and the material phenomena that arise with it,🔽become conditions for the later consciousnesses and material phenomena by way of postnascence.🔽The material phenomena that arise later, such as the first rebirth-linking consciousness and the material phenomena that arise with it,🔽become conditions for the later consciousnesses and material phenomena by way of postnascence.🔽The material phenomena that arise later, such as the first rebirth-linking consciousness and the material phenomena that arise with it,🔽become conditions for the later consciousnesses and material phenomena by way of postnascence.

original: ātītānantaracitte jātassāti vadanti. Yāva aṭṭhamacittāvā purejātassa. Ettako hi kālo🔽rūpadhammānaṃ vaḍḍhanakālonāma. Tatoparaṃ hāyanakāle pacchājātena payojanaṃ natthīti.
analyzed: ātīta anantara citte jātassa ati vadanti yāva purejātassa ettakaḥ hi kālo 🔽rūpa dhammānam vaḍḍhana kālo nāma tatas uparam hāyana kāle pacchājātena payojanam natthi iti
translated: The material phenomena that arise later, such as the first rebirth-linking consciousness and the material phenomena that arise with it,🔽become conditions for the later

original: Yāva soḷasamacittā eva vā purejātassa. Yadaggena hi maraṇāsannakāle vatthurūpaṃ cuticittassa
analyzed: eva vā purejātassa yad aggena hi maraṇa āsanna kāle vatthu rūpam cuti cittassa
translated: Or, in the case of the sixteen consciousnesses, it is only the preceding consciousness that is a condition for the materiality of the base of the present becoming.🔽For the materiality of the base at the time of death is a condition for the death consciousness as a prenascent condition.

original: purejātapaccayataṃ upagacchati. Tadaggena cuticittaṃpi tassa vatthurūpassa pacchājātapaccayo
analyzed: purejāta paccaya tam upagacchati tad aggena cuti cittam pi tassa vatthu rūpassa pacchājāta paccayo
translated: But the death consciousness is not a postnascent condition for that materiality of the base.🔽So it is not to be taken. And so too in the case of the rest of the materiality.

original: na hotīti navattabbo. Tathā sesarūpānañca. Yathā hi upatthambhanto āhāro vaḍḍhanapakkhe🔽ṭhitameva upatthambhati. Hāyanapakkhe ṭhitaṃ nupatthambhatīti natthi. Tadāpi tadanurūpassa
analyzed: na hoti iti tathā sesa rūpānam ca yathā hi upatthambhantaḥ āhāraḥ vaḍḍhana pakkhe  ṭhitam eva upatthambhati hāyana pakkhe ṭhitam na upatthambhati iti natthi tadā api tad anurūpassa
translated: Just as, when the nutriment “contact” is in the state of growth, it supports only what is already arisen, not what is unarisen;🔽and when it is in the state of decline, it does not support what is already arisen, not to speak of what is unarisen;

original: upatthambhanassa icchitabbattā. Evamayaṃpīti.
analyzed: upatthambhanassa icchitabba ttā evam ayam pi iti
translated: and yet it is still necessary to assume that it supports what is appropriate to it at that time, so too this should be understood.

original: Arūpadhammānaṃ ānubhāvonāma mahāvipphāro hoti. Tasmā te kāyekadese vatthumhi uppannāpi
analyzed: arūpa dhammānam ānubhāvaḥ nāma mahā vipphāraḥ hoti tasmā te kāya ekadese vatthumhi uppannā api
translated: The influence of immaterial states has a wide scope. Therefore, although they arise in a part of the body,

original: sakalaṃ imaṃ catujakāyaṃ upatthambhetuṃ sakkontiyevāti vuttaṃ imassakāyassāti. Cakkhādīni
analyzed: sakalam imam catuja kāyam upatthambhetum sakkontiyā iva ati vuttam imassa kāyassa ati cakkha ādīni
translated: they are able to support the whole of the fourfold materiality. That is why it is said “of this body.”

original: pasādavatthūni rūpādīhi sahaladdhaghaṭṭanānieva viññāṇassa ādhārabhāvaṃ gacchanti.
analyzed: pasāda vatthūni rūpa ādīhi saha laddha ghaṭṭanāni eva viññāṇassa ādhāra bhāvam gacchanti
translated: The eye, etc., are the physical supports for the eye-consciousness, and so on. They become the support for consciousness by being struck by visible data, etc., which are their respective ob jects.

original: Ghaṭṭanañca ṭhitipattakāleevāti tesaṃ niccakālaṃpi attano viññāṇassa purejātapaccayatā
analyzed: ghaṭṭanam ca ṭhiti patta kāle eva ati tesam nicca kālam pi attanaḥ viññāṇassa purejāta paccaya tā
translated: And the impact is at the time of the presence of the life faculty. So their conditionality as prenascent conditions for their own consciousness is established at all times.

original: siddhi hoti. Viññāṇañcanāma pañcavokārabhave vatthunissayena vinā uppajjituṃ nasakkotīti,🔽yadā purejātaṃvā vaḍḍhanapakkhe ṭhitaṃvā vatthuṃ na labhati, tadā paṭisandhikālevā
analyzed: hoti viññāṇam ca nāma pañcavokāra bhave vatthu nissayena vinā uppajjitum na sakkoti iti  yadā purejātam vā vaḍḍhana pakkhe ṭhitam vā vatthum na labhati tadā paṭisandhi kāle vā
translated: And consciousness cannot arise in the five-constituent becoming without a physical basis as its proximate cause.

original: maraṇāsannakālevā yaṃ yaṃ labhati, taṃ taṃ nissāya uppajjatiyeva. Yadā pana pure🔽jātaṃ suṭṭhu balavantañca vatthuṃ labhati, tadā tadeva nissāya pavattati. Tañca niyamato
analyzed: yam yam labhati tam tam nissāya uppajjatiyā iva yadā pana pure  jātam suṭṭhu balavantam ca vatthum labhati tadā tat eva nissāya pavattati tat ca niyamataḥ
translated: So when it does not get a prenascent or present physical basis, then it arises in dependence on whatever it gets at the time of rebirth-linking or at the time of death.🔽But when it gets a prenascent physical basis that is strong, then it occurs in dependence on that. And that is only available at the time of the occurrence of consciousness, not at the time of rebirth-linking.

original: pavattikāleeva labbhati, no paṭisandhikāle. Nahi tadā viññāṇapaccayena uppannaṃ vatthupurejātaṃ🔽bhavituṃ sakkotīti vuttaṃ chavatthūni pavattiyanti.
analyzed: pavatti kāle eva labbhati no paṭisandhi kāle nahi tadā viññāṇa paccayena uppannam vatthu purejātam  bhavitum sakkoti iti vuttam cha vatthūni pavattiyanti
translated: For the prenascent physical basis that has arisen with consciousness as its condition cannot continue to exist then.🔽So it is said that “Five physical bases occur at the time of rebirth-linking” .

original: Pañcālambaṇānica pañcaviññāṇavīthiyāti idaṃ niyamasiddhigahaṇa vasena vuttaṃ. Sabbāni
analyzed: pañca ālambaṇāni ca pañca viññāṇa vīthiyā ti idam niyama siddhi gahaṇa vasena vuttam sabbāni
translated: And “The five consciousnesses have five objects” is said with reference to the established rule.

original: pana paccuppannabhūtāni nipphannarūpāni manoviññāṇa vīthiyā purejātapaccayā hontiyeva.
analyzed: pana paccuppanna bhūtāni nipphanna rūpāni manaḥ viññāṇa vīthiyā purejāta paccayā honti yeva
translated: But the material phenomena of the present, which are produced material phenomena, are prenascent conditions for the consciousnesses of the mind door.

original: Evañca katvā paṭṭhāne paccuppanno dhammo paccuppannassa dhammassa purejātapaccayena🔽paccayo. Ārammaṇapurejātaṃ cakkhuṃ aniccato dukkhato anattato vipassati. Sotaṃ, ghānaṃ,🔽jivhaṃ, kāyaṃ, rūpe, sadde, gandhe, rase, phoṭṭhabbe, vatthuṃ, paccuppanne khandhe
analyzed: evañca katvā paṭṭhāne paccuppannaḥ dhammaḥ paccuppannassa dhammassa purejāta paccayena  paccayaḥ ārammaṇa purejātam cakkhum aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ anattataḥ vipassati sotam ghānaṃ  jivham kāyam rūpe sadde gandhe rase phoṭṭhabbe vatthum paccuppanne khandhe
translated: And it is in this way that it is said in the Paṭṭhāna: “A present state is a prenascent condition, as foundation, for a present state.

original: aniccato dukkhato anattato vipassati, paccuppannaṃ cakkhuṃ assādeti abhinandatītiādi
analyzed: aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ anattataḥ vipassati paccuppannam cakkhum assādeti abhinandati itiādi
translated: One contemplates as impermanent, painful, and not-self a visible datum cognizable by the eye that has arisen … a sound cognizable by the ear … a tangible datum cognizable by the body that has arisen. He contemplates as impermanent, painful, and not-self the materiality of the present pentad of aggregates. He relishes the present eye, he delights in the present eye, he welcomes the present eye, he remains cleaving to the present eye” .

original: vuttaṃ. Aṭṭhakathāyañca uppādakkhaṇaṃ atikkamitvā ṭhitipattaṃ aṭṭhārasavidhaṃ rūpameva🔽purejātapaccayoti vuttanti. Etthaca kiñcāpi paṭṭhāne paccuppannārammaṇaṃ paṭisandhicittaṃ
analyzed: vuttam aṭṭhakathāyañca uppāda khaṇam atikkamitvā ṭhiti pattam aṭṭhārasavidham rūpam eva  purejāta paccayaḥ ti vuttan ti ettha ca kiñcā api paṭṭhāne paccuppanna ārammaṇam paṭisandhi cittam
translated: And in the Commentary it is said that the eighteen kinds of materiality that have reached presence by passing beyond the moment of arising are called prenascent conditions.🔽And here, although the rebirth-linking consciousness, which has a present object, is a condition, as proximity condition, for the life-continuum consciousness, which has a present object,

original: paccuppannārammaṇassa bhavaṅgassaanantarapaccayena paccayoti evaṃ paṭisandhibhavaṅgānaṃpi
analyzed: paccuppanna ārammaṇassa bhavaṅgassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ ti evam paṭisandhi bhavaṅgānaṃ pi
translated: nevertheless it is said in the Paṭṭhāna thus: “A present state is a prenascent condition, as proximity condition, for a present state,” and so on, in order to show the prenascence of the rebirth-linking and life-continuum consciousnesses,

original: paccuppannārammaṇatāya vuttattā paccuppannabhūtāni kammanimitta gatinimittāni ārabbha
analyzed: paccuppanna ārammaṇa tāya vutta ttā paccuppanna bhūtāni kamma nimitta gati nimittāni ārabbha
translated: Because it is said to have a present object, it is only the present four primary elements that are the cause of the sign of kamma and the sign of destiny.

original: pavatti kāle paṭisandhicittānaṃpi ārammaṇapurejātaṃ labbhamānaṃ viya dissati. Evaṃsantepi
analyzed: pavatti kāle paṭisandhi cittānam pi ārammaṇa purejātam labbhamānam viya dissati evaṃsante pi
translated: Since it is said to have a present object, it is as if the condition of prenascence in the objective field were found in the rebirth-linking consciousnesses at the moment of occurrence, which have as their object the signs of kamma and the signs of destiny consisting of present states.🔽But even so,

original: purejātapaccayassa paccaniye paṭisandhikkhaṇe vipākā byākato eko khandhotiādinā pāḷiyaṃeva
analyzed: purejāta paccayassa paccaniye paṭisandhi kkhaṇe vipākāḥ byākataḥ ekaḥ khandhaḥ ti ādinā pāḷiyam eva
translated: it is rejected in the text itself thus: ‘One aggregate of the resultant type at the moment of rebirth-linking is a condition, as prenascence condition, for the four resultant aggregates and for the materiality due to kamma performed’ ,

original: taṃ paṭikkhittanti. Etthaca āruppe viya paṭisandhikkhaṇepi vatthupure jātassa abhāvā
analyzed: tat paṭikkhittanti ettha ca āruppe viya paṭisandhi khaṇe pi vatthu pure jātassa abhāvā
translated: and so on. And here the reason they give for its rejection is this: just as in the immaterial sphere, so too at the moment of rebirth-linking there is no prenascent physical basis,

original: aparibyattattāvā tassa ārammaṇassa ārammaṇamattabhāveeva ṭhitattā paṭikkhittanti🔽kāraṇaṃ vadanti. Ārammaṇamevagarukatanti paccavekkhanavasena assādanādivasenaca garukataṃ
analyzed: a paribyatta ttā vā tassa ārammaṇassa ārammaṇa matta bhāve eva ṭhita ttā  kāraṇam vadanti ārammaṇam eva garukatam ti paccavekkhana vasena assādana ādi vasena ca garukatam
translated: and the object is not restricted, since it is established merely as object.🔽But the reason given in the Paṭṭhāna is this: ‘The object is what is given importance to’ . What is given importance to is a desirable object, either by reviewing or by relishing, etc.,

original: iṭṭhārammaṇa māha. Tañca kho tassatassa puggalassa icchāvasena veditabbaṃ. Gūthakuṇapādīnipi
analyzed: iṭṭha ārammaṇa māha tat ca kho tassa tassa puggalassa icchā vasena veditabbam gūtha kuṇapa ādīni pi
translated: and that should be understood according to the wish of the person concerned. Even such objects as excrement and urine, etc.,

original: hi tadabhinandantānaṃ kimimakkhika sunakha gijjha kākādīnaṃ garukatānieva ārammaṇāni hontīti.
analyzed: hi tat abhinandantānam kimi makkhika sunakha gijjha kāka ādīnam garukatāni eva ārammaṇāni honti iti
translated: For the objects of the crows, kites, dogs, and jackals that delight in it are only repulsive.

original: [230] Yaṃ pana vibhāvaniyaṃ
analyzed: yam pana
translated: But what is said in the Vibhaṅga:

original: “Garukatanti garuṃ katvā paccavekkhita”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Taṃ anupapannaṃ.🔽Cakkhuṃ garuṃ katvā assādeti abhinandatītiādinā assā danādivasenapi assa niddesassa
analyzed: garukatam ti garum katvā paccavekkhita ntiādi vuttam tat anupapannam  cakkhum garum katvā assādeti abhinandati iti ādinā assā dana ādi vasena api assa niddesassa
translated: “‘Repulsive’: he reviews it as repulsive” , and so on, is incorrect.

original: pavattattāti. Rāgādayo pana dhammāti etena rāgo doso moho māno diṭṭhi patthanāti
analyzed: pavatta ttāti rāga ādayaḥ pana dhammā ti etena rāgaḥ dosaḥ mohaḥ mānaḥ diṭṭhi patthanā ati
translated: For the exposition of the term “repulsive” occurs thus: “He delights in, welcomes, and remains committed to the repulsive” , and so on.

original: evaṃ vuttehi dhammehi saha dasa akusalakammapathā pañcaanantariya kammānica gahitāni🔽honti. Tattha anantariyavajjāni tāni samatikkamamukhena yathārahaṃ ajjhattaṃ sabbesaṃ
analyzed: evam vuttehi dhammehi saha dasa gahitāni  honti tattha anantariya vajjāni tāni samatikkama mukhena yathāraham ajjhattam sabbesam
translated: But the words “the states beginning with greed” include the ten courses of unwholesome kamma and the five crimes with immediate result that are stated thus:🔽“Greed, hatred, delusion, conceit, and wrong view” .🔽Herein, the crimes with immediate result are included by the words “the states beginning with greed” in the sense of being their proximate cause.🔽But the wholesome kamma of the four planes that is to be experienced in the present existence is included by the words “the wholesome kamma of the four planes” in the sense of being their predominant condition.

original: catubhūmaka kusalānaṃ anantariyakammāni pana kāmāvacarakusalānameva uppattiyā balavanissayā
analyzed: anantariya kammāni pana kāmāvacara kusalānam eva uppattiyāḥ balava nissayā
translated: The wholesome kamma of the sense sphere is a strong support for the arising of the wholesome of the sense sphere.

original: honti. Tāniyevaca sabbāni yathārahaṃ ajjhattañca bahiddhāca rāgādīnaṃ pāṇātipātādīnañca
analyzed: honti sabbāni yathāraham ajjhattam ca bahiddhā ca rāga ādīnam pāṇa atipāta ādīnam ca
translated: They are the conditions for the arising of all the unprofitable things beginning with lust and the indeterminate things beginning with bodily pleasure and pain, in the way appropriate in each case, both internally and externally.

original: sabbesaṃ akusalānaṃ kāyikasukhadukkhādīnañca abyākatadhammānaṃ uppattiyā balava nissayā🔽honti. Saddhādayoti etena saddhā sīlaṃ sutaṃ cāgo paññāti evaṃ vuttehi dhammehi saha
analyzed: sabbesam akusalānam kāyika sukha dukkha ādīnam ca abyākata dhammānam uppattiyā nissayā  honti saddhā ādayaḥ ti etena saddhā sīlam sutam cāgaḥ paññā ti evam vuttehi dhammehi saha
translated: They are the strong support for the arising of all the unprofitable things beginning with lust and the indeterminate things beginning with bodily pleasure and pain, in the way appropriate in each case, both internally and externally.🔽Faith, etc., are the strong support for the arising of all the things beginning with giving and virtue, etc., and the profitable things of the four planes, and for the arising of the indeterminate things beginning with bodily pleasure and pain of the four planes, when they are mentioned together with faith, etc.,

original: sabbe dānasīlādayo catubhūmakaku salānaṃ rāgādi akusalānaṃ sukhadukkhādicatubhūmaka🔽abyākatā nañca uppattiyā balavanissayā hontīti. Sukhaṃ dukkhaṃ puggalo bhojanaṃ utusenāsananti
analyzed: sabbe dāna sīla ādayo rāga ādi akusalānam sukha dukkha ādi catu bhūmaka  abyākatāḥ uppattiyā balava nissayāḥ honti iti sukham dukkham puggalaḥ bhojanam utu senāsananti
translated: in the way beginning ‘Faith is a cause for the acquisition of wealth’ .🔽Pleasure, pain, the person, food, climate, and conduct are the strong support for the arising of all the indeterminate things except Nibbāna, which are mentioned in the way beginning ‘With the arising of contact related to the eye there is the arising of resultant pleasure’ .

original: etena nibbānavajjā sabbe catubhūmakā byākatā gahitā, tepi hi yathārahaṃ ajjhattañca
analyzed: etena nibbāna vajjā sabbe catu bhūmakāḥ byākatāḥ gahitā te api hi yathāraham ajjhattam ca
translated: They are the strong support for the arising of the profitable and indeterminate things, in the way appropriate in each case, both internally and externally.

original: bahiddhāca kusalākusalā byākatadhammānaṃ uppattiyā balavanissayā hontīti. Kammaṃvipākānanti
analyzed: bahiddhā ca kusala akusalāḥ byākata dhammānam uppattiyāḥ balava nissayāḥ honti iti kammaṃ vipākānam ti
translated: Kamma and kamma-result are the strong support for the arising of all the profitable and unprofitable things, in the way appropriate in each case, both internally and externally.

original: ettha suṭṭhu balavaṃ kammaṃ adhippetaṃ, na dubbalanti. Kasmā panettha rūpadhammā
analyzed: ettha suṭṭhu balavam kammam adhippetam na dubbalanti kasmā pana ittha rūpa dhammā
translated: Herein, it is the strong kamma that is intended, not weak kamma.

original: paccayuppannesu na gahitā. Nanu tesaṃpi bahiddhā rukkhatiṇādīnaṃ vuddhiviruḷhi vepullatthāya
analyzed: paccaya uppannesu na gahitā nanu tesam pi bahiddhā rukkha tiṇa ādīnam vuddhi viruḷhi vepulla tthāya
translated: But they are not included in the present context.

original: ajjhattañca ārogyādiatthāya pathavirasa āporasa vassodaka bijamūlabhesajjādayo balavanissayā
analyzed: ārogya ādi atthāya pathavi rasa āporasa vassa udaka bija mūla bhesajja ādayaḥ balava nissayā
translated: But do not the growth, increase, and abundance of those external things such as trees, grass, etc., serve to nourish the internal earth element, etc., for the purpose of health, etc.?

original: hontīti. Ayaṃ panattho mūlaṭīkāyaṃ kathitoyeva. Vuttañhi tattha –
analyzed: honti iti ayam pana atthaḥ mūla ṭīkāyam vuttam hi tattha
translated: The meaning of this is stated in the commentary on the root text. For it is said there:

original: Nahi rūpābyākataṃ pakatūpanissayaṃ labhati. Acetanena rūpasantānena pakatasseva abhāvato.
analyzed: nahi rūpa abyākatam pakata upanissayam labhati acetanena rūpa santānena pakatassa iva abhāvato
translated: “Materiality that is neutral does not receive the name ‘kamma-originated’ because there is no such thing as a kamma-originated continuum of materiality that is insentient.

original: Yathā hi arūpasantānena kattubhūtena saddhādayo nipphāditā utubhojanādayoca upasevitā.🔽Na evaṃ rūpasantānena. Yasmiñca utubījādike kammādikeca sati rūpaṃ pavattati. Na
analyzed: yathā hi arūpa santānena kattu bhūtena saddhā ādayaḥ nipphāditāḥ upasevitā  na evam rūpa santānena yasmin ca utu bīja ādike kamma ādike ca sati rūpam pavattati na
translated: For just as the materiality that is produced by the sentient continuum consisting of faith, etc., and that is used by the sentient continuum consisting of cold, heat, etc.,🔽is not produced by the insentient continuum consisting of cold, heat, etc., so too the materiality that is produced by the insentient continuum consisting of cold, heat, etc., is not used by the sentient continuum consisting of faith, etc.🔽And in the case of cold, heat, etc., and seed, etc., where materiality occurs because of kamma, etc.,

original: taṃ tena rūpena pakataṃ hoti. Sacetanasseva hi uppādanupasevanapayogavasena cetanaṃ
analyzed: tat tena rūpena pakatam hoti sa cetanassa iva hi uppāda nupasevana payoga vasena cetanam
translated: that materiality is not kamma-originated. For kamma-originated is a term for what is produced and used by kamma, etc.,

original: pakappanaṃ pakaraṇaṃ. Rūpañca acetananti.
analyzed: pakappanam pakaraṇam rūpam ca acetananti
translated: as a sentient continuum. And materiality is insentient.”

original: Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti, duvidhaṃ santānaṃ rūpasantānaṃ arūpasantānanti. Tattha yena santānena🔽pubbe kiñci suṭṭhuuppāditaṃvā hoti upasevitaṃvā, tasseva pubbe attanā uppāditupasevitā
analyzed: idam vuttam hoti duvidham santānam rūpa santānam arūpa santānanti tattha yena santānena  pubbe kiñci suṭṭhu uppāditam vā hoti upasevitam vā tassa iva pubbe attanā uppādita upasevitā
translated: What is meant is that there are two kinds of continuity, namely, material-continuity and immaterial-continuity. Herein,

original: dhammā kālantare attano upanissayapaccayā honti. Pakaraṇasaṅkhātañca tathā uppādanupasevanaṃnāma
analyzed: dhammā kāla antare attano upanissaya paccayāḥ honti pakaraṇa saṅkhātam ca tathā uppāda nupasevanam nāma
translated: whatever continuity has previously given rise to or has had recourse to something, the states that have been given rise to or have had recourse to by it are a condition, as decisive-support condition, for it at a later time.

original: sacetane arūpasantāneeva labbhati, na acetane rūpasantāneti. Tasmā rūpadhammā upanissayaṃnāma
analyzed: sa cetane arūpa santāne eva labbhati na acetane rūpa santāne ti tasmā rūpa dhammāḥ upanissayam nāma
translated: And the giving rise to and having recourse to called the “ section” is found only in the immaterial continuity that has cognizance, not in the material continuity that has no cognizance.🔽That is why material states are not called decisive-support.

original: nalabbhantīti. Imasmiṃ sati idaṃ hoti, asati na hotīti evaṃ vuttena suttantikapariyāyena
analyzed: na labbhanti iti imasmin sati idam hoti asati na hoti iti evam vuttena suttantika pariyāyena
translated: But in the case of the sutta method stated thus, “With this present, that comes to be; from the arising of this, that arises,”

original: pana upanissayo nāma rūpadhammānaṃ majjhepi vattabboyevāti.
analyzed: pana upanissayaḥ nāma rūpa dhammānam majjhe pi vattabbaḥ yeva ati
translated: the decisive-support is something that should be mentioned even in the middle of material states.

original: [231] Vibhāvaniyaṃ pana
analyzed: vibhāvaniyam pana
translated: But in the “ Description”

original: “Yathārahaṃ ajjhattañca bahiddhāca rāgādayo.La. Senāsanañcāti” viyojetvā “rāgādayo hi ajjhattaṃ nipphādikā. Puggalādayo bahiddhā sevitāti” vuttaṃ. Taṃ nasundaraṃ.
analyzed: yathāraham ajjhattam ca bahiddhā ca senāsanam ca ati viyojetvā rāga ādayaḥ hi ajjhattam nipphādikā puggala ādayaḥ bahiddhā sevitā iti vuttam tat na sundaram
translated: it is said, “The kinds of lust, etc., are to be separated out thus: ‘As to the kinds of lust, etc., internally and externally, and as to the kinds of lodging.’ For the kinds of lust, etc., are internally originated, and persons, etc., are externally resorted to” . That is badly said.

original: Na hi attano parassaca uppannā rāgādayo parassa attano ca santāne rāgādīnaṃ balavanissayā
analyzed: na hi attanaḥ parassa ca uppannāḥ rāga ādayaḥ parassa attanaḥ ca santāne rāga ādīnam balava nissayā
translated: For the lust, etc., that have arisen in one’s own continuity and in another’s continuity are not conditions for the lust, etc., in one’s own continuity and in another’s continuity, respectively, by way of strong support.

original: na honti. Samānacchandānaṃ itthi purisādīnaṃ manopadosika devādīnañcettha rāgādayo nidassanaṃ.
analyzed: na honti samāna chandānam itthi purisa ādīnam deva ādīnam ca ittha rāga ādayaḥ nidassanaṃ
translated: The lust, etc., of men and women who have the same desire, and of the mind-made gods who are angry, etc., are an example here.

original: [232] Yāca tattha
analyzed: yāca tattha
translated: Herein,

original: “Yathāṭhitavasena yojanaṃ” katvā “attanohi rāgādayo”tiādinā atthavibhāvanā katā. Sāpi anupapannāyeva.
analyzed: yathā aṭhita vasena yojanam katvā attanohi rāga ādayo ti ādinā attha vibhāvanā katā sā api anupapannāya iva
translated: the explanation of the meaning by the words “one’s own lust, etc.,” etc., is made by way of the “as-it-lies” method. But that is not correct.

original: Tāya hi attano rāgādayo saddhādayoca ajjhattaṃ kusalādīnaṃ attano saddhāyo pana bahiddhā kusalassāti evaṃ aparipuṇṇassa atthassa vibhāvitattāti.🔽[233] Yañca
analyzed: tāya hi attano rāga ādayo saddhā ādayo ca ajjhattam kusala ādīnam attano saddhāyo pana bahiddhā kusalassa ati evam aparipuṇṇassa atthassa vibhāvita ttā ti  yañ ca
translated: For by that method the meaning is explained as incomplete, since one’s own lust, etc., and one’s own faith, etc., are internal conditions for one’s own profitable, etc., while one’s own faith, etc., are external conditions for one’s own profitable, etc.🔽And the method of explanation by the words “therein” , etc., is not correct.

original: ‘Tatthā’tiādinā attanorāgādayonissāyaajjhattaṃ kusalākusalānameva uppattividhānaṃ vuttaṃ. Taṃpi anupapannameva.
analyzed: tattha ati ādinā anupapannam eva
translated: For the statement of the arising of profitable and unprofitable states in one’s own continuity by way of one’s own lust, etc., is not correct.

original: Nayadassanamattabhūtaṃpi hi saṃvaṇṇanāvākyaṃnāma nayamukhaṃ paripuṇṇaṃ katvā vattabbaṃ
analyzed: naya dassana matta bhūtam pi hi saṃvaṇṇanā vākyam nāma naya mukham paripuṇṇam katvā vattabbam
translated: For a commendatory statement, even though it is only a mode of expression, should be made by way of a complete method.

original: hotīti. Garukataṃārammaṇanti ettha sabbaṃ lokiyakusalaṃ heṭṭhimamaggaphalanibbānāni
analyzed: hoti iti garukatam ārammaṇam ti ettha sabbam lokiya kusalam heṭṭhima magga phala nibbānāni
translated: “Heavy object” : here all mundane profitable, the lower path and fruition, and Nibbāna,

original: ca kāmāvacara kusalassa arahattamaggaphalanibbānāni catunnaṃ ñāṇasampayutta mahākriyajavanānaṃ.🔽Nibbānaṃ aṭṭhavidhalokuttarassa thapetvā paṭighadvaya momūha dvaya dukkhasahagata
analyzed: ca kāmāvacara kusalassa arahatta magga phala nibbānāni catunnam ñāṇa sampayutta mahākriya javanānam  nibbānaṃ aṭṭhavidha lokuttarassa thapetvā
translated: are the object of the profitable of the sense sphere, and the supramundane path and fruition and Nibbāna are the object of the four kinds of great-object impulsions associated with knowledge.

original: kāyaviññāṇāni avasesaṃ sabbaṃ lokiya kusalākusalābyākatadhammajātaṃ lobhasahagatacittassāti
analyzed: kāya viññāṇāni avasesam sabbam lokiya kusala akusala abyākata dhamma jātam lobha sahagata cittassa ati
translated: Nibbāna is the object of the eight kinds of supramundane consciousness, and the two kinds of receiving, the two kinds of receiving associated with uncertainty, and the two kinds of receiving associated with grief,

original: evaṃ paccaya paccayuppanna vibhāgo veditabbo.
analyzed: evam paccaya paccayuppanna vibhāgaḥ veditabbaḥ
translated: are the object of the consciousness associated with greed. So the analysis should be understood in this way.

original: [234] Yaṃ pana vibhāvaniyaṃ
analyzed: yam pana
translated: But in the analysis in the Vibhāvinī

original: “Garuka taṃālambaṇanti paccavekkhanaassādādinā garukataṃ ārammaṇa”nti vatvā taṃ vibhāventena
analyzed: garuka tam ālambaṇanti paccavekkhana assāda ādinā garuka tam ārammaṇanti vatvā tam vibhāventena
translated: “Heavy object” is said to be “an object made heavy by looking back with enjoyment, etc.,” and the person who is analysing it

original: “tañhi jhānamagga phalavipassanā nibbānādibhedaṃ paccavekkhana assādādimaggaphalādidhamme
analyzed: tat hi jhāna magga phala vipassanā nibbāna ādi bhedam paccavekkhana assāda ādi magga phala ādi dhamme
translated: says, “For that is the kinds of states such as the jhāna, path, fruition, insight, Nibbāna, etc., that are looked back on with enjoyment, etc., and the path and fruition, etc.,

original: attādhīne karotīti ārammaṇādhipatināmā”ti vuttaṃ. Taṃ na sundaraṃ.
analyzed: atta adhīne karoti iti ārammaṇa adhipati nāmā ati vuttam tat na sundaram
translated: are made dependent on self, so it is called ‘object-predominance.’ ” That is not good.

original: Dāna sīla uposathakamma pubbe suciṇṇagotrabhu vodāna maggaphala nibbānāniceva rāgadiṭṭhicakkhusotādīnicāti🔽pana vattabbaṃ. Vipassanātica idaṃ gotrabhuvodānāniyeva sandhāya vuttaṃ siyā. Naca🔽tāni nibbānārammaṇāni vipassanānāma hontīti. Sahajātānaṃnāmarūpānanti dvihetuka tihetuka🔽javanasaha jātānanti adhippāyo. Aññamaññaṃ sahajāta rūpānañcāti aññamaññassaca paṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: dāna sīla uposatha kamma pubbe suciṇṇa gotra bhu vodāna magga phala nibbānāni ca iva rāga diṭṭhi cakkhu sota ādīni ca ati  pana vattabbam idam sandhāya vuttam siyā na ca  tāni nibbāna ārammaṇāni vipassanā nāma honti iti  javana saha jātānanti adhippāyaḥ aññam aññam sahajāta rūpānam ca ati aññam aññassa ca paṭisandhi kkhaṇe
translated: and giving, virtue, the Uposatha rite, the going forth, the fruit of stream-entry, etc., are called “the path” and “the fruit” and “Nibbana” and “the eye of flesh” and “the eye of the Dhamma” and “the ear of flesh” and “the ear of the Dhamma” and so on.🔽But it may be said that this is said with reference only to the path and fruition attainments.🔽And they are not called “insight” because they have Nibbana as their object.🔽As to “the mind and bodily form that are conascent with it”: the intention is that it is the conascent mind and bodily form of the impulsions of the two- rooted and three-rooted types.🔽And as to “and of the other kinds of bodily form that are conascent with it”: it is also the other kinds of bodily form that are conascent with it, that is to say, the kinds of bodily form that are conascent with the mind-element and the mind-consciousness element at the rebirth-linking and death moments.

original: kammasamuṭṭhānarūpānaṃ pavattiyaṃ citta samuṭṭhānarūpānañca. Esa nayo paratthapi.🔽Pañcavokārabhave paṭisandhikkhaṇe viññāṇaṃ vatthunā vinā patiṭṭhaṃ nalabhati. Vatthucatena🔽vinā patiṭṭhaṃ nalabhatīti vuttaṃ paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthuvipākā aññamaññanti. Aññamaññapaccaye
analyzed: kamma samuṭṭhāna rūpānam pavattiyam citta samuṭṭhāna rūpānam ca esa nayo parattha api 🔽pañcavokāra bhave paṭisandhi kkhaṇe viññāṇam vatthunā vinā patiṭṭham na labhati vatthu catena 🔽vinā patiṭṭham na labhati iti vuttam paṭisandhi kkhaṇe vatthu vipākāḥ aññam aññanti aññamañña paccaye

original: yo attano upatthambhakaṃ paccupatthambhati. Soeva paccayuppannabhāvaṃ gacchati. Cittasamuṭṭhāna
analyzed: yaḥ attanaḥ upatthambhakam paccupatthambhati saḥ eva paccaya uppanna bhāvam gacchati citta samuṭṭhāna
translated: And the materiality originated by consciousness cannot support consciousness.

original: rūpānica cittaṃ kiñci upatthambhetuṃ nasakkonti. Tathā upādārūpānica mahābhūteti
analyzed: rūpāni ca cittam kiñci upatthambhetum na sakkonti tathā upādā rūpāni ca mahābhūta iti
translated: And the derived materiality cannot support the great primaries.

original: vuttaṃ cittacetasikādhammāaññamaññantiādi.
analyzed: vuttam
translated: So it is said: “The states of consciousness and its concomitants are reciprocally related to one another, and so on” .

original: [235] Vibhāvaniyaṃ pana
analyzed: vibhāvaniyam pana
translated: But in the Vibhaṅga it is said:

original: “Yasmā pana aññamaññuvatthambhanavaseneva aññamaññapaccayatā. Na sahajātamattatoti🔽pavattiyaṃ rūpaṃ nāmānaṃ aññamaññapaccayo na hoti. Tasmā vuttaṃ cittacetasikā dhammā🔽aññamaññanti” vuttaṃ. Tattha na sahajātamattatoti etena yadi sahajātamattato aññamaññapaccayatāsiyā.
analyzed: yasmā pana aññamañña paccaya tā na sahajāta matta tā ti  pavattiyam rūpam nāmānam aññamañña paccayaḥ na hoti tasmā vuttam citta cetasikāḥ dhammā  aññam aññanti vuttam tattha na sahajāta mattato ti etena yadi sahajāta mattataḥ aññamañña paccaya tā siyā
translated: “But because the condition being by way of reciprocal support is only by way of mutual support, not by way of mere conascence,🔽materiality in the course of an existence is not a reciprocal condition for mentality. Therefore it is said: ‘The states of consciousness and its concomitants are reciprocally related to one another’ ” .🔽Herein, by the words “not by way of mere conascence” it is allowed that if the reciprocal condition were by way of mere conascence,

original: Evaṃsati pavattiyaṃ rūpaṃ nāmānaṃ aññamaññapaccayo siyāti anuññātaṃ hoti. Sahajātapaccayepi
analyzed: evaṃsati pavattiyam rūpam nāmānam aññamañña paccayo siyāti anuññātam hoti sahajāta paccaye pi
translated: then materiality in the course of an existence would be a reciprocal condition for mentality.

original: pana pavattiyaṃ rūpaṃ nāmānaṃ paccayo nahotiyeva. Tasmā na sundarametanti.
analyzed: pana pavattiyam rūpam nāmānam paccayaḥ tasmā na sundaram etat ti
translated: But in the case of the condition being by way of conascence, materiality in the course of an existence is not a condition for mentality. Therefore it is not good .

original: Chavatthūni sattannaṃ viññāṇadhātūnanti ettha vatthusahajāta nissayo vatthupurejātanissayo
analyzed: cha vatthūni viññāṇa dhātūnan ti ettha vatthu sahajāta nissayo vatthu purejāta nissayo
translated: “Six bases and seven consciousness-elements”: here the “base” is the physical heart-basis, which is the support that is co-nascent with the consciousness, and the support that is prenascent to it.

original: vatthārammaṇapurejātanissayoti tividho vatthunissayo. Tattha paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthu🔽vipākānaṃ khandhānaṃ vatthusahajātanissayo. Yaṃ pana pavattiyaṃ purejātaṃ, vatthuṃ🔽nissāya cittaṃ uppajjati, taṃ tassa cittassa vatthupurejātanissayonāma. Yaṃ pana🔽purejātaṃ vatthu yassa cittassa nissayoceva hoti ārammaṇañca, taṃ tassa vatthārammaṇa
analyzed: vattha ārammaṇa purejāta nissayo ti tividhaḥ vatthu nissayo tattha paṭisandhi khaṇe vatthu  vipākānam khandhānam vatthu sahajāta nissayaḥ yam pana pavattiyam purejātam vatthuṃ  nissāya cittam uppajjati tam tassa cittassa vatthu purejāta nissayaḥ nāma yam pana  purejātam vatthu yassa cittassa nissayo ca iva hoti ārammaṇam ca tam tassa
translated: The six bases are the seven kinds of consciousnesses. Herein, the object-base is threefold, namely, object-base as conascent, object-base as prenascent, and object-base as object-prenascent.🔽Herein, at the moment of rebirth-linking the object-base as conascent is the object-base of the resultant aggregates.🔽But that which is prenascent in the course of an existence and is the object-base of consciousness that arises in dependence on it is called the object-base as prenascent.

original: purejātanissayonāma. Vuttañhetaṃ paṭṭhāne ārammaṇa nissaya purejātavippayutta atthiavigatanti
analyzed: purejāta nissayaḥ nāma vuttam ha etam paṭṭhāne ārammaṇa nissaya purejāta vippayutta atthi avigata nti
translated: And that which is prenascent and is both the object-base and object of a consciousness is called the object-base as object-prenascent.🔽For this is said in the Paṭṭhāna: “With respect to the object-base, the prenascent, the dissociate, the existent, the unceased, there is a condition, as object-condition” .

original: tīṇīti. Kathañca taṃ cittassa nissayoca ārammaṇañca hotīti. Paccuppannaṃ vatthuṃ🔽ārabbha sammasanavasenavā assādanādivasenavā iddhividhakiccādhiṭṭhānavasenavā cittaṃ
analyzed: tīṇi iti kathaṃ ca tam cittassa nissayo ca ārammaṇañca hoti iti paccuppannam vatthum 🔽ārabbha sammasana vasena vā assādana ādi vasena vā iddhividha kicca adhiṭṭhāna vasena vā cittam
translated: How is it both the object-base and object? It is the object-base of a consciousness that arises🔽in dependence on it, and it is its object by being the cause of its apprehension of an object.

original: uppajjati, evaṃ taṃ cittassa nissayoca ārammaṇañca hotīti. Vuttañhetaṃ paṭṭhāne-ajjhattaṃ🔽vatthuṃ aniccato dukkhato vipassati, assādeti. Abhinandati. Taṃ ārabbha rāgo uppajjati,
analyzed: uppajjati evam tam cittassa nissayaḥ ca ārammaṇam ca hoti iti vuttam ha etam paṭṭhāne ajjhattam  vatthum aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ vipassati assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha rāgaḥ uppajjati
translated: and it is the support and object of that consciousness. For this is said in the Paṭṭhāna: “When one contemplates as impermanent, painful, not-self, the internal base, he relishes it, delights in it, welcomes it, and remains cleaving to it. Lust arises in him.🔽

original: diṭṭhi uppajjati, vicikicchā uppajjati, uddhaccaṃ uppajjati. Domanassaṃ uppajjatīti.
analyzed: diṭṭhi uppajjati vicikicchā uppajjati uddhaccam uppajjati domanassam uppajjati iti
translated: and it arises, then it is the support and object of that consciousness. For this is said in the Paṭṭhāna: “When he contemplates as impermanent, as painful, as not-self, internally in himself the materiality aggregate that is present … he relishes it, he delights in it, he grasps it … and then greed arises … view … uncertainty … agitation … grief” .

original: Ettha pana ācariyā imaṃ vatthārammaṇapurejātanissayaṃnāma maraṇāsannakāleeva vācanāmaggaṃ
analyzed: ettha pana ācariyāḥ imam vattha ārammaṇa purejāta nissayam nāma maraṇa āsanna kāle eva vācanā maggaṃ
translated: Here the teachers have taken this object-condition that is prior to the occurrence of the consciousness to be the meaning of the words “he relishes it, he delights in it, he grasps it” .

original: āropayiṃsu. Ayaṃpanettha tesaṃ adhippāyo. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ tāva aniṭṭhe ṭhāne āvajjanena🔽vinā vīthicittānaṃ pavatti paṭisiddhā hoti. Tathā ekāvajjanavīthi yañca cittānaṃ
analyzed: āropayiṃsu ayam pana ittha tesam adhippāyaḥ aṭṭhakathā ayam tāva aniṭṭhe ṭhāne āvajjanena  vinā vīthi cittānam pavatti paṭisiddhā hoti tathā eka āvajjana vīthi yat ca
translated: This is their intention: in the first place, in the text of the commentary, the occurrence of the consciousnesses without adverting is prohibited in the case of an undesirable object.🔽And the teachers of the commentary want the object of the consciousnesses in a single adverting to be undifferentiated as to state and time.

original: ārammaṇaṃnāma dhammatoca kālatoca abhinnameva icchanti aṭṭhakathācariyā. Pakatikāleca
analyzed: ārammaṇam nāma dhammato ca kālatoca abhinnam eva icchanti aṭṭhakathā cariyā pakati kāle ca
translated: And at the normal time the consciousnesses have their own individual physical basis as support.

original: cittānināma pacceka vatthunissayāni honti. Tasmā yadā paccuppannaṃ ajjhattaṃ vatthuṃ
analyzed: honti tasmā yadā paccuppannam ajjhattam vatthum
translated: So when the present internal materiality aggregate is the object,

original: ārabbhaaniccādivasena sammasanti, etaṃ mamātivā assādenti, tadāyaṃ vatthu āvajjitaṃ
analyzed: ārabbha anicca ādi vasena sammasanti etam mama ativā assādenti tadā ayam vatthu āvajjitam
translated: They do not apprehend the object as “mine” or as “pleasant.” So the object is apprehended by the preliminary-work consciousness.

original: hoti. Javanānipi tadeva gaṇhanti. Na attano attano nissayavatthūni. Yadi hi tānivā
analyzed: tat eva gaṇhanti na attanaḥ attanaḥ nissaya vatthūni yadi hi
translated: The impulsion consciousnesses also take that same object, not their own individual objects. For if they took a different object,

original: aññaṃvā ārammaṇaṃ gaṇheyyuṃ. Nirāvajjanānināma javanāni honti. Kasmā, āvajjanena🔽āvajjitaṃ agahetvā aññaṃ gahetvā pavattanatoti. Bhinnā rammaṇānicanāma honti. Pacchā
analyzed: aññam vā ārammaṇam gaṇheyyum javanāni honti kasmai āvajjanena  āvajjitam a gahetvā aññam gahetvā pavattanato ti bhinnāḥ honti pacchā
translated: they would be called “non-preliminary-work consciousnesses.” Why? Because they occur without apprehending the object apprehended by the preliminary-work consciousness.

original: uppannāni paccekavatthūnivā aññaṃvā gahetvā pavattanatoti. Naca tathā sakkā bhavituṃ
analyzed: uppannāni pacceka vatthūni vā aññam vā gahetvā pavattanato ti na ca tathā sakkā bhavitum
translated: They would be called “different-object consciousnesses” because they occur taking a different object, either a separate object or another of the same object. But that cannot be,

original: aṭṭhakathā virodhato. Tasmā so vatthārammaṇa purejātapaccayo pakati kāle na sakkā🔽laddhunti. Maraṇāsannakāle pana sabbāni āvajjanādīni cittāni ekameva vatthuṃ nissāya
analyzed: aṭṭhakathā virodhato tasmā so kāle na sakkā  laddhum ti maraṇa āsanna kāle pana sabbāni āvajjana ādīni cittāni ekam eva vatthum nissāya
translated: because it would contradict the commentaries. Therefore it is not possible to take the object of the preliminary-work consciousness as a condition by way of decisive-support condition in the normal state.

original: pavattantīti taṃ ārabbha pavattānaṃ āvajjanādīnaṃ tesaṃ tadeva vatthuca ārammaṇañca
analyzed: pavattanti iti tam ārabbha pavattānam āvajjana ādīnam tesam tat eva vatthu ca ārammaṇam ca
translated: But at the time of death all the consciousnesses beginning with the preliminary-work consciousness occur taking as their support the same object. So the object of the preliminary-work consciousness is the object of the consciousnesses beginning with the impulsion consciousness that occur in dependence on it.

original: hoti. Evañhi sati tesaṃ nirāvajjanatāvā bhinnārammaṇatāvā natthīti ayaṃ tesaṃ adhippāyoti.🔽Tattha pana yadi āvajjanena āvajjitaṃ vatthuṃ agahetvā attano attano nissayavatthūni
analyzed: hoti evam hi sati tesam nirāvajjana tāvā bhinna ārammaṇa tāvā natthi iti ayam tesam adhippāyaḥ ti  tattha pana yadi āvajjanena āvajjitam vatthum a gahetvā attanaḥ attanaḥ nissaya vatthūni
translated: For if it were so, then there would be no difference between them in respect of non-preoccupation and in respect of different objects. This is the purport.

original: gaṇheyyuṃ. Nirāvajjanānināma javanāni bhaveyyunti idaṃ tāva na yujjati. Āvajjanena🔽āvajji tappakārasseva gahaṇato. Yathā hi āvajjanaṃpi vatthuntveva āvajjati. Tathā
analyzed: gaṇheyyum javanāni idam tāva na yujjati āvajjanena  tad pakārassa iva gahaṇataḥ yathā hi āvajjanam pi vatthum tu eva āvajjati tathā
translated: Herein, if they were to apprehend their own respective physical bases without apprehending the object that is apprehended by the adverting, then the impulsions would be called “non-preoccupied” . This is not right, because the object that is apprehended by the adverting is apprehended by the impulsions too,

original: javanānica vatthuntveva javanti. No aññathāti natthi javanānaṃ nirāvajjanatāti. Yathā🔽ca nirāvajjanatā natthi, tathā bhinnārammaṇatāpi tesaṃ natthiyeva. Kasmā, vibhāgassa
analyzed: javanāni ca vatthuntu eva javanti no aññathā ati natthi javanānam nirāvajjana tā ati yathā  ca nirāvajjana tā natthi tathā bhinna ārammaṇa tā api tesam kasmā vibhāgassa
translated: just as it is by the adverting. For just as the adverting adverts to the object that is present, so too the impulsions impel only the object that is present. They do not impel otherwise. So there is no non-preoccupation of the impulsions.

original: asambhavato. Nahi santatighanavasena ekībhūtamiva pubbāparaṃ pavatta mānesu bahūsu🔽vatthusu ekamekaṃ vatthuṃ idamevāti visuṃ katvā āvajjanaṃvājavanānivā gahetuṃ sakkonti.
analyzed: asambhavataḥ nahi santati ghana vasena ekībhūtam iva pubba aparam mānesu bahūsu 🔽vatthusu ekam ekam vatthum idam eva ati visum katvā āvajjanam vā ajavanāni vā gahetum sakkonti
translated: And just as there is no non-preoccupation, so too there is no difference in their objects. Why? Because there is no division. For the many impulsions that occur in succession, which are as it were one because of the compactness of the continuum, are unable to advert to or impel the object separately, thinking, “This is the object.”

original: Naca tathā asakkuṇeyyesu ṭhānesu ekantena dhammatovā kālatovā bhinnā rammaṇatānāma
analyzed: na ca tathā a sakkuṇeyyesu ṭhānesu ekantena dhammataḥ vā kālataḥ vā bhinnā rammaṇa tā nāma
translated: And in the case of what cannot be done in this way, they are not called ‘beautiful’ either by nature or by convention,

original: sakkā laddhunti iti bhinnārammaṇatāpi tesaṃ natthi yevāti. Ettāvatā imassa vatthārammaṇapurejātanissaya🔽vidhānassa pakatikālepi labbhamānatā sādhitā hotīti.
analyzed: sakkā laddhunti iti bhinna ārammaṇa tā api tesam natthi yeva ati ettāvatā imassa  vidhānassa pakati kāle pi labbhamāna tā sādhitā hoti iti
translated: so they have no beautifulness either. So far it has been established that this method of determining the object condition, etc., is applicable also at the time of the normal mode of cognitive series.

original: Apica, sabbaṃ paccuppannaṃ attano rūpakāyaṃ ārabbha rūpaṃ me aniccantivā etaṃ mamātivā
analyzed: apica sabbam paccuppannam attanaḥ rūpa kāyam ārabbha rūpam me etam mama ativā
translated: Moreover, it is not possible to say of those who regard their own visible-data body as present, referring to it as ‘my visible form is impermanent’ or ‘this is mine,’

original: samanupassantānaṃ ajjhattarūpesu idaṃ nāmarūpaṃ tassacittassa ārammaṇaṃ nahotīti🔽navattabbaṃ. Ārammaṇa bhūtesu pana tesu kiñci ārammaṇamattaṃ kiñci ārammaṇapurejātaṃ
analyzed: samanupassantānam ajjhatta rūpesu idam nāma rūpam tassa cittassa ārammaṇam nahoti iti  ārammaṇa bhūtesu pana tesu kiñci ārammaṇa mattam kiñci ārammaṇa purejātam
translated: that the visible data in their own bodies are not the object of their consciousness.🔽But it is possible to say that among those visible data that are objects, some are merely objects, some are object-predominant,

original: kiñci vatthārammaṇapurejātaṃ hotīti sakkā vattunti. Kabaḷī kāro āhāroti kāmāvacarasattānaṃ
analyzed: kiñci vattha ārammaṇa purejātam hoti iti sakkā vattum ti kabaḷī kāro āhāro ti kāmāvacara sattānam
translated: and some are object-predominant-prenascent.

original: paṭisandhito paṭṭhāya uppanno catusamuṭṭhānika rūpāhāroceva bahiddhāhāroca. Gabbhaseyyakānañhi
analyzed: paṭisandhitaḥ paṭṭhāya uppanno gabbhaseyyakānam hi
translated: ‘Physical nutriment’ is the material food consisting of the four primary elements and derived from what is born from nutriment, which has arisen in beings of the sense sphere🔽since the moment of rebirth-linking. It is also called ‘external nutriment.’ For those who lie in the womb,

original: yāva mātuyā āhārapharaṇaṃ nalabbhati, tāva kalalādikālesu tisamuṭṭhāniko ajjhattāhāroyeva
analyzed: yāva mātuyāḥ āhāra pharaṇam na labbhati tāva kalala ādi kālesu ti samuṭṭhānikaḥ ajjhatta āhāraḥ yeva
translated: As long as the mother’s food and drink are not digested, the internal food consisting of nutritive essence, which has three sources,

original: upatthambhanakiccaṃ sādheti. Vuttañhetaṃ paṭṭhāne-paṭisandhikkhaṇe kabaḷīkāro āhāro
analyzed: upatthambhana kiccam sādheti vuttam ha etam paṭṭhāne paṭisandhi khaṇe kabaḷīkāraḥ āhāro
translated: performs the function of supporting the embryo in the stages of the kalala, etc.,

original: imassa kāyassa āhārapaccayena paccayoti, ojaṭṭhamakarūpasamuṭṭhāpanaṃ panassa bahiddhāhārupatthambhanaṃ
analyzed: imassa kāyassa āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ ti ojaṭṭhamaka rūpa samuṭṭhāpanam pana assa bahiddhā āhāra upatthambhanam
translated: as stated in the Paṭṭhāna: “The material food that is eaten is a condition, by the way of nutriment condition, for this body” . But the external food that causes the production of the materiality consisting of nutritive essence🔽should be regarded as supporting the embryo only after it has been swallowed.

original: laddhakāleyevāti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Yadievaṃ –
analyzed: daṭṭhabbam yadi evam
translated: For it is said:

original: Yañcassa bhuñjati mātā, annaṃ pānañca bhojanaṃ. Tena so tattha yāpeti, mātukucchigato tiroti
analyzed: yat ca assa bhuñjati mātā annam pānam ca bhojanam tena saḥ tattha yāpeti mātukucchi gataḥ tiroti
translated: “Whatever food and drink his mother takes, Thereby he subsists there in the mother’s womb” .🔽Why is it said? In order to make the ghost understand by means of obvious food.

original: Kasmā vuttanti. Pākaṭāhārena tassa yakkhassa bodhanatthanti. Imassakāyassāti gabbhaseyyakānaṃ🔽tāva paṭisandhicittassa uppādakkhaṇe ekasamuṭṭhānikassa ṭhitibhaṅgakkhaṇesu dvisamuṭṭhāni
analyzed: kasmā vuttanti pākaṭa āhārena tassa yakkhassa bodhana atthanti imassa kāyassa ati gabbhaseyyakānam  tāva paṭisandhi cittassa uppāda khaṇe eka samuṭṭhānikassa ṭhiti bhaṅga kkhaṇesu dvi samuṭṭhāni
translated: “This body”: of those who lie in the womb,

original: kassa tatoparaṃ tisamuṭṭhānikassa ojāpharaṇakāle catusamuṭṭhānikassaca kāyassa. Itaresaṃpi
analyzed: kassa tatas uparam ti samuṭṭhānikassa ojā pharaṇa kāle catu samuṭṭhānikassa ca kāyassa itaresam pi
translated: the body consisting of one source at the moment of arising of the rebirth-linking consciousness, consisting of two sources at the moments of its duration, consisting of three sources at the moment of the descent of nutritive essence, and consisting of four sources thereafter.

original: yathāsambhavaṃ vattabbaṃ. Rūpaloke pana vināpi duvidhena ojāhārakiccena appanāpatta
analyzed: yathāsambhavam vattabbam rūpa loke pana vinā api duvidhena ojā āhāra kiccena

original: kammavisesena siddhassa suciraṃpi addhānaṃ pharituṃ samatthassa rūpa jīvitindriyassa🔽tathārūpānañca bhavaṅgapariyāpannānaṃ arūpāhārānaṃ vasena anekakappānipi attabhāvassa🔽pavatti veditabbā. Etenupāyena kammajakāyabahutaresu devesu petanirayesuca suciraṃpi
analyzed: kamma visesena siddhassa su ciram pi addhānam pharitum samatthassa jīvita indriyassa  tathārūpānam ca bhavaṅga pariyāpannānam arūpa āhārānam vasena aneka kappāni pi atta bhāvassa  pavatti veditabbā etena upāyena kamma ja kāya bahutaresu devesu peta nirayesu ca
translated: and it should be said in the way appropriate to each case. But in the fine-material sphere, the occurrence of the material life faculty, which is accomplished by the special kamma of the attainment and is capable of persisting for a long period without the function of nutriment in its twofold sense of nutriment and of energy,🔽and also of the immaterial nutriment comprised in the life-continuum, can be understood to last for many world-cycles.🔽And by this means it should be said that the occurrence of the materiality of the individual existence of the gods of the various kinds of generated bodies lasts for a long time without external nutriment.

analyzed: labbhatiyā iva ati kiñcā api okkanti khaṇe vipāka khandhā api vatthussa vippayutta paccayā  honti te pana citta cetasikā dhammā ettha saṅgayhissanti iti katvā
translated: And although at the moment of descent the resultant aggregates are a condition by way of state condition for the materiality of the basis,🔽nevertheless, since those states consisting of consciousness and its concomitants will be included in the clause “at the moment of descent, the materiality of the basis and the resultant,”

original: okkantikkhaṇevatthuvipākānanti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: okkanti khaṇe vatthu vipākānam ti vuttam

analyzed: sabbathā ti sabba pakāram sahajāta nti ādinā yojetabbam tividhaḥ hoti sahajāta paccayaḥ iti ādi vasena

original: veditabbo. Rūpajīvitamiccayanti evaṃ porāṇehi vutto ayaṃ atthipaccayo avigatapaccayocāti
analyzed: veditabbaḥ evam porāṇehi vuttaḥ ayam atthi paccayaḥ avigata paccayaḥ ca ati

original: yojetabbaṃ. Nanu kabaḷīkārāhāro rūpajīvitindriyañca sahajāte saṅgahetabbaṃ. Evañhi
analyzed: yojetabbam nanu kabaḷīkāra āhāraḥ rūpa jīvita indriyam ca sahajāte saṅgahetabbam evam hi

original: sati tividhova atthipaccayo siyāti.Na. Sahajananasaṅkhātassa sahuppādanalakkhaṇassa
analyzed: sati tividhaḥ va atthi paccayo siyā tina saha janana saṅkhātassa sahuppādana lakkhaṇassa
translated: No. Because there is no such characteristic of conascence as “being born together.”

original: abhāvā. Sahuppādanalakkhaṇo hi sahajātapaccayo. Kabaḷīkārāhāroca ojaṭṭhamakarūpāni🔽uppādentopi attano ṭhitikkhaṇeeva uppādeti, no uppādakkhaṇe. Yathāca mahābhūtā sahajātarūpāni
analyzed: abhāvā sahuppādana lakkhaṇaḥ hi sahajāta paccayaḥ kabaḷīkāra āhāra ucaḥ oja ṭṭha maka rūpāni  uppādentaḥ api attanaḥ ṭhiti khaṇe eva uppādeti no uppāda kkhaṇe yathā ca mahābhūtā sahajāta rūpāni
translated: For the conascence condition has the characteristic of “being born together.” And although physical nutriment and the material phenomena of the octad of physical nutriment are born together,🔽physical nutriment only causes the octad to be born at the moment of its own presence, not at the moment of its arising.

original: upatthambhantā attanā saha uppādanapubbakāeva upatthambhanti, na tathā so āhāro.
analyzed: upatthambhantā attanā saha uppādana pubbakā eva upatthambhanti na tathā saḥ āhāro
translated: And just as the great primaries, while supporting the conascent material phenomena, support them only after being born together with them, not otherwise, so too physical nutriment does not.

original: So pana vināva sahuppādanakiccena sahajātānipi asahajātānipi upatthambhatīti rūpajīvitaṃpi🔽saha uppādanakiccena vināva saha jātarūpāni anupāleti. Iti ime dvepi dhammā sahajāta
analyzed: saḥ pana vinā āva sahuppādana kiccena sahajātāni api asahajātāni api upatthambhati iti rūpa jīvitaṃpi  saha uppādana kiccena saha jātarūpāni anupāleti iti ime dve api dhammā sahajāta
translated: But that, without the function of co-arising, supports what is conascent and what is not conascent. analyzed: lakkhaṇa abhāvā eva sahajāta paccaye asaṅgahitāḥ idāni sabbe pi catuvīsati paccayā saṅgayhamānā

analyzed: cattāro paccayāḥ honti iti dassetum gacchanti iti vuttam
translated: they are four conditions, it is said.

analyzed: tatra ayam catuvīsatiyā paccayesu adhipati paccayo duvidhaḥ ārammaṇa sahajāta vasena

analyzed: tattha ārammaṇa adhipati tīsu kammavajjesu samodhānam gacchati hi  kammena saha samodhānam na gacchati kutas
translated: Herein, object-predominance is combined with the three kinds of kamma-condition. For object-predominance is not combined with kamma even as object,🔽let alone as a condition of predominance.

analyzed: paṭisandhi bhavaṅga cutiyaḥ honti iti saccam ettha pana mūla ṭīkāyam kammam pana tasmin  kate pavattamānānam kata upacita bhāvena kamma paccayaḥ hoti na ārammaṇa ākārena visaya  matta tā vasena ca ārammaṇa paccayaḥ hoti na santāna visesanam katvā phala uppādana saṅkhātena  kamma paccaya ākārena tasmā te paccaya ākāra visabhāga ttā saha ghaṭanam na gacchanti iti
translated: and rebirth-linking, life-continuum, and death are present. That is true. It is not by way of distinguishing the continuity and by way of the mode of conditionality consisting in producing the result. Therefore, because of the difference in the modes of conditionality, they do not occur together.”🔽🔽

original: visajjitanti. Sahajātādhipati pana atthipaccaye. Nissayapaccayo tividho sahajāto🔽vatthupurejāto vatthārammaṇapurejātoti. Tattha vatthupurejāto
analyzed: visajjitanti sahajāta adhipati pana atthi paccaye nissaya paccayo tividhaḥ sahajātaḥ 🔽vatthu purejātaḥ vattha ārammaṇa purejāto ti tattha purimā dve atthi paccaye pacchimo 🔽pana dvīsu ārammaṇa atthi paccayesu saḥ ce garukataḥ hoti upanissaye pi iti purejāta paccayo 🔽tividhaḥ ārammaṇa pure jātaḥ vatthu pure jātaḥ vattha ārammaṇa pure jātaḥ ti tattha vatthu pure jātaḥ
translated: and rebirth-linking, life-continuum, and death are. True. But here in the Root Commentary it is said: “The kamma is a condition for the states occurring when it has been done by way of its being stored up, not by way of object. And it is a condition by way of object by way of mere object, not by way of distinguishing the continuity and by way of producing the fruit called kamma condition. Therefore, because of the difference in the modes of conditionality, they do not coincide, and so they are distinguished. But there is conascence, predominance, and presence condition. Support condition is threefold: conascence, prenascence, and prenascence as object. Herein, the first two are presence condition, but the last is in two of the object conditions. If it is weighty, it is also a decisive support condition. Preceding condition is threefold: preceding as object, preceding as physical basis, and preceding as object and physical basis. Herein, that which is preceding as physical basis is a condition by way of support for the states that arise in the physical basis. That which is preceding as object is a condition by way of object for the states that arise in the physical basis. That which is preceding as object and physical basis is a condition by way of object and by way of support for the states that arise in the physical basis. That which is preceding as object and physical basis is a condition by way of object and by way of support for the states that arise in the physical basis.

original: atthipaccaye. Itare dve dvīsu ārammaṇatthipaccayesu. Tece garukatā honti. Upanissayepīti.

analyzed: kamma paccayaḥ duvidhaḥ sahajātaḥ nānākkhaṇikaḥ ti tattha sahajātaḥ atthi paccaye nānākkhaṇikaḥ  pana duvidhaḥ balavā dubbalaḥ ca tattha ca balavā duvidhaḥ akāliko kāliko ca tad ubhayā api

original: bhijjissatha. Itthatthāyāti īdisassa attabhāvassa atthāyāti attho. Vuddhiṃ viruḷhiṃ🔽vepullanti pathamavayavasena vuddhiṃ. Majjhimavayavasena viruḷhiṃ. Pacchimavayavasena
analyzed: bhijjissatha itthatthāya ati īdisassa atta bhāvassa atthāya ati attho vuddhim viruḷhim  vepullanti pathama vayavasena vuddhim majjhima vayavasena viruḷhim pacchima vayavasena
translated: Herein, you will grow means you will increase. For material form is the increase of consciousness. You will break up means you will be destroyed. For the sake of this means for the sake of this kind of selfhood. Growth, increase,

original: vepullanti aṭṭhakathāyaṃ vuttaṃ. Tasmā paṭisandhikkhaṇe rūpuppattiyā ekantena viññāṇapaccayatā🔽veditabbā. Evaṃ uppannañca panetaṃ paṭisandhirūpaṃ puna sayaṃ tasmiṃ bhave yāva cutiyā
analyzed: vepullam ti aṭṭhakathāyam vuttam tasmā paṭisandhi khaṇe rūpa uppattiyāḥ ekantena viññāṇa paccaya tā  veditabbā evam uppannam ca pana itam paṭisandhi rūpam puna sayam tasmin bhave yāva cutiyā
translated: and abundance: growth is by the first part, increase is by the middle part, and abundance is by the last part. So it is said in the commentary. Therefore it should be understood that the sole condition for the arising of material form at the moment of rebirth-linking is consciousness.

original: pavattamānānaṃ sabbāsaṃ catusamuṭṭhānikarūpasantatīnaṃ sita bhūtaṃ bījabhūtañca hoti.
analyzed: pavattamānānam sabbāsam catu samuṭṭhānika rūpa santatīnam sita bhūtam bīja bhūtañca hoti
translated: And this material form that has arisen is the seed and the source for all the processes of material form with fourfold origination that occur in that becoming until death.

original: Atibalavantaṃpi hi cittaṃ purimuppannāya rūpapaveṇiyā asati rūpaṃ janetuṃ nasakkoti.
analyzed: ati balavantam pi hi cittam purima uppannāya rūpa paveṇiyāḥ asati rūpam janetum na sakkoti
translated: For even a very powerful consciousness cannot produce material form if there is no continuity of material form already arisen.

original: Evaṃ utu āhārāpīti. Tatoyeva hi arūpabhave kāmāvacarādīni rūpajanakacittānipi tattha
analyzed: evam hi arūpa bhave kāmāvacara ādīni rūpa janaka cittāni api
translated: So too with temperature and with kamma. For in the immaterial world, too, the kinds of consciousness belonging to the sense sphere, etc., that produce material form are not able to do so there.

original: rūpaṃ najanentīti. Asaññasattepi utu samuṭṭhānarūpasantatiyo pathamuppannāya kammajarūpasantatiyā
analyzed: rūpam na janenti iti asañña satte pi pathama uppannāya kamma ja rūpa santatiyā
translated: and the materiality of the immaterial-state beings is not generated.

original: vijja mānattāeva uppajjantīti. Vuttañhi vibhaṅgaṭīkāyaṃ arūpaṃ pana rūpassa okāso
analyzed: uppajjanti iti vuttam hi vibhaṅga ṭīkāyam arūpam pana rūpassa okāsaḥ
translated: The materiality of the immaterial-state beings is generated, however, by the materiality of the kind that is originated by temperature, which is the first to arise in the continuity.🔽For it is said in the Vibhaṅga Commentary: “But the immaterial does not serve as a condition for the material.

original: na hotīti yasmiṃ rūpe sati cittaṃ aññaṃ rūpaṃ uppādeyya. Tadeva tattha natthīti attho.
analyzed: na hoti iti yasmin rūpe sati cittam aññam rūpam uppādeyya tat eva tattha natthi iti attho
translated: What is meant is that there is no materiality that could cause the mind to generate other materiality.

original: Purimarūpassāpi hi paccayabhāvo atthi puttassa pitisadisatādassanatoti. Etthaca puttassa🔽pitisadisatādassanatoti etena imamatthaṃ dasseti. Yathā tiṇarukkhānaṃ bījabhāvasaṅkhātaṃ
analyzed: purima rūpassa api hi paccaya bhāvaḥ atthi puttassa ettha ca puttassa  piti sadisa tā dassanato ti etena imam attham dasseti yathā tiṇa rukkhānam bīja bhāva saṅkhātam
translated: For the first materiality has the function of a condition, as is shown by the case of the son’s resemblance to his father” .🔽And here the meaning of the words “as is shown by the case of the son’s resemblance to his father” is this.🔽Just as there is a kind of materiality called “seed” in grasses and trees,

original: niyāmarūpaṃnāma atthi. Yassa ānubhāvena tannibbattātiṇarukkhā vaḍḍhantā yathāvā tathāvā
analyzed: atthi yassa ānubhāvena vaḍḍhantā yathāvā tathāvā
translated: by the power of which the grasses and trees grow, and just as they grow either in the same way or in a different way,

original: avaḍḍhitvāattanā samānabījehieva tiṇarukkhehi sabbaso sadisā kāraṃ gahetvā vaḍḍhanti.
analyzed: a vaḍḍhitvā attanā samāna bījehi eva tiṇa rukkhehi sabbaso sadisā kāram gahetvā vaḍḍhanti
translated: and having grown, they take on the appearance of the seed, and they grow by means of grasses and trees of the same kind as themselves,

original: Evamevaṃ gabbhaseyyakānaṃ sattānaṃ yoni bhāvasaṅkhātaṃ niyāma rūpaṃnāma atthi. Yassānubhāvena
analyzed: evam evam gabbhaseyyakānam sattānam yoni bhāva saṅkhātam niyāma rūpaṃnāma atthi yassa anubhāvena
translated: So too, there is a kind of materiality called “destiny” in the case of beings who are to be reborn in a womb.

original: te samāna jātikehieva kulehi visesato mātāpitūhi eva sabbaso sadisarūpasaṇṭhānā honti.
analyzed: te samāna jātikehi eva kulehi visesataḥ mātā pitūhi eva sabbaso sadisa rūpa saṇṭhānāḥ honti
translated: By its influence they are exactly like their parents in their family, which is of the same kind, and they are similar in appearance and shape.

original: Iti bījaniyāmo viya yoniniyāmopi hoti. Soca paṭisandhirūpasseva ānubhāvoti veditabbo.
analyzed: iti bīja niyāmaḥ viya yoni niyāmaḥ api hoti saḥ ca paṭisandhi rūpassa iva ānubhāvaḥ ti veditabbo
translated: So the destiny is like the seed. But it should be understood that this is the influence of the rebirth-linking materiality.

original: Apica, ayaṃ yoniniyāmonāma kalalakālādīsu puttānaṃ sarīresu mātāpitūhi samudāgataṃ
analyzed: apica ayam yoniniyāmaḥ nāma kalala kāla ādīsu puttānam sarīresu mātā pitūhi samudāgatam
translated: Moreover, this so-called destiny is a continuity of materiality derived from the primary elements of the parents and present in the bodies of the children in the kalala, etc., stages.

original: utujarūpasantānaṃeva. Yassa ānubhāvena taṃsantānaṃ samānajātikasattasaṇṭhānasadisaṃ🔽attano ñātikulasadisañca hoti. Yathāhiitthibhāvādirūpaṃ sattānaṃ itthiliṅgādīni bījarūpañca
analyzed: utu ja rūpa santānam eva yassa ānubhāvena tat santānam samāna jātika satta saṇṭhāna sadisam  attanaḥ ñāti kula sadisam ca hoti yathā hi itthi bhāva ādi rūpam sattānam itthi liṅga ādīni bīja rūpam ca
translated: By its influence that continuity becomes similar in appearance and shape to the being of the same kind,🔽and it becomes like the family of the parents’ relatives. For just as the materiality of the female sex, etc., in beings, and the materiality of the seed in trees, etc., determine the respective colours, shapes, etc.,

original: tiṇarukkhānaṃ taṃtaṃvaṇṇasaṇṭhānā dīni niyāmeti. Evaṃ yonirūpaṃ nānājātivasena sattānaṃ
analyzed: tiṇa rukkhānam evam yoni rūpam nānā jāti vasena sattānam
translated: so this materiality of the destiny determines the different kinds of beings.

original: niyāmakaṃ vavatthāpakaṃ hotīti. Ettāvatā pavattiyaṃ thapetvā cittajarūpaṃ sabbesaṃ
analyzed: niyāmakam vavatthāpakam hoti iti ettāvatā pavattiyam thapetvā citta ja rūpam sabbesam
translated: So far, with the exception of consciousness-originated materiality, all the kinds of materiality are included in the categories of kamma-born, consciousness-born, and temperature-born.

original: tisamuṭṭhānikarūpānaṃ uppattiyā cittanirapekkhatā purimuppanna rūpapaveṇi paṭibaddhatāca
analyzed: ti samuṭṭhānika rūpānaṃ uppattiyā citta nirapekkha tā purima uppanna rūpa paveṇi paṭibaddha tā ca
translated: The fact that the materiality of the three origins is independent of consciousness and is bound up with the preceding materiality is established.

original: sādhitā hoti. Tenevaca tesaṃ cittassa ṭhitibhaṅgakkhaṇesupi cittarahite nirodhasamāpatti
analyzed: sādhitā hoti tena iva ca tesam cittassa ṭhiti bhaṅga kkhaṇesu pi citta rahite nirodha samāpatti
translated: That is why it occurs even at the moments of the presence and dissolution of consciousness, and even in the attainment of cessation, which is without consciousness.

original: kālepi uppatti hotīti. Tena vuttaṃ sahajātarūpanti panetthātiādi. Itītiādi nigamanaṃ.
analyzed: kāle api uppatti hoti iti tena vuttam sahajāta rūpan ti pana itthā atiādi iti itiādi nigamanam
translated: That is why it is said, “But here ‘conascent materiality’ and so on. ‘Thus’ and so on is the conclusion.

original: Tattha sambhavaṃti yathā sambhavaṃ. Sambhavātivā sambhūtā. Ajjhattañcāti ajjhattabhūtāca.
analyzed: tattha sambhavanti yathā sambhavam sambhavāti vā sambhūtāḥ ajjhattam ca ati ajjhatta bhūtāḥ ca
translated: Herein, “as they occur” is as they come to be. “As they have come to be” is as they have originated. “Internally” is as they are internally.

original: Bahiddhācāti bahiddhābhūtāca. Saṅkhatāti saṅkhatabhūtā. Asaṅkhatāti asaṅkhatabhūtā.
analyzed: bahiddhā ca ati bahiddhā bhūtā ca saṅkhatā ati saṅkhata bhūtā asaṅkhatā ati asaṅkhata bhūtā
translated: “Externally” is as they are externally. “Conditioned” is as they are formed. “Unconditioned” is as they are unformed.

original: Evaṃ tekālikāca kālamuttāca ajjhattabahiddhā sambhūtāca. Tathā saṅkhatāsaṅkhatabhūtāca
analyzed: evam kāla muttāca ajjhatta bahiddhā sambhūtāca tathā saṅkhata asaṅkhata bhūtāca
translated: Thus they are past, future, and present, and they are internal and external, and they are originated, and they are formed and unformed.

original: paññatti nāmarūpānaṃ vasena tividhā ṭhitā dhammā paṭṭhāne sabbathā catuvīsati paccayānāma
analyzed: paññatti nāma rūpānam vasena tividhāḥ ṭhitāḥ dhammāḥ paṭṭhāne sabbathā catuvīsati paccayā nāma
translated: The states that are classed thus in four ways by means of the description of mentality-materiality are all the twenty-four conditions in all aspects.

original: hontīti yojanā. Etthaca tividhā ṭhitānaṃ dhammānaṃ tekālikādibhāve sati catuvīsatipaccayānaṃpi
analyzed: honti iti yojanā ettha ca tividhā ṭhitānam dhammānam tekālika ādi bhāve sati catuvīsati paccayānam pi

original: yathāsambhavaṃ tekālikādibhedo siddho hoti. Tattha ārammaṇaadhipati upanissayapaccayā
analyzed: yathāsambhavam tekālika ādi bhedaḥ siddhaḥ hoti tattha ārammaṇa adhipati upanissaya paccayā
translated: This is the construction. And here, when there are states that are of three kinds, namely, simultaneous, etc., then the twenty-four conditions are established as being of the same kind, etc., according as applies. Herein, the object condition, the predominance condition, and the support condition

analyzed: dhana dhañña bhogānam vā vijjā sippa suta pariyattīnam vā sīla samādhi paññānam vā bhavantare  bhava sampatti bhoga sampatti magga phala sampattīnaṃ vā paṭilābha atthāya pubbayogam karontassa
translated: or when he is acquiring wealth, corn, or property, or when he is acquiring knowledge, craft, children, a wife, or cattle, or when he is acquiring virtue, concentration, or understanding,🔽or when he is acquiring in the future the excellence of a happy destiny, the excellence of wealth, and the excellence of the path and fruit, then the condition by way of decisive support should be understood in the future for those things.

analyzed: patthayamāno sota ghāna jivhā kāya sampadam vaṇṇa sampadam sadda gandha rasa  phoṭṭhabba sampadam patthayamānaḥ anāgate khandhe patthayamānaḥ dānam deti sīlam samādiyati itiādinā  bhava antara pariyāpannāḥ eva sampattiyaḥ vuttā tāḥ pana dāna ādīnam kammānam anurūpa vasena
